loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 43-year-old married woman. A mother of one school-aged child, she has established a mini-supermarket in Lebanon. She has owned her small grocery store since 2005. Her mini-market is situated in a busy area so she was able to gain a good number of clients passing by her shop during this period.  Today, she is requesting to borrow US$ 1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase her store’s inventory. In the future, she expects that her business will continue to grow. 

It is very common in Lebanon to find small supermarkets selling perishable and non-perishable goods. As members of the communities themselves, store owners have a deep understanding of local consumer needs and can offer products that meet local demand. The strong network of community relationships are an important component of life in Lebanon, especially in smaller towns and villages.

loans.use: to increase her store’s inventory

loans.name: Mohamed Jayah

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Mohamed Jayah.  He is married and has eight children aged 25, 22, 19, 17, 10, 8, 5, and 3. He has 10 additional dependents, who live with him because all are family members, part of his own assistance to his family. 

 In 1990, Mohamed Jayah established his palm oil and 'gari' (processed cassava) business. He began his business because he wanted to be self-reliant. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 1,981,200SLL every month from this business. He needs a loan of 4,500,000 SLL. 

Mohamed Jayah has already received and successfully repaid two loans and now requires a new loan in order to buy palm oil and 'gari'. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 396,240 SLL. In the future, Mohamed Jayah plans to have an agent to be buying large quantities so that he can export his goods, and he would love to have an additional house for his children.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy additional palm oil and 'gari'

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy additional cosmetics

loans.name: Wellingtone

texts.en: Wellingtone is a married man with three children.  He owns and runs a barber shop to make a living.  Most of his customers are the people of his local area.  Besides running his business, he is employed as a technician in a company that manufactures sweets.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has become more focused in his business.  He has requested 20,000 Kes to buy a shaving machine and an electric heater.

loans.use: To buy a shaving machine and an electric heater

loans.name: Jose Domingo

texts.es:
Jose Domingo A. se mudo a la ciudad de Cochabamba hace más de 10 años de Argentina, en busca de terminar su carrera y poder conseguir trabajo. Jose no tiene esposa ni hijos, y se dedica 100% a su trabajo.

Jose logro terminar de estudiar a nivel Técnico Superior y trabaja  en la empresa DIMACO TRADING SRL “la casa de las calaminas”  (calaminas es un tipo de techo de metal) por más de 3 años. Según su jefe y sus compañeros de trabajo Jose es una persona sumamente responsable y confiable. Jose requiere de este préstamo para poder comprar metal y poder hacer calaminas y venderlas ya que conoce del negocio quiere comenzar su propia microempresa. 

Jose nos cuenta que su mayor sueño es poder en un futuro tener una empresa de Calaminas tan grande como en la que trabaja actualmente.
texts.en:
Jose Domingo A. moved from Argentina to the city of Cochabamba more than 10 years ago in search of finishing his degree and being able to continue working. Jose does not have a wife or children and he dedicates himself 100% to his work.

Jose finished studying at a technical college and has worked at Dimaco Trading Ltd., La Casa de las Calaminas (‘calaminas’ is a type of metal roof) for more than 3 years. According to his boss and co-workers, Jose is a very responsible and trustworthy person. Jose needs this loan to be able to buy metal, make calaminas, and sell them because now that he knows the business, he wants to start his own small business.

Jose tells us that his biggest dream for the future is to have a calaminas business that is as big as the one where he currently works.

loans.use: Investment capital

loans.name: Virgen De Rosario Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO  esta compuesta por tres integrantes  2 mujeres  y un varón El  representante del grupo es el Sr. Teófilo, se dedican a la venta D. carbón le entregan por mayor y el venD. al por mayor o menor, el dinero del crédito será para la compra D. carbón por carga ya que pronto le entregaran una buena cantidad,  las Sras. Viven en Colomi  a unos 45 minutos D. sacaba sus puestos D. venta son céntricos cerca D. la plaza principal, es un grupo D. amigos se conocen  D.  hace muchos años ,son muy conocidos en la zona   por ser personas muy responsables y trabajadoras, el préstamo lo destinaran para su mercadería y aumentar capital.
texts.en:
The solidarity group "Virgen del Rosario" [Virgin of the Rosary] is maD. up of three members, two women and one man. The group's representative is Teófilo who sells charcoal. It is delivered to him wholesale and he sells it wholesale or retail. The money from the loan will be for the purchase of a load of charcoal since he will have a large quantity delivered to him soon. 

The women live in Colomi about 45 minutes from Sacaba. Their points of sale are centrally located near the main plaza. They are a group of friends who have known each other for many years. They are well-known in the area for being responsible and hard-working people. The loan will be used for their merchandise and to increase capital.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Marlyn Isabel

texts.es:
Marlyn B., vive en Prado Mar, un lugar turístico ubicado en el municipio de Puerto Colombia en el Caribe Colombiano, con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 13 y 19 años. 
Ella su cónyuge y su hijo mayor preparan los ya famosos congelados entre los que se destacan los deditos empanaditas, carimañolas que empacan en bandejas y salen a venderlos diariamente en hogares del municipio de Puerto Colombia y un corregimiento llamado Salgar muy cercano y también a orillas del mar. Así mismo tiene un kiosco ubicado en el estadio de beisbol en el que venden refrescos y refrigerios que incluyen las delicias que ellos mismos preparan.
Este es su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y planean la compra de harina de trigo, maíz, margarina y otros insumos para la fabricación de deditos empanadas, arepas, pastelitos  y  bebidas en mayor volumen para surtir su kiosco en el estadio de beisbol en este mismo municipio aprovechando la época en que más se práctica este deporte, con esta inversión logrará aumentar su capital de trabajo y fortalecer sus utilidades en las temporadas en que por el repunte de las ventas hay mayor efectividad en esta inyección de capital.
Con el producto de su negocio, Marlyn ha logrado en los estudios de Contaduría pública en una universidad privada en la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde  él viaja diariamente a recibir sus clases y justamente este es uno de sus sueños como madre :  lograr que sea un profesional exitoso.
Su mayor desafío es el acondicionamiento locativo del negocio,  para mejorar el proceso productivo de sus alimentos y generar productos destacados por su calidad.
texts.en:
Marlyn B. lives in Prado Mar, a tourist area of Puerto Colombia, on the Colombian Caribbean coast, with her spouse and two children who are 13 and 19 years old.

She, her spouse and her oldest son prepare delicious traditional pastries that they pack on trays and go out daily to sell door-to-door in Puerto Colombia and in a nearby settlement, Salgar, also on the seashore.  She also has a kiosk at the baseball stadium where she sells beverages and snacks including the delicious items they themselves make.

This is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo which will be used to buy wheat flour, corn, margarine and other ingredients to make pastries like: deditos, empanadas, arepas and cupcakes and to buy beverages in bulk to stock the kiosk at the baseball stadium.  This investment will increase working capital and improve profits during seasons when sales increase and the capital investment are more efficient.

Profits from her business have made it possible for Marlin to pay for her son to study Public Accounting at a private university in Barranquilla where he travels daily to attend classes.  This is precisely one of her dreams as a mother: to see him become a successful professional.

Her greatest challenge is to improve the physical conditions of her business so that the productive process of the foods is improved thus making them stand out for their quality.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, corn, margarine and other ingredients to prepare pastries and to buy larger amounts of beverages to stock her kiosk.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio Cesar R. G. está casado hace mas de 10 años y tiene 3 hijos. El cliente nació en Argentina pero hace ya muchos años saco su nacionalidad Boliviana y vive actualmente en la ciudad de Cochabamba.
  
Julio Cesar se dedica a la distribución de botellones de agua hace más de 3 años. Trabaja para la empresa Agua y Sol ubicada en la zona sud de la ciudad de Cochabamba a solo unas cuadras de su casa en la zona conocida como Coña Coña - km 6 a la Av. Blanco Galindo. Julio desea poder comenzar un negocio pequeño vendiendo botellones de agua tal como lo hace en su trabajo de esta manera poder incrementar sus ingresos y poder darle a su familia un mejor futuro.

Julio nos cuenta que su mayor sueño es poder ver a sus hijos crecer en un ambiente bueno y que logren terminar sus estudios y sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar R. G. has been married for over ten years and has three children. He was born in Argentina but many years ago, he obtained Bolivian citizenship and he now lives in the city of Cochabamba.

Julio Cesar has worked distributing jugs of water for more than three years. He works for the company Agua y Sol, located in the southern area of the city of Cochabamba a few blocks from his house in the area known as Coña Coña – kilometer 6 of the Av. Blanco Galindo. Julio wants to be able to begin a small business selling jugs of water, just as he does at his job, so that he can increase his income and be able to provide his family with a better future.

Julio tells us that his biggest dream is to be able to see his children grow up in a good environment and for them to finish school and be good professionals.

loans.use: Investment capital

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en: Shadrack is 48 years old, married and has five children. For more than 10 years, he has made a living running an electronics shop where he sells and repairs TVs and radios. Thanks to help from Faulu Kenya, he has earned enough money to send all five of his children to school. He hopes to continue providing his family with a decent life and, to help make that possible, has applied for a loan for 40, 000 Kes to buy more supplies for his shop.

loans.use: To buy supplies for a TV and radio store

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Dos Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Solidario NUEVA ESPERANZA DOS  esta compuesta por tres integrantes  todas mujeres,   La   representante del grupo es la Sra. Isolina tiene dos hijos su esposo es albañil ella de dedica a la venta de verdura en Cochabamba los días de feria es donde vende mas , su préstamo destinara para aumentar su capital y poder variar sus verduras como tomate, zanahoria y cebolla por cantidad, vive en sacaba,
Es un grupo de amigas se conocen  de  hace muchos años, son muy conocidas en la zona   por ser personas muy responsables y trabajadoras, el préstamo lo destinaran para su mercadería y aumentar capital .
texts.en:
The solidarity group "Nueva Esperanza Dos" [New Hope Two] is made up of three members, all of them women. The group's representative is Isolina. She has two children and her husband is a construction worker. She sells fruits and vegetables in Cochabamba. Market days is when she sells more. She will use her loan to increase her capital and to bring variety to her produce such as tomatoes, carrots and onions in quantity. She lives in Sacaba. 

This is a group of friends who have known each other for many years. They are well-known in the region for being very responsible and hard-working people. The loan will be used for their merchandise and to increase capital.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
Rosa L. es una mujer casada con 3 hijos en las edades D. 21 a 36 años, que elabora con sus  manos artesanías y las venD. en su propia miscelánea, actividades que inició  a partir D. su creatividad, conocimiento empirico en el oficio y del  mercado que aborda .
Rosa es una mujer muy inteligente que le saca provecho a todos sus conocimientos, por eso en  cada momento elabora el producto D. acuerdo a la época,  al mercado y  teniendo en cuenta que le deje utilidades; ella  se adapta rápidamente a los cambios D. productos cuando es necesario,  porque es capaz D. ajustarse a los requerimientos D. su mercado, así ocurrió  cuando fabricaba productos en cerámica y se le complicó la venta por su alta  competitividad  y   ella fue capaz D. sostenerse,   aprendiendo  diferentes tipos D. manualidades y técnicas,  como las que práctica hoy  que es la D.  elaborar muñecos D. trapo y arteanias en tela, en su propio taller,  tiene maquina para fabricarlos y un punto D. venta en su propia casa, que lo  aprovecha efectivamente porque agregó mercancías  como articulos femeninos, figuras decorativas, adornos D. cocina, detalles para el hoga, multiusos con lo que tambien genera utilidades.  
Este es su segundo financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con él comprará materias primas e insumos como: telas, caritas, rellenos D. algodon y detalles naviD.ños para la venta decembrina. Con su primer crédito aumentó su capital D. trabajo, consiguió nuevos clientes y quiere con su credikiva, continuar creciendo especialmente  para lograr su sueño y gran desafío que el D. tener un almacén especializado en sus propios productos.
texts.en:
Rosa L. is married and has three children whose ages range from 21 to 36 years.  She makes hand-maD. crafts that she sells in her own general store.  She began these activities based on her own creativity and self-taught skills in the area and the marketplace.

Rosa is a very intelligent woman who takes full advantage of all her knowledge.  She is always making items according to the season, the market and their profitability.  She adapts quickly to product changes when necessary because she is able to adjust to market requirements.  This is what happened previously when she used to make ceramic items but sales became complicated due to high competition.  She was able to stay in business learning different manual skills and techniques like the ones she practices today making rag dolls and cloth crafts in her own workshop.  She has a machine to manufacture them and a sales point in her own home which she uses quite efficiently in that she added other merchandise like female articles, decorative figures, kitchen decorations, home goods, multiple-use clothing items that also generate profits.

This is her second loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that will be used to buy raw materials and ingredients like: fabric, faces, cotton filling and Christmas decorations for the December sales season.  She used her first loan to increase working capital and acquired new customers.  She wants to use her Kiva loan to continue growing especially to reach her dream and great challenge of having a large store specializing in her own products.

loans.use: To buy fabric, faces, cotton filling and Christmas decorations for December sales.

loans.name: Las Estrellas Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama "Las estrellas",  y se integra de tres señoras cada una con diferente actividad, se ubica en la localidad de "La Ribera Vista Hermosa", Municipio de Copaínala, Estado de Chiapas México, la razón del nombre es porque son tres personas y cada una de ellas tiene una gran estrella.
    
  Alba Arévalo A. es casada con el señor Carlos Pérez Juárez, ellos tienen cinco hijos, dos ya están casados y tres siguen a su responsabilidad y son: Cintia verónica  estudia en la telesecundaria, Carla Rafaela que estudia la primaria y la más pequeña es Alexia Roxana de tres años de edad.
     
   Alba se dedica a su hogar, y tiene un pequeño negocio de compra y venta de ropas, hace pocos meses que inicio éste negocio y solicita su préstamos para surtirse, cometa que la va bien con esta actividad ya que de eso ha tenido ingresos para su hogar.
    
 Se inspiro en esta actividad por una prima cercana que la animó a vender ropas ya que es un trabajo donde se obtiene buenas ganancias y con ello podrá ganar su propio dinero, apoyar con los gastos que tiene del diario en su hogar y así apoya a su esposo que a diario trabaja en el campo.
   
 Con las ganancias que va obteniendo lo ahorra para que cuando vaya a resurtirse tenga suficiente dinero y pueda comprar más cosas y de mejor calidad para su clientela. De ésta manera los clientes comprarán con mas gusto y sus ingresos serán mayores.
   
   El sueño que tiene es tener una tienda de ropas en donde pueda vender su mercancía y también desea ahorrar para darle lo mejor a sus hijas que están estudian y con el apoyo de su esposo construir una casa donde vivan mejor.
  
   Alba formó un grupo para pedir un préstamo a FRAC, lo formó con su nuera que esta de blusa morada quien acaba de tener un bebé y con su vecina. Habló con ellas y todas pensaron que era un buen apoyo para que ellas continuaran trabajando y pudieran obtener ganancias mientras pagan el crédito.
   
   Las integrantes del grupo son las siguientes:

   María Candelaria Pérez A.: invertirá el préstamo en la compra de ingredientes como son: maseca, chile ancho, carne, entre otros, para le elaboración de antojitos.

   María Emma Pérez Gómez: invertirá el préstamo en la compra de pollos para matanza y venta por kilo.(destazados).

  Alba Arévalo A.: invertirá el préstamo en la compra y  venta de ropas como son: pantalones, camisas, playeras, faldas blusas entre otros para venderlo en la misma región.
texts.en:
This group is called "Las Estrellas" (The Stars), and it is made up of 3 women who each have a different kind of business.  This group resides in the locality of Ribera Vista in the beautiful municipality of Copaínala, in the state of Chiapas, Mexico.  

The reason for the name of their group is that their group contains 3 women, and each one of them is a great star. 

Alba Arévalo A. is married to Carlos Pérez Juárez; they have 5 children: 2 of whom are married, and 3 of whom are still dependent children.  These 3 are: Cintia Verónica, who is in a distance education program for secondary school, Carla Rafaela, who is in elementary school, and  Alexia Roxana, the youngest, who is 3 years old.

Alba is a housewife who also has a small clothing business.  It has only been a few months since she started this business, and she requests a loan to stock the business with merchandise.  She comments that the business is going well, as it allows her to have some income for the household.  

She was inspired to start this activity by a cousin who lives nearby who motivated her to sell clothing, since it is a business where one can obtain good earnings.  With this business she will be able to earn her own money and pay for some of the daily household expenses and in this way support her husband, who works daily in agriculture.  

She will save some of the profits from her business to restock it with more merchandise and merchandise that is of better quality for her customers.  This way her customers will buy with greater enthusiasm and her income will be higher.

Her dream is to have a clothing store where she can sell her merchandise.  In addition, she wants to save so that she can provide the best for her daughters who are still in school and, with the support of her husband, build a house where they can live better.

She formed this group with her daughter-in-law, who is in the purple blouse and recently had a baby, and a neighbor.  They found out about FRAC, and it seemed to them to be a source of support where they could work on their activities and obtain earnings while paying back the loans.  The members of this group are the following: María Candelaria Pérez A., who will invest the loan in the purchase of ingredients such as corn flour, ancho chiles, meat and other items to make snacks; María Candelaria Pérez A., who will invest the loan in the purchase of broilers to slaughter, season and sell; and Alba Arévalo A., who will invest the loan in the purchase of clothing to sell such as: pants, shirts, T-shirts, skirts, blouses, and other items to sell in the same region.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as: pants, blouses, dresses, skirts and other items

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LA UNION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nieves; ella tiene 50 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, que atiende desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar su negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para la tienda de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar y fideos.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the La Unión communal bank, located in the district of Cusco and also in the province and department of Cusco.

Nieves is 50 years old and has a live-in partner and two children. She alternates her daily activities with her grocery store business, which she attends to from 6am to 7pm to get her children ahead. She wants to expand her grocery store and she is requesting the loan to purchase products for her store like rice, sugar and pasta.

Nieves is grateful for everyone who is making this dream possible and promises to make her payments in the established time frame.

loans.use: To buy products for the grocery store such as rice, sugar and pasta.

loans.name: Jayne

texts.es:
Jayne I. Q. D. M. está casada hace mas D. 15 años y tiene 3 hijos. Tanto ella como el marido trabajan en diferentes áreas mientras los hijos se quedan con la madre D. la Jayne. Jayne y su familia vive en Cochabamba en la zona norte en un barrio conocido como Pacata Alta. 

Jayne se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes en su tienda D. barrio mientras su esposo trabaja como Analista D. Sistemas en la creación D. software y al mismo tiempo da clases D. Sistemas informáticos. Es para la tienda que Jayne tiene que necesita el crédito, pues la zona donD. está la tienda está más poblada y la demanda se incremento considerablemente en los últimos años y ella necesita capital para comprar más abarrotes y poder abastecer mejor su tienda.

Jayne y su marido que el único sueño que tienen es poder darle todo lo que puedan a sus hijos y poder verlos profesionales algún día.
texts.en:
Jayne I. Q. D. M. has been married for 15 years and has three children. She and her husband work in different areas while their children stay with Jayne’s mother. Jayne and her family live in the northern area of Cochabamba in a neighborhood known as Pacata Alta. Jayne works selling groceries at her neighborhood store, while her husband works as a systems analyst in software creation and also provides classes on information technology. Jayne needs the loan for the store because the area where the store is located is more populated and the demand increased considerably in the past few years. She needs money to purchase more groceries and to better stock her store.

The only dream that Jayne and her husband have is to be able to proviD. all that they can to their children and to be able to see them as professionals one day.

loans.use: Operational capital

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
Yanet tiene 39 años, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos. Actualmente, Yanet vive en la comunidad de Compone del distrito de Anta provincia de Anta del departamento del Cusco. La comunidad de Compone se encuentra ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco donde la mayoría de pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.  Yanet alterna las actividades del hogar con las actividades de su negocio. Su actividad económica principal de Yanet es la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, gallinas, chanchos, etc.  Yanet también se dedica a la compra y venta de maíz. 

Yanet desde hace mucho tiempo que participa en el banco comunal “San Isidro de Compone” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Yanet con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de S/. 800 nuevos soles, ella invertirá el dinero en el negocio y comprara cuyes y productos agrícolas. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Yanet is 39 years old and has a live-in partner and two children. She currently lives in the community of Compone, within the district and province of Anta and the department of Cusco. The community of Compone is located 45 minutes from the city of Cusco where the majority of the residents work in agriculture and cattle farming.

Yanet alternates her household activities with her business activities. Her main business is raising young animals like guinea pigs, chickens, pigs, etc. She also works buying and selling corn.

Yanet has participated for a long time in the San Isidro de Compone communal bank, part of the Unidad de Microfinanzas Arariwa from the city of Cusco, Peru. With the next loan that she hopes to receive of 800 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN), Yanet will invest in the business and will buy guinea pigs and agricultural products.

She is grateful for the opportunity provided and promises to make her loan payments according to schedule.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs and agricultural products.

loans.name: Meribeht

texts.es: Meribeht, de 22 años, vive en compañía de su esposo Henry de 33 años, que es comerciante,  y de sus 2 menores hijos, juntos cada día se esfuerzan por salir adelante en busca del progreso. Desde hace 2 años, empezó con el negocio de venta de relojes, accesorios para mujer y adornos para el hogar. Al principio no fue fácil porque sola buscaba a sus compradores, pero en la actualidad solo trae pedidos a sus clientes, les deja en sus casas o negocios y les brinda su mercadería a crédito, es por esta razón que obtiene regulares ganancias ya que ofrece a mayor precio del real. Esta muy satisfecha pues es un trabajo tranquilo que le permite continuar con las labores del hogar y no descuidar la crianza de sus hijos; lo que no le gusta es cuando sus clientes se atrasen en pagar en la fecha que quedaron y eso le genera atrasos en los pagos. Como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado instalar un negocio propio en algún mercado de la ciudad, pues quiere trabajar más estable. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete cumplir con sus pagos puntualmente, ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este préstamo que le permitirá continuar trabajando, además esta muy satisfecha con el desempeño de los integrantes de su grupo pues son muy responsables y solidarios. Meribeht tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería, pues tiene varios pedidos por cumplir y quiere obtener mejores ganancias para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Maribeht, 22, lives with her husband, Henry, 33, who is a merchant, and their two minor children.  They struggle daily together to get ahead seeking progress.  Two years ago she started selling watches, women’s accessories and home decorations.

At the beginning it wasn’t easy because she would seek customers by herself but currently she fills orders for customers that she delivers to their homes or work places and that she sells on credit.  This is how she earns steady profits because she sells slightly higher than the real price.  She is very satisfied because it’s calm work that allows her to continue with her household chores and not neglect her children’s care.  What she dislikes is when customers lag behind in their payments.

Because she’s an enterprising woman she plans for the future to set up her own store in one of the city markets because she wants a more stable work environment.

This is her first loan with MFP and she pledges to repay on time because she does not want to disappoint the people who made the loan possible that will allow her to continue working.  Besides, she is very satisfied with the work of her fellow group members because they are very responsible and mutually supportive.

Maribeht plans to use the loan to buy larger amounts of merchandise because she has several pending order to fill and wants to obtain better profits to get ahead.

loans.use: To buy merchandise like decorations and articles for the home.

loans.name: Octavia

texts.es:
Octavia tiene 56 años, es casada y tiene ocho hijos. Actualmente, Octavia vive en la comunidad de Compone del distrito de Anta provincia de Anta del departamento del Cusco. La comunidad de Compone se encuentra ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco donde la mayoría de pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería. Octavia alterna las actividades del hogar con las actividades de su negocio. Su actividad económica principal de Octavia es la ganadería y brinda servicios de transportes. Yanet también se dedica a la compra y venta de maíz. 

Octavia desde hace mucho tiempo que participa en el banco comunal “San Isidro de Compone” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Octavia con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de S/. 600 nuevos soles, ella invertirá una parte del dinero en el gasto familiar y la otra parte comprara maíz.

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Octavia is 56 years old, married, and has eight children. She currently lives in the community of Compone, within the district and province of Anta and the department of Cusco. The community of Compone is located 45 minutes from the city of Cusco where the majority of the residents work in agriculture and cattle farming.

Octavia alternates her household activities with her business activities. Her main business is cattle farming and transportation services. She also worked buying and selling corn.

Octavia has participated for a long time in the San Isidro de Compone communal bank, part of the Unidad de Microfinanzas Arariwa from the city of Cusco, Peru. With the next loan that she hopes to receive of 600 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN), Octavia will invest a part in family expenses and will buy corn with the other part

She is grateful for the opportunity provided and promises to make her loan payments according to schedule.

loans.use: For family expenses and to buy corn.

loans.name: Tania America

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LA UNION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Tania America; ella tiene 24 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de cosméticos, ella vende en forma independiente a sus vecinos o al público en general, la socia quiere tener un lugar donde pueda vender los cosméticos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos de belleza. 


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "The Union."  The bank is located in Cuzco District in Cuzco Province, Department of Cuzco.

The member is named Tania America.  She is 24 years old, lives with her partner and has two children.  She alternates her daily activities with the business of selling cosmetics.  She works independently selling to her neighbors and to the general public.  

Tania wants to have a place to sell cosmetics. She is requesting a loan to buy beauty products.  She is grateful to those who support her in this dream by donating through this forum, and she promises to make timely loan repayments.

loans.use: The member requests this loan to purchase beauty products.

loans.name: Kollitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. KOLLITAS inicia su segundo ciclo, es parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes, ocho mujeres y un varón. La mesa directiva está compuesta por la  presidenta: la señora Olga,  la tesorera: la señora Fidela y la secretaria de actas: la señora Lidia.

La señora  presidenta Olga es una mujer de 47 años de edad, casada, con  tres hijos,  las señoras consideraron que era la persona adecuada para el cargo.

Con respecto a su negocio, ella tiene un puesto de dulces en su mismo domicilio, además cuenta con canchitas (futbolines) que son la atracción para niños y grandes. Ella comenta que cuenta con este negocio desde hace 16 años y lo inicio por cuenta propia.  Su primer crédito fue invertido en mercadería, lo mismo que el que se le otorgará en este ciclo.
Con respecto a los negocios  que llevan adelante el resto de integrantes de la asociación, ellos tienen negocios como comerciantes y de servicio.
texts.en:
The A.C. KOLLITAS group is beginning its second season.  It is part of the Focal Point of Panamericana. It is composed of nine members, eight females and one male. The board consists of the president, Mrs. Olga; the treasurer, Mrs. Fidela; and recording secretary, Mrs. Lydia.

The president, Olga, is a 47-year-old woman who is married with three children.  The other members decided she was the right person for the position.  

With respect to her business, Olga has a candy stand in her own home.  She also sells popcorn balls, which is a big draw for both adults and children.  She notes that she has been in this business, which she started on her own, for 16 years.  Her first loan was invested in merchandise, and she plans to do the same with the proceeds of the currently requested loan.

The other members of the association have businesses as merchants and service industry personnel.

loans.use: To buy sweets.

loans.name: Los Claveles Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario LOS CLAVELES  esta compuesta por tres integrantes  todas mujeres,   La   representante del grupo es la Sra. la representante del grupo es la Sra. Jiovana  tiene un hijo D. 4 años  que no asiste todavía a la escuela, su actividad D. la Sra. Es la venta D. Papa y el destino del crédito es para la compra D. Papa por cantidad, lleva ya 3 años en esta actividad, todas ellas viven en rodeo  km. 33 carretera a Santa Cruz , en la zona son muy conocidas  por ser personas muy responsables y trabajadoras,  ellas se dedican a la venta D. Papa los días D. feria en sacaba , Cochabamba ,Tiraque y una D. ellas se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos el préstamo lo destinaran para aumentar su mercadería .
texts.en:
The "Los Claves" ["The Carnations"] solidarity group is composed of three members, all women.  The group representative is Ms. Jiovana.  She has a four year-old son who is not yet in school.  Her business is selling potatoes and she will use this loan to buy potatoes in large quantities.  She has been doing this for three years.

All of the women live around 33 kilometers by highway from Santa Cruz.  In their area, they are well known for being very responsible and hard working people.  They sell potatoes on market days in Sacaba, Cochabamba, and Tiraque.  One of them sells cosmetics.  She will use the loan to add to her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy potatoes in large quantities

loans.name: Norberta

texts.es:
Norberta tiene 49 años y vive en la comunidad de Compone del distrito de Anta provincia de Anta del departamento del Cusco. La comunidad de Compone se encuentra ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco donde la mayoría de pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería. Norberta alterna las actividades del hogar con las actividades de su negocio. Su actividad económica principal es la ganadería y también se dedica a la venta de leche. 
     
Norberta desde hace mucho tiempo que participa en el banco comunal “San Isidro de Compone” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Norberta con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de S/. 300 nuevos soles, ella invertirá para aumentar sus negocios y desea comprar leche. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Norbeta is 49 years old and lives in the community of Compone, in the district and province of Anta, in the department of Cusco.  The community of Compone is located 45 minutes from the city of Cusco and the majority of its inhabitants grow crops and raise livestock. Norberta divides her time between her household chores and her business activities.  Her main job is livestock farming and she also sells milk.

Norberta has been a member of Arariwa's “San Isidro de Compone” community bank in Cusco, Peru for a long time.  Norberta plans to invest the loan of 300 nuevos soles which she hopes to receive in increasing her business and buying milk.

Norberta is grateful for the opportunity she is being offered through this loan and pledges to repay in a timely manner.

loans.use: To purchase milk

loans.name: Nalweyiso

texts.en: Nalweyiso K. lives in the Katanga neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed, has five children, three of whom are in school, and  supports her family by selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for more than 10 years and works seven days a week, selling her products in a local market. She is applying for a loan for 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Because one of her main challenges is transportation, she hopes to be able to buy a delivery van in the near future. K. owns her home and has access to electricity but not water delivered by pipe. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding her family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to sell to her customers

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es:
PILAR D. O.
Socia activa del banco comunal mujeres valientes. Distrito calleria departamento Ucayali,  Es viuda Tiene  60 años de edad, tuvo 3  hijos, dos ya independientes y uno a su cargo. Que todavía depende de pilar
 Con el préstamo que Manuela Ramos le hizo hace 8 años ha está  invirtiendo en  su negocio  que  tiene de bar- restaurant.
Y con el afán de mejorar la atención a su público asístete  su negocio ha decidido variar sus platos a la carta.
 Pilar  Con su último préstamo  que es de  s/. 1000 nuevos soles y s que saco de Manuela Ramos se va proveer de insumos y enseres que le faltan para seguir brindando la debida atención a sus asiduos clientes.  
 La señora  Pilar se siente bien porque  ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos  y a su negocio aun siendo una mujer sola. Gracias a los préstamos obtenidos de parte de Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
PILAR D. O. is an active member of the "Mujeres Valientes" ["Brave Women"] communal bank. She lives in the Calleria district in the department of Ucayali. She is a widow and 60 years old. She has 3 children; two are already independent, and one is in her care and still dependent on her.

With the loan granted to her 8 years ago by the Manuela Ramos organization, she invested in her business, which is a restaurant-bar. With the goal of improving her service to her customers, she has decided to offer more varied dishes on her menu. With her current loan through Manuela Ramos, for 1000 Peruvian new soles, she will buy supplies and equipment which she needs to provide proper service to her loyal customers. 

Pilar feels good because she has been able to help her children get ahead, and she has made progress with her business in spite of being a woman alone, thanks to the loans she has obtained through Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Buying supplies

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina tiene 33 años, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos. Actualmente, Luz Marina vive en la comunidad de Compone del distrito de Anta provincia de Anta del departamento del Cusco. La comunidad de Compone se encuentra ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco donde la mayoría de pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería. Luz Marina alterna las actividades del hogar con las actividades de su negocio. Su actividad económica principal de la venta de comestibles como por ejemplo arroz, fideos, aceite  y muchas cosas más. 
 
Luz Marina desde hace mucho tiempo que participa en el banco comunal “San Isidro de Compone” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Luz Marina con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de S/. 700 nuevos soles, ella invertirá para aumentar sus negocios y desea comprar mas comestibles como por ejemplo sacos de arroz y azúcar. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Luz Marina is 33 years old, lives with her common-law husband and has two children. She currently lives in the community of Compone, district of Anta, department of Cusco, Peru. Her community is located about 45 minutes from the city of Cusco, and the majority of its inhabitants make a living in agriculture and raising livestock. Luz Marina alternates her household and business responsibilities. Her main source of income comes from selling food products, such as rice, noodles, oil and many other items. She has belonged to the San Isdro de Compone community bank and Kiva partner Asociacion Arariwa in Cusco for quite some time. Luz Marina plans to use her next loan of 700 soles to invest in expanding her business and purchasing more food products, such as sacks of rice and sugar. She is grateful for the opportunity made available through this medium and promises to fulfill her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase more food products such as bags of rice and sugar.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
Matilde reside en vivienda de sus padres en la zona de Cota Cota, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, es casada y tiene dos hijas de 5 y 4 años, la señora es profesora y trabaja en la provincia, área rural y su esposo es empleado en una fabrica, con los ingresos que obtienen mantienen a su familia, es la primera ves que solicita un crédito en nuestra institución.

El crédito será destina a la conclusión de obra fina en un garzonier de la casa de sus padres, para una mayor comodidad en la vivienda.

Por el análisis socio económico, califica para obtener un crédito.
texts.en: Matilde lives in her parents' home in the area of Cota Cota on the western side of the city of La Paz. She is married and has two children, ages 5 and 4. She is a teacher and works in a rural area, and her husband works at a factory. The use their income to provide for their family. This is the first time she is requesting a loan with this institution. She plans to use the loan to finish construction on an extension to her parents' home to add a higher level of comfort. A socioeconomic analysis deems her qualified to receive a loan.

loans.use: Finish construction on an extension to her parents' home.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LA UNION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Virginia; ella tiene 36 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artefactos y también trabaja en un snack cafetería, la socia compra diferentes artefactos y luego los lleva a diferentes lugares como Chumbivilcas y Quillabamba, la socia quiere mejorar su negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artefactos como radios pequeñas al por mayor.  


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: Virginia belongs to "La Union" community bank in the district of Cusco, Peru. Virginia is 36 years old, has two children and lives with her common-law husband. She alternates her daily activities between selling electronic devices and running a snack stand. Virginia buys different devices and then takes them to different places such as Chumbivilcas and Quillabamba. She wants to improve her business and is requesting a loan to purchase more devices, such as small radios, at wholesale. Virginia is grateful to those who make this dream possible through this medium and promises to fulfill her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase devices like small radios at wholesale

loans.name: Jovita

texts.es:
Jovita tiene 33 años, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos. Actualmente, Jovita vive en la comunidad de Compone del distrito de Anta provincia de Anta del departamento del Cusco. La comunidad de Compone se encuentra ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco donde la mayoría de pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería. Jovita alterna las actividades del hogar con las actividades de su negocio. Su actividad económica principal es la agricultura y también se dedica a la venta granos. 
     
Jovita desde hace mucho tiempo que participa en el banco comunal “San Isidro de Compone” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Jovita con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de S/. 500 nuevos soles, ella invertirá para aumentar sus negocios y desea comprar granos como por ejemplo cebada, trigo, etc. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Jovita is 33 years old, has two children and lives with her common-law husband. She currently lives in the community of Compone, district of Anta, department of Cusco, Peru. Her community is located 45 minutes from the city of Cusco, and the majority of its inhabitants make a living in agriculture and raising livestock. Jovita balances her household and business activities. Her main source of income comes from farming, and she also makes a living selling grains. Jovita has belonged to the "San Isidro de Compone" community bank and Kiva partner Asociacion Araruwa in Cusco for quite some time. With her next loan of 500 soles, she plans to expand her business by purchasing grains, such as barley, wheat, etc. Jovita is grateful for the opportunity made available through this medium and promises to fulfill her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase grains such as barley, wheat, etc.

loans.name: Yeni

texts.es:
Yeni tiene 24 años, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos. Actualmente, Yeni vive en la comunidad de Compone del distrito de Anta provincia de Anta del departamento del Cusco. La comunidad de Compone se encuentra ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco donde la mayoría de pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería. Yeni alterna las actividades del hogar con las actividades de su negocio. Su actividad económica principal de Yeni es la venta de lácteos y a la crianza de aniamales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, chanchos, etc. 

Yeni desde hace mucho tiempo que participa en el banco comunal “San Isidro de Compone” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Norma con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de S/. 300 nuevos soles, ella invertirá para aumentar sus animales y desea comprar cuyes. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Yeni is 24 years old, has two children and lives with her common-law husband. She currently lives in the community of Compone, district of Anta, department of Cusco, Peru. Her community is located 45 minutes from the city of Cusco, and the majority of its inhabitants make a living in agriculture and  livestock. Yeni balances her household and business responsibilities. She makes a living selling dairy products and raising small animals, such as guinea pigs, hogs, etc. She has belonged to the "San Isidro de Compone" community bank and Kiva partner Asociacion Arariwa in Cusco for quite some time. With her next loan of 300 soles, she plans to add livestock and purchase guinea pigs. She is grateful for the opportunity made available through this medium and promises to fulfill her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase guinea pigs

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma tiene 27 años, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos. Actualmente, Andrea vive en la comunidad de Compone del distrito de Anta provincia de Anta del departamento del Cusco. La comunidad de Compone se encuentra ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco donde la mayoría de pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería. Norma alterna las actividades del hogar con las actividades de su negocio. Su actividad económica principal de Norma es la agricultura, ganadería y también se dedica a la venta de lácteos. Norma para trabajar la tierra tiene un pequeño tractor que sirve para ayudar a la siembra de sus productos.   

Norma desde hace mucho tiempo que participa en el banco comunal “San Isidro de Compone” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Norma con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de S/. 2000 nuevos soles, ella invertirá para el mantenimiento de su tractor y comprara llantas.

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Norma is 27 years old, lives with her partner and has two children.  Currently she works in the Compone community in the district and province of Anta, in the department of Cusco.  The Compone community is located 45 minutes from the city of Cusco. The majority of its inhabitants farm crops and livestock.  Norma divides her time between her household chores and her business activities.  Norma's main economic activity is crop farming, livestock farming and selling dairy products.  Norma has a small tractor which she has for working the land.  It helps her to sow her products.

Norma has been a member of the “San Isidro de Compone” community bank in Cusco, Peru for a long time.  She hopes to receive this next loan for 2,000 nuevos soles and will use it to have maintenance work done on her tractor and to purchase tires.

Norberta is grateful for the opportunity she is being offered through this loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: For maintenance work to her tractor and to purchase tires

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel, de 40 años, vive en su casa propia a lado de sus padres y trabaja cada día para que no les falte nada. Este carismático hombre aprendió desde muy joven todo sobre cosmetología. Luego de varios años de trabajar en diversos negocios, con mucho esfuerzo logró instalar su propio salón de belleza en un populoso barrio al norte de la ciudad donde no había competencia. Es así como adquirió gran cantidad de clientes que hasta hoy en día  lo visitan pues confían en la calidad del servicio de corte y arreglo personal que él ofrece. Le gusta mucho su trabajo pues se entretiene conversando con sus clientes de siempre; además obtiene regulares ganancias que le han permitido mejorar su negocio para la comodidad de sus visitantes. Aunque trabaja sin ayuda, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, no se cansa y tiene muchos planes para en el futuro mejorar el negocio ya que quiere comprar los implementos modernos que le hacen falta. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este préstamo que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Miguel tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de un vaporizador y algunos implementos que le hacen falta en su salón de belleza, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Miguel is 40 years old and lives in his own home alongside his parents.  He works every day so that they don't need for anything.  This charismatic man has learned all about cosmetology from a young age.  After several years working in different businesses, he made a lot of effort and managed to set up his own beauty salon in a densely-populated neighborhood in the north of the city where there was no competition.  This is how he acquired a large number of customers who still come to see him since they trust the quality of the haircut and hairstyling services which he offers.  He likes his work a lot because he has fun chatting to his long-standing customers.  He also makes regular profits which have enabled him to improve his business for the comfort of his customers.  Although he works without help from 8 in the morning until 9 in the evening, he doesn't get tired and he has many plans for the future.  He would like to improve his business since he wants to buy modern tools which he lacks.  This is the first loan which he has had with MFP and he pledges to make his repayments in a timely manner since he doesn't want to let down those people who are making the loan possible.  The loan will allow him to continue working in search of progress.  Miguel plans to invest the loan he is requesting in the purchase of a hood dryer and some other tools which he needs in his beauty salon.  In this way he hopes to improve his profits.

loans.use: To buy a hood dryer and tools for his beauty salon

loans.name: Rosa Alejandrina

texts.es:
ROSA  ALEJANDRINA A. D. P.
La señora Rosa es socia del banco comunal Mujeres valientes, personas perseverantes que con su esfuerzo han sabido salir adelante, pero no lo hubieran logrado sino hubieran tenido el apoyo económico que manuela ramos les dio  en el momento que lo necesitaron y que muchas D. ellas han sabido aprovechar con su trabajo día a día. Su esposo es chofer y no la alcanzaba para los gastos D. la casa. 
Rosa  es una D. ellas con su primer préstamo se implemento D. algunos enseres apropiados y compro los insumo necesarios para la venta D. comida y empezó con su pequeño negocio en su casa, sin descuidar a sus hijos pueD. trabajar  desD. hace 5 años, tiempo que lleva con Manuela Ramos.
Es un trabajo que es por horas, solo tiene que levantarse a las 4 am.  Preparar sus alimentos  para comenzar atender a las 7:00 D. la mañana a para atender a sus clientes.
Con el último préstamo D. manuela ramos le dio que es la suma D. s/.1500 soles. Va  invertir en  vajillas, 2 doc. D. platos hondos y tendidos, 2 doc.D. vasos, 6 jarras, una licuadora, un juego D. coladores, 2 doc. D. tasas, 2 doc. D. platos chicos  y demás enseres que ya se deterioraron con el uso.
 Rosa gracias a Manuela Ramos ha podido salir adelante con su negocio, a sus 58 años se siente muy bien con lo que ha logrado hasta el momento.
texts.en:
ROSA  ALEJANDRINA A. D. P.
Rosa is a member of the 'Mujeres Valientes' (Strong Women) community bank.  The bank's members are persistent people who, through their hard work, have known how to get ahead.  However, they would not have managed without the financial support that Manuela Ramos gave them when they needed it.  Many of them have known how to make the most of it with their everyday work.  Rosa's husband is a driver and he was unable to cover their household expenses.

Rosa is one of the women who maD. the most of their financial assistance.  With her first loan she set herself up with some equipment and bought the necessary supplies to sell food.  She started her small business from her own home and, without neglecting her children, has been able to work for 5 years, the time which she has been with Manuela Ramos.

Rosa's is a job which is by the hour.  She has to get up at 4.00am and prepare her food so that she can begin serving her customers at 7.00am.

With the current loan from Manuela Ramos, which is for 1,500 soles, she will buy dishes, soup dishes, plates, glasses, jugs, a blender, a set of colanders, cups, siD. plates and other utensils since they get damaged with use.

Thanks to Manuela Ramos, Rosa has been able to get ahead in her business.  At 58 years old, she feels very satisfied with what she has achieve up to this point.

loans.use: To purchase utensils

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda B. lives in the Lubaga neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda.  She is widowed, has six children and also cares for her brother's daughters. For the last 10 years, she has made a living by running a restaurant, where she works six days a week. She supplements her income by renting rooms and selling food in her home. Imelda is applying for a loan for 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy food for her restaurant, including rice, bananas, beef and chicken. The main challenge she faces is transportation, especially during the rainy season. In the future, she hopes to open a second restaurant. Imelda owns her home and has access to electricity and water.  Her major monthly expenses include medicines and feeding her family.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her restaurant, including bananas, rice, beef, chicken and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Roukayatou

texts.fr: O. Roukayatou est née en 1975 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative et politique du Bénin. Mariée à AFOUYEMI Camille, un soudeur, Roukayatou est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille s’est installée depuis une quinzaine d’année à PK10, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji au Bénin. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Roukayatou vend divers produits (conserves de tomate et de sardine, lait, mayonnaise, beurre, savons, produits de beauté, etc.) dans sa boutique size dans son quartier. Roukayatou achète ses produits à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui avait obtenu quatre crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Aujourd’hui encore, Roukayatou sollicite un autre crédit pour renforcer son activité et augmenter son stock de produits, ce qui lui permettra de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en: Roukayatou O. was born in 1975 in Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of Benin. Married to Camille Afouyemi, a welder, Roukayatou is the mother of three children, all of whom are in school. The family has lived for about fifteen years in the PK10 area of the town of Sèmè-Podji in Benin. The couple provide for the household together. To meet her own needs and those of her children, Roukayatou sells various items (canned tomatoes and sardines, milk, mayonnaise, butter, soap, cosmetics, etc.) at her store located in her area. Roukayatou buys her goods in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is a longstanding client of ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), and has obtained four loans, all of which were repaid properly. Currently, once more, Roukayatou is seeking another loan to strengthen her business and increase her stock of products, which will allow her to better respond to the demands of her clientele.

loans.use: To buy various items (canned tomatoes and sardines, soap, cosmetics, milk, mayonnaise)

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza vive en la zona de Barrio Grafico de la ciudad de La Paz. 
Es comerciante, tiene una tienda de ropa, y también vende a crédito su mercadería en las oficinas.
Esta separada y tiene un hijo en edad escolar.
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra de poleras, chompas y camisas)
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro.
Con este crédito podrá incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Maritza lives in the Barrio Grafico area of the city of La Paz. She is a shopkeeper and has a clothes store.  She also sells her goods on credit in offices.  She is separated and has a school-age son.  Her loan will be used as working capital (to purchase t-shirts, sweaters and shirts).  This is the first time that she has requested a loan from Impro.  With this loan she will be able to increase her income.

loans.use: Purchase of t-shirts, sweaters and shirts which are products she sells to her customers

loans.name: Herculana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LA UNION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Herculana; ella tiene 51 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes que atiende desde las 7:00 a.m hasta 7:00 p.m, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas, la socia quiere ampliar la tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para la tienda de abarrotes.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Herculana is a member of the community bank "La Union". The bank is located in the district, province, and region of Cusco.

Herculana is 51 years old, she lives with her partner and they have 4 children together. She manages a general store every day from 7am to 7pm. She sells basic needs products such as rice, sugar, milk, and cookies. She wishes to expand her store. She requests a loan to purchase products for her store.

She is thankful to all those who have made her dream possible and she is compromised to the terms of this loan.

loans.use: To purchase products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Urumuri A Group

texts.en: Urumuri, which is the name of this loan group, means Light in the Kinyarwanda language. Each of this group's members makes a living selling various items locally. Peteronille, the group leader, is 35 years old, married and has four children who are between the ages of five and 11. All of her children are in school. Her husband works as a farmer. Peteronille runs a shop where she sells household and food items such as sugar, soaps, rice, lotions and soda. She has had this business for 20 years and will use her portion of this loan to buy more items to sell to her customers.  She plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to pay her children's school fees. She has succeeded in business because she knows her customers well. In the future, she hopes to buy a house where she can also run her business. In the photo, we see Peteronille seated in the second row holding up her Urwego Opportunity Bank Passbook.

loans.use: To buy more food and household goods to sell to her customers

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
ROSA F. S.
La socia señora Rosa F. perteneciente al banco comunal Mujeres Valientes. del distrito calleria , departamento de Ucayali tiene 62 años de edad en la actualidad. Con su primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos inició con la venta de productos golosinarios y artículos comestibles en un  pequeño kiosco.
Con cuatro años que lleva de beneficiaria de los préstamos de Manuela Ramos ha logrado seguir implementando su negocio con el cual ayuda económicamente a su esposo que tiene trabajos ocasionales en la construcción.    
Con el ultimo préstamo s/. 1,500 soles  que ha recibido va comprar  1 caja de galletas varios sabores, 1 bolsas de caramelos, 1 caja de chicle, 1 caja de cigarrillos   también comprara  5 jabas de gaseosas, 2 paquetes de papel higiénico, 1 bolsa de detergente.
La señora Rosa muestra su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos  y  por la confianza que tuvo el banco comunal Mujeres Valientes para otorgarle el préstamo que ahora le sirve como sustento para su hogar.
texts.en:
Rosa F. S.

Rosa F. is a member of the community bank named "Valiant Women", located in the district of Calleria in the Ucayali region. She is 62 years old. Her first loan received from Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) was use to set up a small kiosk from where to sell sweets and snacks.

Four years have passed and she has received other loans from Manuela Ramos and she has kept reinventing back into the business. She is able to contribute financially with her husband. Her husband works independently as a construction contractor.

The previous loan in the amount of 1500 soles was invested in the purchase of a box of cookies of various flavors, 1 bag of caramels, 1 box of gum, 1 box of cigarettes, 5 cartons of soft drinks, 2 packages of bathroom tissue, and 1 bag of detergent.

Rosa is thankful to Manuela Ramos and for the trust imparted up on her by her community bank.  These loans have translated into her ability to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase snacks.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea tiene 54 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos. Actualmente, Andrea vive en la comunidad D. Compone del distrito D. Anta provincia D. Anta del departamento del Cusco. La comunidad D. Compone se encuentra ubicado a 45 minutos D. la ciudad del Cusco donD. la mayoría D. pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería. Andrea alterna las actividades del hogar con las actividades D. su negocio. Su actividad económica principal D. Andrea es el comercio pues venD. leche. Andrea también se dedica a la agricultura y venta D. madera. 

Andrea desD. hace mucho tiempo que participa en el banco comunal “San Isidro D. Compone” D. la Unidad D. Micro finanzas Arariwa D. la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Andrea con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir D. S/. 2000 nuevos soles, ella invertirá el dinero en comprar madera.

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Andrea is 54 years old, she is married and she has 2 children. Andrea lives in the community of Compone in the district and province of Anta, in Cusco. The community is located 45 minutes from the city of Cusco. The population is primarily maD. up of agriculturists and farmers. Andrea takes care of the household chores and she also manages her business. Andrea's source of income comes from being a milk merchant. Andrea is also an agriculturist and she sells wood.

For a very long time Andrea has been a member of the community bank "San Isidro D. Compone", a member organization of Microfinance Arariwa in the city of Cusco, Peru. Andrea requests a loan in the amount of 2000 nuevos soles and she plans to invest in the purchase of wood for resale.

Andrea is very thankful for the opportunity and she is committed to the terms of this loan.

loans.use: To purchase wood for resale.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita vive en anticretico en la zona de Alto San Pedro de La ciudad de La Paz; esta casada, los hijos ya son mayores de edad. Ella trabaja como profesora en un instituto enseñando cocina y repostería y en su tiempos libres ella confecciona poleras, con su hijo mayor y así consigue un ingreso extra.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar una maquina de coser, que le facilitará mucho la confección de poleras.

Es cliente de Impro y paga muy bien por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Margarita lives in the region of Alto San Pedro in the city of La Paz. She is married and she has grown children. She works as a teacher in a college and she teaches cooking and pastry. In her spare time she makes t-shirts with her eldest son as an additional source of income. 

The loan she requests will be used to purchase a sewing machine which will facilitate making t-shirts.

She is a client of Impro (Kiva Field Partner) and she has been on time with her payments, allowing her to access another loan.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LA UNION”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Haydee; ella tiene 33 años de edad y es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de medicamentos, ella tiene una botica que atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de botica. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar medicamentos al por mayor. 

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Haydee is a member of the community bank "La Union". The bank is located in the district, province, and region of Cusco. 

Haydee is 33 years old and she is a single mother of 2 children. She takes care of the household responsibilities and manages her business, selling medications. She has a drugstore that she operates from 8am to 8pm and it is thanks to this business that she is able to support her children.  She wishes to expand her drugstore. She requests a loan to purchase medications in wholesale. 

She is very thankful to all those who are making her dream possible and she is committed to the terms of this loan.

loans.use: To purchase medicines in wholesale.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
VIRGINIA V. D. G.
La señora Virginia socia del banco Denominado Mujeres Valientes, del distrito D. calleria departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 62 años D. edad, con tres hijos ya independientes, junto a su esposo atienden su negocio D. venta D. repuestos.
Todos estos años Virginia invertía el dinero que Manuela Ramos le prestaba en su negocio D.  repuestos,  D. esa manera ha ido surgiendo cada día más. Lo que ellos quieren  es tener D. aquí a unos años una tranquilidad económica.
La señora  Virginia feliz por lo que la vida le dio, tres hijos y al compañero D. toda su vida que es su esposo y con quien comparte todo logro obtenido gracias al esfuerzo y trabajo.
El ultimo préstamo D. s/. 3000 nuevos soles lo invertirá  en la compra D. 20 cadenas, 10 catalinas, una caja D. rodajes, 15 llantas, 1 caja D. aceite, 5 tapabarros, 30 cámaras y demás accesorios que le faltan en su venta D. repuestos.
Y da gracias a Manuela Ramos por ser parte D. ellos en estos nueve años que esta como socia del banco comunal.
texts.en:
Virginia V. D. G.

Virginia is a member of the community bank named "Valiant Women", located in the district of Calleria within the community of Ucayali. She is 62 years old and she has three grown children.  She lives together with her husband and they sell spare parts. 

All these years Virginia has been investing loans from Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) into her spare parts business. And she has been improving the business each day more and more. What they want to ensure their financial stability in the future. 

Virginia is happy with what life has given her: three children and her life partner who is her husband with whom she share every triumph forged through hard work and effort.

She requests a loan in the amount of 3000 nuevos soles and she will invest in the purchase of various types of spare parts for autos. She is thankful to Manuela Ramos and to her community bank with which she has been a member for the past 9 years.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Nocturnal Group

texts.es: El grupo nocturnal, se llama así porque en una noche de reunión de amigas decidieron formar el grupo para poder obtener crédito con CrediComún, el grupo está formado por nueve personas y todas se conocen entre sí.La señora Irma O. V.: está en unión libre con Alfredo Nicolás Blas, tienen tres hijos uno de seis, otro de cinco, y uno de dos, la señora se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y tortillas hechas a mano y el mismo local tiene un poco de mercancía de abarrotes. En la colonia todos la conocen por que hace unas tortillas muy ricas, dice estar muy agradecida con el crédito ya que es una posibilidad de crecimiento en su negocio para poder superarse y sacar adelante a su familia ya que en este tiempo es muy difícil que solo trabaje un sólo miembro de la familia porque a veces no les alcanzaba para la comida.Sin embargo quiere invertir en su negocio y hacerlo crecer, con las ganancias piensa comprar unos utensilios para poder vender antojitos mexicanos.
texts.en:
The group's name is Nocturnal. It was called this because it was one night that a group of friends decided to get together to be able to apply for a loan from CrediComun (Kiva Field Partner). The group is made up of nine members and they are all known to each other.

Mrs. Irma O. V. lives with her partner Alfredo Nicolas Blas and they have three children together: one is six years old, the other is five, and the last is 2 years old. She sells cosmetics and hand made tortillas; she also has a stand from where she sells groceries. In her community everyone knows her because she makes very delicious tortillas. She is very thankful for the loan because it is an opportunity for the development of her business. She wants to develop her business and she wants to support her family, especially at this time when there is only one source of income. Sometimes they do not have enough money for food. She wants to invest in her business and expand it. With her profits she hopes to purchase utensils to sell authentic Mexican snacks.

loans.use: To invest in her business.

loans.name: Adilia Judith

texts.es:
ADILIA JUDITH V.  D. C.
Judith como socia del banco comunal Mujeres Valientes.  distrito D. calleria, departamento D. Ucayali. A sus 47 años queriendo  ayudar a su esposo  y ser  también quien apoye económicamente deciD. dedicarse a la venta D. perfumería  tiene muchos años vendiendo productos jomy.
Estos últimos años sigue con la venta D. perfumes y también lo combina con la venta D. productos que están por campañas como son los turrones en el mes D. octubre. Que los trae D. la cuidad D. lima, también confecciona sandalias con aplicaciones.
Con los ingresos que genera con su negocio pueD. solventar los gastos D. los 6 hijos que tiene en su poder.
Los  S/.2300 nuevos soles que tiene del préstamo que Manuela Ramos lo distribuirá comprando 50 kilos D. turrones  que lo envían D. la ciudad D. lima, lo D. mas lo invertirá  s/. 500.00 soles  en lo que es  perfumes  y lo complementara comprando 20 pares D.  zapatos D. la ciudad D. Trujillo.
La señora Judith se siente tranquila porque su negocio ha mejorado y  da gracias a Dios por la vida y a Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad a tener acceso a su crédito.
texts.en:
Adilia Judith V. D. C.

Judith is a member of the community bank "Valiant Women". It is located in the district of Calleria within the community of Ucayali. She is 47 years old and she wanted to help her husband with the financial support of the family so she started her own business selling perfumes. She has been selling Jomy brand products for many years. These last several years she has been combining her perfume sales with the sale of other products featured in campaigns, as are fudge bars in the month of October. She imports quality products from Lima, though she makes sandals with appliqués for sale, too. 

The income that is generated by her business is used to proviD. for her 6 children who are in her care. 

She requests a loan of 2300 nuevos soles from Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) will be used to  purchase 50 kilograms of fudge that are imported from the city of Lima. The remaining 500 soles will be used to purchase perfumes and 20 pairs of shoes from the city of Trujillo. Judith is very happy to see her business progressing and thank god for life and for Manuela Ramos for the opportunity to access this loan.

loans.use: To purchase perfumes and fudge.

loans.name: K. Bernadette

texts.fr: A. K. Bernadette est née le 12 Juin 1961 à Adjohoun dans le département de l’Ouémé au Bénin. Il y a une vingtaine d’année que Bernadette s’est installée à Davatin dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, où elle vit avec sa famille. Bernadette est en effet mariée à DOHETO Honoré et est mère de cinq enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Le couple supporte ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Bernadette n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Depuis près de dix ans, Bernadette vend des produits cosmétiques, et également de l’huile de palme à son domicile et de façon ambulante. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l’aidant à subvenir à ses besoins. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Bernadette se ravitaille. Bernadette a déjà obtenu auprès de ALIDé cinq crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Bernadette désire développer davantage son activité et augmenter son chiffre d’affaire et donc son revenu ; raison pour laquelle Bernadette sollicite un autre crédit.
texts.en: K. Bernadette A. was born on 12 June 1961 in Adjohoun, in the Ouémé department, Benin. About twenty years ago, Bernadette settled in Davatin in the town of Sèmè-Podji, where she lives with her family. Bernadette is married to Honoré Doheto and has five children, some of whom are in school. The couple provide for the family together. Bernadette never attended school. For close to ten years, she has sold beauty products, as well as palm oil, at her home and door-to-door. This business provides her with an income that helps her meet her needs. Bernadette gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. She has already obtained five loans with ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), all of which were repaid properly. Bernadette wants to further develop her business and increase her sales, and thus raise her income; this is why she is seeking another loan.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and cans of palm oil

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en: Hadjah M. lives in the Makerere neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school. For the last year, she has made a living selling charcoal. She works every day of the week, selling from her home, and has applied for a loan for 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal to sell. Her main challenges include transporting charcoal from the town Luwero to her home in Makerere. In the future, she hopes to be able to buy a delivery van to help with transportation, and earn enough money to send her children to college. Hadjah owns her home and has access to electricity and water. Her biggest monthly expenses include school fees and feeding her family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to sell to her customers

loans.name: Katherine Lizeth

texts.es:
Catherine Lizete M. Suárez tiene 19 años.  Es soltera vive sola en el cantón de Ventanas en la provincia de los Ríos en la ciudadela Nueva Esperanza, no tiene cargas familiares. 

Catherine es un socio de la ventanilla rural Nuevo Porvenir, se encuentra  en la ciudadela Nueva Esperanza perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla integran 10 socios,   en su gran mayoría se dedican a las actividades de comercio. 

Catherine estudia y se dedica a vender ropa como ambulante. Realiza sus compras cada dos meses en la ciudad de Guayaquil o Perú, y las ventas lo realiza en el cantón Ventanas.
