Solicita el préstamo para surtir más su mercadería. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Su sueño es hacer una casa y terminar sus estudios. Dice no tener al momento desafíos que enfrente la familia ni el negocio.
Le gusta en sus tiempos libres escuchar música.
texts.en:
Katherine Lizete M. S. is 19 years old. She is single and she lives alone in the community of Ventanas, in the province of Los Rios, Nueva Esperanza. She does not have a family of her own. 

Katherine is a member of the community bank named Nuevo Porvenir. It is located in the village of Nueva Esperanza in Ventanas. It is a community bank with 10 members, and the great majority of the members are merchants. 

Katherine is going to school and she sells clothing door to door. She makes her purchases every two months in the city of Guayaquil or in Peru. She carries out her sales in Ventanas.

She requests a loan to add merchandise to her business. She sees this loan as an opportunity for success. Her dream is to have a house built for her and to finish her studies. She says she doesn’t have specific challengers pertaining to family or her business. 

She enjoys listening to music in her spare time.

loans.use: To add variety to her clothing business.

loans.name: Karina Estefania

texts.es:
Karina Estefanía Rodríguez Rodríguez tiene 21 años.  Es soltera vive con su mama  en el cantón de Ventanas en la provincia de los Ríos en la ciudadela Nueva Esperanza, no tiene cargas familiares. 

Karina es un socio de la ventanilla rural Nuevo Porvenir, se encuentra  en la ciudadela Nueva Esperanza perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla integran 10 socios,   en su gran mayoría se dedican a las actividades de comercio. 

Karina estudia y se dedica a la venta de ropa a domicilio desde hace un año atrás. Realiza sus compras en la ciudad de Guayaquil, y las ventas lo realiza en el cantón Ventanas.

Solicita el préstamo para surtir más su negocio de ropa. Piensa que el crédito le ayudaría para salir adelante con sus estudios en la Universidad y solventar también gastos varios. Su sueño es terminar sus estudios Universitarios y trabajar en su profesión de Enfermera. El desafió que enfrenta es tener mucha competencia en su negocio.

Le gusta estudiar y escuchar música.
texts.en:
Karina Estefania R. R. is 21 years old. She is single and she lives with her mother in the community of Ventanas, in the province of Los Rios, Nueva Esperanza. She doesn’t have a family of her own. 

Karina is a member of the community bank named Nuevo Porvenir. It is located in the village of Nueva Esperanza in Ventanas. It is a community bank with 10 members, and the great majority of the members are merchants. 

Karina is going to school and she has been selling clothing door to door for the past year. She makes her purchases in Guayaquil and carries out her sales in Ventanas. 

She requests a loan to add clothing inventory for her clothing business. She sees this loan as an opportunity to complete her University studies and to cover various personal expenses. Her dream is to complete her university career and find work as a nurse. The challenge she faces is steep competition in her business. 

She enjoys studying and listening to music.

loans.use: To add inventory to her clothing business.

loans.name: Vicencias D.

texts.fr: K. Vicencias D. est née en 1960 à Sèmè-Podji au Bénin. Mariée à BONOU Etienne, un frigoriste, Vicencias est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille vit à Davatin, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji depuis onze ans environs. Le couple assure ensemble les besoins du foyer. Vicencias n’a pas été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Vicencias prépare et vend du pâté (fait à base de farine de blé) à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Vicencias vend du maïs. Vicencias s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Vicencias exerce cette activité depuis onze ans et a déjà bénéficié de cinq crédits qu’elle a tous bien remboursés. Face à la demande de plus en plus grandissante, Vicencias désire augmenter son fonds de roulement et rehausser le niveau de son activité pour mieux répondre à sa clientèle.
texts.en: Ms. K. Vicencias D. was born in 1960 in Sèmè-Podji, in Benin. Married to Mr. BONOU Etienne, a refrigerator specialist, Vicencias is the mother of three children, who have all attended school. The family has lived in Davatin, in the community of Sèmè-Podji, for about eleven years. The couple jointly ensure that their household needs are met. Vicencias did not attend school. To support herself and her children, she makes and sell pâté (made from wheat flour) out of her home. Secondarily, she sells corn. She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She has been in this business for eleven years and has already had five loans, which were all repaid. Facing a burgeoning demand, Vicencias would like to increase her working capital and raise her level of business in order to respond better to her customers.

loans.use: Buying sacks of wheat flour

loans.name: Rosario Karina

texts.es:
Rosario Karina V. B. tiene 37 años.  Es soltera vive con sus dos hijos Alex de 16 años, Génesis de 4 años  en el cantón de Ventanas en la provincia de los Ríos en la ciudadela Nueva Esperanza. 
Rosario es un socio de la ventanilla rural Nuevo Porvenir, se encuentra  en la ciudadela Nueva Esperanza perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla integran 10 socios,   en su gran mayoría se dedican a las actividades de comercio. 

Rosario trabaja en una fábrica y también se dedica a la venta de bisutería en plata. Realiza sus compras en la ciudad de Guayaquil cada 15 días, y las ventas lo realiza en el cantón Ventanas.

Solicita el préstamo para aumentar el negocio de bisutería. Piensa que el crédito le cambiaria en lo económico y en lo emocional. Su sueño es seguir con el negocio y con la ayuda de la Cooperativa. El desafió que enfrenta es la competencia. 

En sus tiempos libres le gusta trabajar y cuidar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosario Karina V. B. is 37 years old. She is a single mother of two: Alex is 16 years old and Genesis is 4 years old. They live in the community of Ventanas, in the province of Los Rios, Nueva Esperanza. 

Rosario is a member of the community bank named Nuevo Porvenir. It is located in the village of Nueva Esperanza in Ventanas. It is a community bank with 10 members, and the great majority of the members are merchants. 

Rosario works in a manufacturing plan but she also sells silver jewelry. She makes her purchases in Guayaquil every two weeks and she carries out her sales in Ventanas.

She requests a loan to supplement her jewelry inventory. She thinks that this loan will change her financially and emotionally. Her dream is to keep up her business and continue to be part of the community bank. The challenge she faces is the steep competition. 

In her spare time she enjoys working and looking after her children.

loans.use: To purchase silver jewelry for resale.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence N. lives in the Kawala neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school.  Florence has a business of selling bananas.  She has been in this business for over than 10 years and she works six days a week.  Florence sells her bananas at the market.    Florence has requested a loan for 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas.  Her major business challenges are seasonality and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to buy a plot of land and to start going to farmers directly.   Florence lives in a home, which she rents, and does not have access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: The Entrepreneurs Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal EMPRENDEDORES, en secuencia  9, está conformado por 11 personas, 10 mujeres y 1 varón, la mayoría D. las socias pertenecen a la Zona D. Villa Copacabana y Villa San Antonio, que están ubicados por el cruce D. villas. Las socias se dedican a la venta D. diversos productos como ser, ropa interior, cosméticos, venta en tienda D. abarrotes. En la secuencia anterior todas cancelaron muy bien sin problemas. Es un banco que se caracteriza por que todas las integrantes traen sus cuotas sin necesidad D. prestarse D. otras.
La Sra. Esperanza Es la presidenta del banco, elegida democráticamente por sus compañeras por ser una D. las mas responsables y no falto a ninguna D. las reuniones, se dedica a la venta y distribución D. víveres y otros productos alimenticios en distintas instituciones y colegios, cuenta con esta actividad hace 8 años, el préstamo será destinado a los pedidos D. víveres por mayor.  
La Sra. Zenobia  Socia que continua en el cargo D. tesorera del banco, se dedica a la venta y distribución D. víveres en diferentes lugares ya sea en instituciones o pedidos a domicilios se dedica a esta actividad hace 5 años, el préstamo esta destinado a la incremento D. capital. La socia es soltera tiene 3 hijos, asume el cargo por su  responsabilidad que ha demostrado dentro del banco como garante y como compañera D. grupo. 
la Sra. Tania, es elegida como secretaria , es una integrante nueva y joven asume el cargo por su característica D. coadyuvar en los tramites del grupo y por su talento en la redacción se dedica a la venta D. tucumanas por la zona D. Miraflores.  El préstamo esta destinado para incrementar su capital. Casada con el señor Giovanni, vive en la casa D. sus Papas. Su meta es abrir un restaurante en el cruce D. villa Copacabana.en la foto no se encuentra el Sr. Rodrigo.
texts.en:
The community bank named "The Entrepreneurs" is on their ninth loan cycle and it is maD. up of 11 members; 10 women and 1 man. The majority of the members live in the Villa Copacabana region and San Antonio region. They are both located near Cruce D. Villas. The members sell various types of products, such as: undergarments, cosmetics, and groceries. In the previous loan cycle all of the members successfully repaid their loans without any problems. In this community bank the members are able to make their own payments without having to recur to others for help. 

Esperanza is the leader of the community bank. She was democratically elected by the other members. And she was chosen for being one of the most responsible people and she had not missed any of the meetings. She sells and distributes groceries and other food products to various institutions and schools. She has had this business for 8 years and the loan she requests will be used to purchase products in wholesale. 

Zenobia is a member who has always been the treasurer of the bank. She sells and distributes groceries to various places, either to institutions or to private homes where orders had been placed. She is a single mother of 3. She has assumed this responsibility having demonstrated her ability as a manager and as a member of the team. 

Tania was elected as the secretary. She is a new and young member of the group who helps with the group's business; she has a talent for writing.  She sells savory turnovers in the region of Miraflores. The loan will be used as working capital. She is married with Giovanni and they live in her parents' home. Her goal is to open a restaurant in the downtown area of Villa Copacabana. Rodrigo is not pictured in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Hector Luis

texts.es:
Héctor Luís L. B. tiene 19 años.  Es soltero vive con su mama sus dos hijos Layesca de 2 años, Héctor de 2 meses  en el cantón de Ventanas en la provincia de los Ríos en la ciudadela Nueva Esperanza. 

Héctor es un socio de la ventanilla rural Nuevo Porvenir, se encuentra  en la ciudadela Nueva Esperanza perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla integran 10 socios,   en su gran mayoría se dedican a las actividades de comercio. 

Héctor trabaja en la bananera Noboa y también le gusta pescar y salir a vender para obtener otros ingresos extras. Realiza sus compras y ventas en el mercado de la localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para ponerse un local para la venta de su pescado. Piensa que el crédito le cambiaria en lo económico y personal. Su sueño es tener casa, carro y superarse en la vida. El desafió que enfrenta es la superación. 
En sus tiempos libres le gusta jugar bolley, fútbol.
texts.en:
Hector Luis L. B. is 19 years old. He is single and he lives with his mother and his two children: Layesca is 2 years old and Hector is 2 months old. They live in the region of Ventanas, in the province of Los Rios within the Nueva Esperanza region. 

Hector is a member of the community bank named "Nuevo Porvenir". It is located in the region of Nueva Esperanza in Ventanas. This community bank is made up of 10 members. The great majority of the members are merchants.

Hector works in the Noboa banana company and he also enjoys fishing and selling as additional sources of income. He makes his purchase and carries out his sales in the local market. 

He requests a loan to set up a stand from where to sell fish. He thinks this loan will change his finances and impact on him personally. His dream is to have a house of his own, a car, and to improve himself in life. His personal challenge is for self-improvement. 

In his spare time he enjoys playing volleyball and soccer.

loans.use: To purchase a stand to sell fish.

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en:
Kevin K. lives in the Bukasa neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda. A married mother of six children, four of whom are in school, Kevin has operated a fish-selling business for six years, working six days per week. She sells her fish at the market on a retail basis and is now requesting a loan of 300,000/- Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more baskets of fish.

Kevin’s business challenges include transportation and rotting of fish. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only and to get a plot of land. She lives in a home that she rents and has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more baskets of fish

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ategbeh Town Traders Group

texts.en:
Osman K. (pictured in the left) is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Osman was born in Waterloo, a small town in western Sierra Leone where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with SMT to start a branch. Osman is twenty-six years old. He is married to a businesswoman and they have one child. 

For six years now, Osman has been selling slippers, groundnuts, biscuits, etc. Osman has applied for a loan of SLL 500,000 from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to expand his business. He will buy slippers, groundnuts, biscuits, etc. in large quantity to add to his current stock.

loans.use: Buy slippers, groundnuts, biscuits, etc. in large quantity to add to his current stock

loans.name: Reine Blanche S.

texts.fr: H. Reine Blanche S. est née le 07 Septembre 1980 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Reine Blanche vit depuis vingt huit ans à Agbalilamè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Mariée à ADONON Théodore un enseignant, Reine Blanche est mère de trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Reine Blanche vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple se partage les différentes charges familiales. Reine Blanche a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Depuis une dizaine d’année, Reine Blanche vend divers produits (produits de soins et de beauté, piles, stylos, papiers d’emballage, etc.) à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Reine Blanche vend du yaourt. Reine Blanche achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est la troisième fois que Reine Blanche sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un concours financier, en vue de rehausser le niveau de son activité et d’accroître sa clientèle et donc son chiffre d’affaire.
texts.en: Reine Blanche S. H. was born on September 7, 1980 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Reine Blanche has been living for 28 years in Agbalilame, in the community of Sémè-Poddji. Married to Théodore Adonon, a teacher, Reine Blanche is the mother of three; some of her children who to school. Reine Blanch lives together with her husband and children. The spouses take care of the family needs jointly. Riene Blanche stopped her studies after secondary level. For about a dozen years, Reine Blanche has been selling smiscellaneous  items (personal care and beauty products, batteries, ballpoint pens, wrapping paper etc). As a secondary activity, she also sells yougurt. Reine Blanch stocks up in Dantokpa, at the international market of Benin. This is the third time that Reine Blanche is requesting a loan from ALIDé in order to expand her business, increasing her customer base and thus her profits.

loans.use: Purchasing miscellaneous products (tooth paste, lotions, hair straighteners,  other personal care products, batteries, etc.)

loans.name: Wilson Franklin

texts.es: Wilson Franklin F.
texts.en:
Wilson Franklin Fernandez Alvarez is 32 years old. He lives together with his partner and they have two children together: Naydeli is 5 years old and Jamely is 3 years old. They live in the community of Ventanas within the province of Los Rios in the Nueva Esperanza region. 

Wilson is a member of the community bank named Nuevo Porvenir. It is located in the region of Nueva Esperanza in Ventanas. This community bank is made up of 10 members. The great majority of the members are merchants. 

Wilson is an automotive mechanic. He makes his purchases at the paint depot in Ventanas. 

He requests a loan to invest in his business. He believes this loan will help him improve his household. His dream is to have a home of his own. His greatest challenge is the competition in the field.

In his spare time he enjoys raising livestock (pigs and chickens).

loans.use: To invest in his business.

loans.name: Selene

texts.es:
Selene tiene 28 años, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos. Actualmente, Selene vive en la comunidad de Compone del distrito de Anta provincia de Anta del departamento del Cusco. La comunidad de Compone se encuentra ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco donde la mayoría de pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería. Selene alterna las actividades del hogar con las actividades de su negocio. Su actividad económica principal de Selene es el comercio pues vende leche y queso. Selene también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, gallinas, chanchos, etc. 

Selene desde hace mucho tiempo que participa en el banco comunal “San Isidro de Compone” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Selene con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de S/. 1300 nuevos soles, ella invertirá el dinero en comprar animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes.

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Selene is 28 years old and she lives with her partner and their two children. Selene lives in the community of Compone in the district of Anta in Cusco. The community of Compone is located 45 minutes from the city of Cusco and the population is made up of agriculturists and farmers. Selena manages her home and her business every day. Her business is selling milk and cheese. Selene also raises livestock such as guinea pigs, chickens, pigs, etc.

Selene has for a very long time been a member of the community bank of San Isidro de Compone. It is a member organization of Microfinanzas Arariwa (Kiva Field Partner) in the city of Cusco in Peru. Selene with her loan of 1300 nuevos soles will invest in the purchase of small livestock, such as guinea pigs. 

She is very thankful for the opportunity and she is committed to the payment terms of this loan.

loans.use: To purchase small livestock.

loans.name: Mitzy

texts.es: Mitzy, de 31 años, vive a lado de su esposo Juan de 32 años, que es confeccionista  y de sus 2 hijos menores, juntos se esfuerzan cada día para salir adelante. Desde hace 1 año, esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la venta de ropa y la modalidad de su trabajo es la siguiente: compra ropa al por mayor en un gran emporio comercial de la ciudad y trae por pedidos a los  clientes de su zona. Esta muy satisfecha por su trabajo ya que no tiene un horario fijo lo que le permite no descuidar la crianza de sus hijos; además ofrece algunas prendas que confecciona su esposo en el taller donde labora. Sin embargo no le gusta cuando sus clientes le hacen pedidos y luego desisten, lo que le ocasiona que debe colocar su mercadería a otras personas; pero a pesar de las dificultades sigue adelante pues quiere progresar. Como es una mujer emprendedora para el fututo quiere instalar un negocio propio ya que desea mejorar sus ganancias. Es el primer crédito con MFP, y promete cancelar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este préstamo que les permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso; también esta muy contenta con el desempeño de su grupo pues esta integrado por personas solidarias y responsables como ella. Mitzy tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mercadería de ropa, pues tiene varios pedidos pendientes por cumplir y espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Mitzy is 31 years old and she lives together with her husband and their two young children. Her husband Juan is 32 years old and he is tailor.  Together they work hard every day to make ends meet. For the past year, this enterprising woman has been selling clothing. Her business is conducted in the following way: clothing is purchased in wholesale at a large shopping district in the city and buys merchandise to fill orders placed by clients in her community. She is very happy with her work because she doesn't have a fixed schedule which is very useful while raising her children. She is also able to sell some of the clothing items that her husband makes in his shop.  She doesn't appreciate it when orders placed are then rejected by the clients, forcing her to sell to other persons. But despite the difficulties she is able to progress in her business. She is en enterprising person and in the future she wants to have her own store in order to improve her earnings. This is her first loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is committed to making her payments on time. She does not want to cause hardship for the other members of the team especially because it is through them that she is able to continue her business. She is also very happy with her group because they are team players and very responsible, like she is. Mitzy plans on investing her loan in the purchase of clothing to fill various outstanding orders. She hopes to see an improvement in her income.

loans.use: To purchase clothing.

loans.name: Humberto Eduardo

texts.es:
Humberto Eduardo Espinaza Powell  tiene 50 años.  Vive en unión libre con su señora tiene tres hijos Jeyson de 23  años, Heidi de 20 años y Eduardo de 1 año siete meses de edad  en el cantón de Ventanas en la provincia de los Ríos en la ciudadela Nueva Esperanza. 

Humberto es un socio de la ventanilla rural Nuevo Porvenir, se encuentra  en la ciudadela Nueva Esperanza perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla integran 10 socios,   en su gran mayoría se dedican a las actividades de comercio. 

Humberto trabaja como constructor, además tiene un negocio de salón de cervecería.  Realiza sus compras en la cervecería Pilsener de ventanas.

Solicita el préstamo para incrementar su negocio del salón de cervecería y comprar una maquina soldadora para los trabajos de constructor.  Piensa que el crédito le cambiaria le ayudara al crecimiento de su hogar. Su sueño es seguir trabajando para ir prosperando en su hogar. El desafió que enfrenta es que de pronto le hagan competencia. 
En sus tiempos libres se a jugar indor fútbol y alzar pesas.
texts.en:
Humberto Eduardo E. Powell is 50 years old. He lives together with his partner and their three children: Jeyson is 23 years old, Heidi is 20 years old, and Eduardo is 19 months old. They live in the community of Ventanas within the Los Rios province in Nueva Esperanza.

Humberto is a member of the community bank Nuevo Porvenir. It is located in the community of Nueva Esperanza in Ventanas. This group is made up of 10 members, the great majority of whom are merchants.

Humberto works as a construction worker. He also has a bar. He purchases Pilsner brand beer in the city of Ventanas. 

He requests a loan to supplement his bar and to purchase a soldering iron for his construction business. He believes this loan will help him with the support of his homestead. His dream is to keep working and to keep prosperity within the home.  His greatest challenge is facing steep competition. 

In his spare time he enjoys playing indoor soccer and weightlifting.

loans.use: To supply his bar and to purchase a soldering iron.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret B. lives in the Makerere neighborhood in Kampala, Uganda.  She is widowed and has seven children, all of whom attend school.  Margaret has a business of selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works seven days a week. Margaret sells her products door-to-door.   Margaret has requested a loan for 70,0000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy bags of charcoal.     She also generates additional income with a food stall.  Margaret's main business challenges are transportation and thieves.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and to buy a plot of land.   Margaret lives in a home, which she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food for her family.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Jantetelco Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Jantetelco, se encuentra localizado en la comunidad de Jantetelco, en el estado de Morelos, México, este grupo está conformado por 6 integrantes mujeres que se conocen y son vecinas ellas son la señora Misael B. N. y va a comprar con su préstamo ropa por mayoreo para vender y un poco de zapatos vende por catalogo, la señora Norma C. R. va a comprar perfumes, labiales etc., la señora Carlota E. J. va a comprar todo tipo de dulces para vender, frijol, zapatos vende por catalogo, la señora Eva Rodríguez A. va a comprar productos de belleza, ropa, etc., la señora Buenaventura S. Lena va a comprar forraje alimento para sus vacas, la señora Minerva R. E. va a comprar zapatos en catalogo para vender. La señora Eva Rodríguez A. es integrante del grupo Jantetelco, ella tiene 45 años de edad, estudio en la normal para maestra de primaria terminando de estudiar la secundaria entro en la normal de Puebla estudio 4 años para maestra, ella tiene 3 hijos Javier tiene 22 años de edad apenas se recibió, Joselin tiene 21 años de edad es soltera estudia en la universidad sicología y un curso de ingles, Iván tiene 10 años de edad está estudiando la primaria, la señora Eva solicito su préstamo para invertir en el negocio de cosméticos y artículos para el hogar, su negocio es ambulante sale a ofrecer sus productos, también la van a ver a su casa cuando quieren algo para regalo, sus clientes son sus vecinos, conocidos y familiares, los productos que les ofrece a sus clientes son cosméticos, perfumes, labiales, desodorantes, cremas, barniz, rímel y artículos para el hogar, bajillas, baterías, cucharas, sobrecamas, sabanas. Ella inicio con el negocio hace 20 años desde que estaba soltera, su mama también se dedicaba a este negocio y ella le enseño y le animo, ella estudiaba entre semana y los sábados y domingos salía a ofrecer los productos con sus conocidos, adquirió su negocio con las ganancias fue comprando mercancía y ahorita para crecer más con los apoyos de los créditos y está muy contenta con este préstamo que le proporciona por que va a surtirse de mercancía. Su negocio es importante porque gana dinero y se distrae hay de todo se ríe, se enoja y lo que más le gusta es convivir con las personas, le proporciona gran satisfacción tener un dinero de mas, su negocio es popular sus clientes la recomiendan a más personas, los desafíos que enfrenta son los costos no siempre es el mismo precio, suben los precios, las ganancias las vuelve a reinvertir y en alguna cosa que le gusta, ella está planeando ampliarlo meter otras cosas que no vende ,meter mercancía diferentes como calzado y lo pieza lograr echándole mas ganas vendiendo mas. Este negocio le ha ayudado en lo económico le ha podido dar estudios a sus hijos, arreglar su casa y sus sueños son que siga creciendo el negocio y su hijo el chico que siga estudiando para que tenga una carrera, ahorita como quiera ya están saliendo sus hijos más grandes.  Jantetelco es un lugar bonito, es fresco, tranquilo, hay mucha vegetación, hacen dulces cristalizados como el camote, el jamoncillo, chilacayote. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decir a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad ”gracias por su apoyo ya que su ayuda a que sigan creciendo los negocio”.
texts.en:
The name of this group is Jantetelco and it is located in the community of Jantetelco in the state of Morelos, Mexico. This group is made up of 6 women who are all known to each other as neighbors. 

Misael B. N. is a member and she will use her loan to purchase clothing in wholesale and shoes from a catalogue. 

Norma C. R. will purchase perfumes and makeup. 

Carlota E. J. will purchase all kinds of candies for resale and she will also purchase beans and shoes. 

Eva R. A. will purchase beauty products, clothing etc. 

Mrs. Buenaventura S. Lena will purchase feed for her cattle. 

Minerva R. E. will purchase shoes from a catalogue to resell. 

Eva R. A. is a member of the Jantetelco group and she is 45 years old. She started out from very young to train to be a teacher. When she finished high school she studied 4 years in teacher's college. She has 3 children: Javier is 22 years old and has graduated high school; Joselin is 21 years old, she is single and she is studying Sociology and English in university; and Ivan is 10 years old and he is in primary school. Eva requested a loan to invest in her cosmetics business and to purchase articles for the home. She travels door to door selling her products but clients also come to her home when they need to purchase a gift. Her clients are her neighbors, her acquaintances, and her family. She sells products such as cosmetics, perfumes, lipsticks, deodorants, skin creams, nail polish, Rimel brand products and household articles such as dinnerware, batteries, spoons and bedding.  She started her business 20 years ago when she was still single. Her mother was also in this business and she showed her and grew interested. She went to school during the week and on Saturdays and Sunday she would go out to sell her products to her clients. She set up her business with her own savings. She started to buy merchandise and today she is able to expand her business even more with the help of these loans. She is very happy to receive this loan because she will be able to add variety to her inventory. Her business is important because she is able to earn money and it is a distraction for her. She laughs, she cries, but the best part about the work is being in contact with other. She gets great satisfaction for have money. Her business is popular and clients recommend others to come. The challenge she faces is having to deal with fluctuating prices.  Sometimes prices go up. She reinvests her earnings in something she enjoys. She is planning to expand the variety in what she sells. She wants to start selling shoes and to reach her goal she will sell more with even greater fervor. This business has helped her financially and she has been able to send her children to school and bring about some renovations to their home.  Her dream is to see her business expand even more. She also dreams of seeing her youngest son continue going to school to have a career.  In whichever way possible her two eldest kids are almost ready to be independent. 

Jantetelco is a beautiful place, cool and tranquil with a great deal of vegetation. They make candies from yams, milk, and berries. The members of this group wish to covey a note of thanks to Kiva and Fundacion Realidad for the support provided to them for the development of their business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es: Sara, de 21 años, vive en casa de sus tíos en compañía de ellos y de sus primos. Es una joven muy trabajadora que se esfuerza por salir adelante. El día esta joven empieza muy temprano, pues labora como cajera en un centro comercial, desde 9 de la mañana hasta  las 9 de la noche durante 6 días a la semana y solo descansa durante 1 día. Sin embargo todos los días debe hacer un largo viaje hasta su trabajo, continúa adelante ya que tiene muchos proyectos en mente. Aunque no tiene mucho tiempo libre trata de continuar con su negocio de venta de ropa, pues tiene algunas clientes que le sacan la mercadería a crédito, y ella se abastece de ropa al por mayor en un gran emporio comercial de la ciudad. Dice que ambas labores le generan considerables ganancias que le permiten mantenerse sola y para el futuro quiere instalar su propio negocio, pero aún no decide a que rubro se dedicará. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete cumplir con sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este préstamo que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Sara tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de mercadería en ropa para la temporada veraniega que ya se acerca, ya que quiere ofrecerles lo mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en: Sara is 21 years old and she lives with her aunt and uncle and cousins. She is a hard working young woman and she is endeavoring to come out ahead. Her day starts very early as a cashier in a shopping centre, working from 9 in the morning until 9 at night, 6 days a week. She only gets a 1 hour break all day.  She needs to travel a long way to get to her work but she keeps it up because she has many plans in mind.  Although she doesn't have much spare time she plans on continuing on with her clothing business. She has some clients who buy from her on credit.  She purchases her clothing in wholesale from a large outlet in the city. She says that both of her jobs generate considerable income for her which allows her to support herself. In the future she wants to set up her own business but she doesn't really know in what field exactly she wants to specialize.  This is the first loan she accesses from MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is compromised to the terms of this loan. She doesn't want to cause any hardship to all those individuals who made this loan possible. This will permit her to keep working and progressing. Sara plans on investing her loan in the purchase of a large quantity of clothing for the upcoming season, wanting to offer her clients a large variety.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for the coming season.

loans.name: Angela Mayra

texts.es:
Ángela  Mayra Alarcón P.  tiene 27 años.  Es casada y vive con su esposo tiene cuatro hijos Alberto de 9  años, Estefanía de 8 años,  Jorge  de 7 años y Ismael de 1 año 3 meses  de edad  en el cantón de Ventanas en la provincia de los Ríos en la ciudadela Nueva Esperanza. 

Ángela es una socia de la ventanilla rural Nuevo Porvenir, se encuentra  en la ciudadela Nueva Esperanza perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla integran 10 socios,   en su gran mayoría se dedican a las actividades de comercio. 

Ángela trabaja en la agricultura y tiene un negocio de venta de Chuzos.  Realiza sus compras en el mercado de la localidad y vende en la ciudadela donde vive.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en una tienda de víveres y abarrotes.  Piensa que el crédito le cambiaria su vida porque pondría una tienda en el lugar donde vive. Su sueño es ver a sus hijos que terminen sus estudios y viajar a las playas de Esmeraldas. Al momento dice no tener desafíos. 
En sus tiempos le gusta coser ropa.
texts.en:
Angela Mayra A. P. is 27 years old. She is married and she lives together with her husband and their four children: Alberto is 9 years old, Estafania is 8 years old, Jorge is 7 years old, and Ismael is 15 months old. They live in the community of Ventanas within the Los Rios province in Nueva Esperanza. 

Angela is a member of the community bank named Nuevo Porvenir. It is located in the community of Nueva Esperanza in Ventanas. There are 10 members in this group and the great majority of them are merchants. 

Angela is an agriculturist and she sells prepared meat skewers. She makes her purchases in the market and she carries out her sales in the same city where she lives. 

She requests a loan to set up a general store. She feels that this loan will change her life because she will be able to have a store in her home. Her dream is to see her children complete their education and to travel to the beaches in Esmeraldas. She says she doesn't face any particular challenges at this time. 

In her spare time she likes to sew.

loans.use: To set up a grocery store.

loans.name: G. Blandine

texts.fr: A. G. Blandine est née le 31 Mai 1984 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Blandine n’est pas encore mariée et n’a pas d’enfant. Blandine vit donc seule  à Lokokoukoumè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, depuis environs vingt et un an. Blandine a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Blandine mène comme activité la vente de divers produits (riz, farine de manioc, insecticides, savons, biscuits, mèches, etc.) depuis près de cinq ans. Blandine achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin et les vend à son domicile. Blandine a déjà obtenu auprès de ALIDé, deux crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Aujourd’hui, Blandine désire augmenter le stock de ses produits afin d’accroître sa clientèle et de mieux répondre à leurs différentes exigences ; raison pour laquelle Blandine sollicite pour la troisième fois un appui financier de ALIDé.
texts.en: G. Blandine A. was born on May 31, 1984 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Blandine is not yet married and doesn’t have children. She lives alone in Lokokoukoume, in the community of   Sémè-Podji, where she has lived for about 21 years already. Blandine stopped her studies at the secondary level. In order to support herself, for the last five year she has been  selling various products (rise, manioc flour, insecticides, soap, cookies, hair extensions etc). Blandine stocks up at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and sells out of her home. Blandien already had two previous loans from ALIDé and repaid them well. At present, Blandine would like to increase her stock in order to increase her customer base and better meet different customers’ needs, which is hwy she is seeking a third loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: Purchasing various products (soap, cookies, hair extensions, rice,  manioc flour, etc.)

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
H. M. Carlos Alberto  tiene 25 años.  Vive en unión libre con su señora tiene una hija Carla de 3  años en el cantón  de Ventanas en la provincia de los Ríos en la ciudadela Nueva Esperanza. 

H. es un socio de la ventanilla rural Nuevo Porvenir, se encuentra  en la ciudadela Nueva Esperanza perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla integran 10 socios,   en su gran mayoría se dedican a las actividades de comercio. 

H. trabaja en la bananera y también se dedica a la venta de ropa.  Realiza sus compras en la ciudad de guayaquil y las ventas en el cantón de Ventanas.

Solicita el préstamo para incrementar su negocio de ropa.  Piensa que el crédito  le ayudara a dar una mejor vida a su familia. Su sueño es seguir trabajando para ir prosperando en su hogar. El desafió que enfrenta es  la competencia de los almacenes. 
En sus tiempos libres le gusta jugar naipe y trabajar.
texts.en:
H. M. Carlos Alberto is 25 years old.  He lives with his common-law wife and has a 3 year-old daughter called Carla.  They live in the Nueva Esperanza neighborhood, in the Ventanas district, in the province of los Ríos.

H. is a member of the Nuevo Porvenir (New Future) solidarity group which is in the Nueva Esperanza neighborhood of Ventanas.  This group has 10 members who are mostly in the business of buying and selling.

H. works in the banana industry and also sells clothes.  He makes his purchases in the city of Guayaquil and sells in the Ventanas district.

He is requesting this loan to expand his clothes business.  He believes that the loan will help him provide his family with a better life.  His dream is to continue working in order to be successful. The challenge which he faces is the competition from warehouses.  In his spare time he likes to play cards and work.

loans.use: To expand his clothes business

loans.name: Perfume De Gardenias Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama “ Perfume de Gardenias”, este grupo esta integrado por 10 clientas en este grupo se encuentra la señora Celia U. H. de 49 años de edad, nos platica que estudió carrera comercial en secretariado pero nunca la ejerció ya que se casó, hace 10 años decidieron poner su negocio de costura para poder sacar adelante a su familia, al principio fue difícil como en todo negocio que comienza, hasta que poco a poco se fueron haciendo de su cartera de clientes que dentro de la misma colonia los fueron  recomendando, poco a poco su negocio fue creciendo y las ganancias fueron incrementando,  la familia adquirió otra máquina para producir un mayor número de prendas y su producto fuera de mayor calidad. Los hijos de las integrantes de este grupo son su fuente de inspiración, el crédito lo quieren para invertir en sus negocios, su inquietud siempre ha sido que a sus hijos no les falte nada, y que su negocio crezca y sea cada vez más reconocido en su colonia.
texts.en:
This group is called “Perfume de Gardenias". It is made up of 10 clients.  One member of the group is Mrs. Celia U. H., who is 49 years old. She tells us that she studied business at a secretary school but she never practiced it because she married. Ten years ago she decided to open a business sewing to get her family ahead. At the beginning it was difficult like in every business at the beginning.  Little by little she was able to build her clientele in her own neighborhood. They would recommend her, and little by little her business grew and the earnings increased. The family acquired another machine to produce a greater number of pieces and to have a better quality product. 

The children of the group members are their inspiration source. They will use the loan to invest in their businesses. Their worry has always been for their children not to lack for anything and for their businesses to grow and be more well known in the neighborhood.

loans.use: To invest in their businesses

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah N.  lives in the Makerere neighborhood in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has six children, four of whom attend school.  Sarah  has a business of selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works six days a week. Sarah sells her products at the market.   Sarah has requested a loan for  60,0000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy bags of charcoal.  She also generates additional income by selling snacks such as chips and sausages.  Sarah's main business challenges include transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are  to own a delivery van and to buy a plot of land.  Sarah lives in a home, which she rents; she has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent, and food for her family.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Hazina

texts.en: Hazina is 37 years old, married. and has five children, all of whom attend school. Her husband buys and sells goods in the local market.  Hazina sells cooking oil, potatoes, and cassava flour, which she has been doing for 15 years. With the loan she will buy more cassava flour, potatoes, and cooking oil. The profit from the business will be used to renovate her house. Her business is successful because she has good customer relations. She would eventually like to have a big shop so that she can supply additional products to her customers.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, cassava flour, and potatoes to sell

loans.name: Augustine's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is pleased to present to you teachers of the Peninsula Secondary School, in Waterloo, a small town, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with SMT to start a branch. This school was founded by the Seventh Day Adventists (SDA) in 1961. The school is staffed with thirty-six teachers and has 1,000 pupils. 

These hard-working and dedicated teachers have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org to seek a loan of SLL 8,700,000. With the help of this loan, these teachers can embark on some meaningful project that their mere salaries alone can not do. Some of them will use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, others to buy house-building materials; some buy a piece of land or pay school fees for their children, while some of them will invest the loan in business. 

Augustine R. is the leader of this group of teachers. Born in the village of Monkanji, Augustine is today residing in Waterloo together with his wife and one child. Augustine is requesting for a loan of SLL 1,500,000 in order to pay his university fees.

loans.use: To pay his own university fees

loans.name: Carlos Darwin

texts.es:
Carlos Darwin F. V.  tiene 27 años.  Vive en unión libre con su señora en la casa de su mama, tiene una hija Sarike F. de 3  años en el cantón  de Ventanas en la provincia de los Ríos en la ciudadela Nueva Esperanza. 

Carlos es un socio de la ventanilla rural Nuevo Porvenir, se encuentra  en la ciudadela Nueva Esperanza perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla integran 10 socios,   en su gran mayoría se dedican a las actividades de comercio. 

Carlos trabaja en la bananera y también posee una tienda pequeña de abarrotes.  Realiza sus compras en Ventanas en el comercial Loaza.

Solicita el préstamo para incrementar su tienda de abarrotes.  Piensa que el crédito  le ayudara a mejor su nivel de vida ya que venderá mas. Su sueño es seguir trabajando y ponerse otro negocio para resolver todas sus necesidades. El desafió dice no tener al momento. 

En sus tiempos libres le gusta jugar boly.
texts.en:
Carlos Darwin F. V. is 27 years old.  He lives with his common-law wife in his mother's house.  He also has a 3 year-old daughter called Sarike F..  They live in the Nueva Esperanza neighborhood, in the district of Ventanas, in the province of los Ríos.

Carlos is a member of the Nuevo Porvenir (New Future) solidarity group which is in the Nueva Esperanza neighborhood of Ventanas.  This group has 10 members who are mostly in the business of buying and selling.

Carlos works in the banana industry and also owns a small grocery store.  He makes his purchases in Ventanas in the Loaza market.

He is requesting this loan to stock his grocery store.  He believes that the loan will help him to improve his quality of life because he will sell more.  His dream is to continue working and start another business so that he has enough to cover all his needs.  He says that he has no hardships at the moment.  In his spare time he likes to play volleyball.

loans.use: To stock his grocery store

loans.name: N. Viviane

texts.fr: A. N. Viviane est née le 10 Juin 1972 à Calavi. Mariée à ANANI Bertin, Viviane est mère de cinq enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Viviane vit avec sa famille depuis neuf ans à Lokokoukoumè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Viviane n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Viviane vend des mèches et des produits de beauté à son domicile. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Viviane achète ses produits. Viviane exerce cette activité depuis sept ans, et a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits, qui ont été tous bien remboursés. La clientèle de Viviane se fait de plus en plus nombreuse et Viviane désire augmenter son fonds de roulement afin de mieux les satisfaire et par ricochet d’accroître son revenu. C’est ce qui l’amène à solliciter un troisième crédit.
texts.en:
N. Viviane A. was born on June 10, 1972 in Calavi. Married to Bertin Anani, Viviane is the mother of five children, some of whom are in school. Viviane has lived with her family for nine years in Lokokoukoumè, in the community of Sèmè-Podji. The couple jointly pay the family's various expenses.

Viviane has never been to school. To meet her needs, Viviane sells hair extensions and beauty products from her home. She buys her supplies in Dantokpa, international market of Benin. 

Viviane has been in this business for seven years and has already received two loans, both of which were fully repaid. Viviane's customers are more and more numerous, and she would like to increase her working capital in order to better satisfy them and thus increase her income. This is why she is seeking a third loan.

loans.use: Purchase of hair extensions and beauty supplies

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr: N. Afiwa est née le 29 Janvier 1965 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Afiwa est mariée à AMOUHOUE Paul, un électricien bâtiment, et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille s’est installée depuis deux ans à Lokokoukoumè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Afiwa apporte une aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Afiwa n’a pas été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et aux besoins de ses enfants, Afiwa vend des céréales (maïs, riz, haricot), de la farine de manioc, et divers autres produits (conserves de tomate et de sardine, lait, couscous, pâtes alimentaires,  huile végétale, savons, etc.) dans sa boutique size à son domicile. Afiwa s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Afiwa exerce cette activité depuis huit ans et a déjà obtenu trois crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Dans le but d’agrandir davantage son activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Afiwa sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Afiwa N. was born January 29, 1965 in Cotonou, Benin's economic capital. Afiwa is married to Paul AMOUHOUE, a building electrician. She is a mother to three children, all in school. 

Two years ago, the family moved to Lokokoukoumè, in the commune of Sèmè-Podji. Afiwa assists her husband in supporting family. She never attended school. To support herself and provide for her children, she sells cereals (maize, rice, and beans), cassava flour, and various other products (canned tomatoes, canned sardines, milk, couscous, pasta, oil vegetable, soaps, etc.) from a shop in her home.  

Afiwa gets her stocks in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She has been engaged in this activity for eight years and has already obtained three loans from ALIDé, all fully repaid. 

In order to expand her business and better meet the needs of its customers, Afiwa is seeking a fourth loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: To purchase various products (cereals, canned tomatoes, canned sardines, milk, couscous, pasta, soap)

loans.name: Mariana Anabel

texts.es:
Mariana Anabel T. P.  tiene 29 años.  Vive en unión libre con su señora, tiene cuatro hijos Ana de 11 años, Isabel de 9 años, Roxana de 7 años y mariana de 3 años de edad en el cantón  de Ventanas en la provincia de los Ríos en la ciudadela Nueva Esperanza. 

Mariana es un socio de la ventanilla rural Nuevo Porvenir, se encuentra  en la ciudadela Nueva Esperanza perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla integran 10 socios,   en su gran mayoría se dedican a las actividades de comercio.
 
Mariana trabaja vendiendo productos YAMBAL y prendas de vestir a domicilio.  Realiza sus compras en Guayaquil y luego los vende en el cantón Ventanas.

Solicita el préstamo para incrementar sus productos.  Piensa que el crédito  le beneficiara con sus ingresos en el hogar y mejorar su nivel de vida. Su sueño en un futuro cercano tener casa propia para sus hijos y seguir siendo una mejor persona. El desafió que se pone es hacer mas grande su negocio surtiendo con mas productos para poder vender. 

En sus tiempos libres le gusta jugar básquet.
texts.en:
Mariana Anabel T. P. is 29 years old.  She lives with her common-law husband and has four children; 11 year-old Anabel, 9 year-old Isabel, 7 year-old Roxana and 3 year-old Mariana.  They live in the Nueva Esperanza neighborhood, in the district of Ventanas, in the province of Los Ríos.

Mariana is a member of the Nuevo Porvenir (New Future) solidarity group which is in the Nueva Esperanza neighborhood of Ventanas.  This group has 10 members who are mostly in the business of buying and selling.

Mariana works selling YAMBAL products and clothes door to door.  She makes her purchases in Guayaquil and then sells them in Ventanas.

She is requesting this loan in order to increase her stock.  She believes that the loan will help her with her household finances and improve her standard of living.  Her dream for the near future is to have her own house for her children and to continue being a better person.  The challenge which she sets herself is being able to expand her business and stock up on more products which she can sell.  In her spare time she likes playing basketball.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Safina

texts.en: Safina N. lives in the Kyebando neighborhood in Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has six children, all of whom attend school.  Safina has a business of selling and frying fish.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works seven days a week. Safina sells her products from home.   Safina has requested a loan for  600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more baskets of fish.  She also generates additional income through poultry farming.   Safina's main business challenges are transportation and the rainy season.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and to buy a plot of land.  Safina lives in a home, which she rents; she does not have access to electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent, and food for her family.

loans.use: To buy more baskets of fish

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es: Santiago, de 48 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposa María de 44 años y de sus 3 jóvenes hijos que estudian, juntos se esfuerzan cada día para salir adelante. Desde hace 10 años, este emprendedor hombre se dedica al comercio de diversas confecciones de ropa, y dice que las ganancias son regulares pues compra en la capital su mercadería a precios bajos y las transporta hasta diversas provincias. En los diversos lugares donde va vende a mayor precio las confecciones y esta muy satisfecho, pues de a pocos ha ido adquiriendo clientela, quienes saben de la calidad de las confecciones que Santiago ofrece. Manifiesta además que le gusta mucho su negocio pues los viajes le permiten distraerse, y aunque trabaja solo, tiene deseos de poder transportar mayor cantidad de mercadería y ampliar las fronteras de su negocio, para ello tiene pensado contratar a un ayudante. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este préstamo que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Santiago tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería en diversas confecciones porque ya quiere empezar ampliar el negocio y mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Santiago is 48 years old.  He lives in his own home with his 44 year-old wife María and his three young children who are all in school.  They work hard every day to get ahead in life.  For 10 years this entrepreneur has been working buying and selling different clothing fashions.  He says that the income is steady since he buys his goods in the capital for a low price then transports them to different provinces.  In the different places he travels to, he sells the garments at a higher price and he is very satisfied because he has been acquiring a customer base which is aware of the quality of the fashions which he offers.  He says that he likes his business a lot because he enjoys the trips he makes.  Although he works alone, he would like to be able to carry more goods and expand his business.  For this reason, he would like to hire an assistant.

This will be the second loan Santiago has had from MFP and he pledges to make his repayments in a timely manner because he doesn't want to give a bad impression to the people who, through funding his loan, will help him to continue working in search of progress.  Santiago plans to invest the loan in the purchase of a larger quantity of garments because he wants to begin to expand his business and improve his income.

loans.use: Purchase of more garments in different fashions.

loans.name: We Go Able Group

texts.en:
Mohamed S. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Mohamed was born in Masimera village about fifty years ago. He is married to a businesswoman and he has thirteen children, ten of whom are still attending school. For over thirty years now, he has been a businessman, and he sells house-building materials.

They are seeking a loan of SLL 3,900,000 in order to boost their respective businesses. With the help of this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Mohamed S. will use his share of the loan (SLL 1,200,000) to buy a large number of house-building materials to add to his business inventory.

loans.use: Buy a large number of house-building materials to add to his business inventory

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz, D. 41 años, vive al lado D. su esposo Rubén D. 48 años y D. sus 3 jóvenes hijos, que son mayores D. edad, y juntos se esfuerzan cada día para salir adelante. DesD. hace 2 años, esta emprendedora mujer instaló en su casa un negocio D. alquiler D. cabinas D. Internet. Empieza su labor desD. las 9 D. la mañana y se prolonga hasta las 10 D. la noche; y esta muy satisfecha pues sus hijos la apoyan en la atención cuando ella debe salir. Aunque el negocio es tranquilo, manifiesta que es algo sacrificado, pues muchas veces sus clientes le piden que deje abierto el local hasta tarD., pero por las buenas ganancias que obtiene, trata D. sacrificarse y continuar trabajando para ayudar a su esposo en los constantes gastos del hogar. Con el pasar del tiempo ha captado buenos clientes que la visitan seguido, además ha logrado implementar mejor sus cabinas D. Internet. Como siempre planea el futuro ampliar el negocio, asimismo quiere instalar un local D. alquiler D. videojuegos. Es el décimo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este préstamo que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Luz  tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra D. 2 videojuegos para empezar con el futuro negocio con el que asegura mejorará sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Luz is 41 years old.  She lives with her 48 year-old husband Rubén and her 3 grown-up children.  They work hard every day to get ahead in life.  Two years ago this entrepreneurial woman set up an Internet café in her house.  She starts working at 9 o'clock in the morning and works until 10 o'clock at night.  She is very happy because her children help to mind the business when she has to go out.  Although the business is relaxed, she says that she has to make sacrifices because very often her customers ask her to stay open until late.  However, because she makes a good income, she tries to make these sacrifices and continues to work in order to help her husband with the constant household expenses.  Over time, she has attracted good customers who keep coming back.  She has also managed to set up her Internet stations better.  In the future, she is planning to expand her business and she also wants to set up a video game rental place.

This will be the tenth loan which Luz has had from MFP and she pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner because she does not want to give a bad impression to the people who, through funding her loan, will allow her to continue working in search of progress.  Luz plans to invest the loan in the purchase of 2 video games in order to begin her future business which she says she will improve her income.

loans.use: To purchase two video games in order to set up her business

loans.name: Pélagie

texts.fr: H. Pélagie est née le 15 Octobre 1983 et est mariée à HOUNKANRIN Justin. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Pélagie vit avec sa famille depuis quatre ans environs au quartier Irédé à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Pélagie vient en aide à son mari en ce qui concerne les charges familiales, grâce au revenu que lui apporte son activité. Pélagie a très peu fréquenté l’école. Depuis une dizaine d’année, Pélagie vend des produits cosmétiques à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Pélagie s’approvisionne à Lomé au Togo, État voisin du Bénin. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant obtenu auparavant trois crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre aux multiples exigences de sa clientèle, Pélagie sollicite un quatrième prêt.
texts.en: Pélagie H. was born on 15 October 1983, and is married to Justin Hounkanrin. The couple have three children, all of whom are in school. Pélagie has lived with her family for about four years in the Irédé area of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Pélagie helps her husband in providing for the family, thanks to the income her business brings. She has had very little schooling. For about ten years, Pélagie has been selling cosmetics at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. She gets her supplies in Lomé, Togo, a country bordering Benin. She is a longstanding client of ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), having previously obtained three loans, all of which were repaid properly. With the goal of strengthening her business and better responding to the multiple demands of her clientele, Pélagie is seeking a fourth loan.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, deodorants, and other cosmetics.

loans.name: Hoflade A. Rosine

texts.fr: T. Hoflade A. Rosine est née le 27 Mars 1977 et est mariée à ZOUNMENOU Gilbert, un transitaire. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille vit depuis une quinzaine d’année au quartier Ayélawadjè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Rosine vient en aide à son mari et assure avec lui les charges de la famille, grâce au revenu de son activité.  Rosine n’a pas fréquenté l’école, mais a appris la coiffure. Parallèlement à cette activité qu’elle mène passionnément, Rosine vend des mèches, des tissus et des produits de cheveux dans son atelier. Rosine achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est la quatrième fois que Rosine sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un appui financier, en vue de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Les trois premiers crédits ont été tous bien remboursés.
texts.en: Hoflade A. Rosine T. was born on 27 March 1977, and is married to Gilbert Zounmenou, a shipping agent. The couple have two children, both of whom are in school. The family has lived for about 15 years in the Ayélawadjè area of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Rosine helps her husband and joins him in providing for the family, thanks to the income from her business. She never attended school, but did learn how to be a hairstylist. Alongside this hairstyling business that she runs with passion, Rosine sells hair extensions, fabric, and hair products at her workshop. She buys these products at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. This is the fourth time that Rosine is seeking a loan with ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), with the goal of strengthening her business and better satisfying her clientele. The three previous loans were all repaid properly.

loans.use: To buy hair extensions and hair products

loans.name: Dora

texts.es: Dora, de 42 años, vive en casa de su madre al lado de ella, sus hermanas, sus sobrinos y de sus 3 hijos de los cuales solo el último es menor de edad y juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante. Desde hace 1 año, esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado; pero trabaja con la modalidad de pedido. Es decir sus clientes le piden algún modelo en especial de ropa o calzado y ella se los trae, luego les cobra a crédito con un interés, de esta manera obtiene regulares ganancias que le ayudan en los gastos del hogar. Además paralelamente a su negocio de comercialización, también se dedica a lavar ropa para sus conocidos que le pagan por prenda, así transcurren los días de Dora que busca crearse con frecuencia recursos para brindarles una buena educación  a sus hijos. Y como siempre piensa en el futuro ya tiene planeado instalar un puesto de venta de ropa y calzado en el mercado de su zona, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias y continuar progresando. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP y promete cumplir con sus pagos puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este préstamo que le permitirá continuar trabajando para alcanzar el progreso. Dora tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de variedad de mercadería de ropa para la temporada de verano, pues quiere abastecerse y cumplir con los pedidos que tiene pendiente.
texts.en:
Dora, age 42, lives in her mother’s house with her sisters, nieces and nephews, and her three children.  Only one of her children, the last one, is a minor.  Together, they try hard every day to get ahead.

This enterprising woman started selling clothes and footwear one year ago.  She works by orders.  That is to say that her customers ask for a particular style of clothes or footwear, and Dora gets them.  Then, she charges her customers on credit and with interest.  That way she gets regular income, which helps with the household expenses.

In addition to her business of selling clothes and footwear she washes clothes for people she knows.  They pay by the garment.  That is how Dora spends her days.  She looks to establish continual resources in order to give her children a good education.  As she is always thinking of the future, she has plans to establish a stand to sell clothes and footwear in the area market.  This way she hopes to improve her income and to continue to make progress.

This is her fourth loan with MFP.  She pledges to make her payments on time because she does not want to disappoint the people who make this loan possible.  The loan will allow her to keep working to make progress.  Dora plans to use the requested loan to buy a variety of clothes for the summer season.  She wants to stock up and fill the pending orders that she has.

loans.use: To stock up on merchandise in order to fill the pending orders that she has

loans.name: Fidela Erminia

texts.en:
Fidela is a member of the Communal Bank "Inka Wasi", which is located in the district of Puno, the province of Puno, and the department of Puno. She is 34 years old, married, and has three children. She has an incomplete primary education. 

Fidela has worked with Manuela Ramos for four months. Her first loan was for 500 PEN and allowed her to increase her merchandise for her business. She sells a variety of products, such as padlocks, mirrors, razors, and all types of school uniform items, including gloves, ties, belts, hair pieces, etc. 

She is asking for a loan of 500 PEN, which she will use to increase her business selling personal items. Her dream is to have a hardware store. Her favorite thing about working with the Communal Bank is the responsibility.

loans.use: Increase her business of selling personal items.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca N. lives in the Busega neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 5 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of an additional family member (adopted child).

Rebecca has a business of selling milk. She has been in this business for 1 year, and she works 7 days out of every week. Rebecca sells her products door-to-door, by means of retail. Rebecca has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more jerrycans of milk. She also generates additional income through a food stall. The main business challenges for Rebecca include transportation and the rainy season which hinders her movements. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale and also to get a permanent business premise.

Rebecca lives in a home that she owns; she doesn't have access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of milk.

loans.name: United Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “United” group from Waterloo, a small town in western Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Ibrahim S. is the leader of this group. Ibrahim is married to a businesswoman and has two children who are attending primary school. Ibrahim has been a businessman for ten years now. He sells sticks (for building houses, fences, etc.) and planks. He will use his share of the loan to buy a large number of sticks and planks to add to his business inventory.

loans.use: Buy a large number of sticks and planks to add to his business inventory

loans.name: Kartimou

texts.fr: I. M. Kartimou est née en 1969 et est mariée à AFFO Seïdou. Le couple a trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Kartimou vit ensemble avec sa famille au quartier Hlacomey à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis environs quatre ans. Le couple se partage les différentes charges familiales. Pour faire face à ses besoins quotidiens, Kartimou prépare et vend de la nourriture (haricot, pâte de maïs accompagné de sauce de tomate). De façon secondaire, Kartimou vend du savon de Ghana. Kartimou achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et aussi au Ghana. Kartimou exerce cette activité depuis treize ans et a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés auprès de ALIDé. Kartimou désire rehausser son activité et mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. C’est donc pour y parvenir que Kartimou sollicite un autre concours financier.
texts.en: Kartimou I. M. was born in 1969 and is married to Seïdou Affo. The couple have three children, all of whom are in school. Kartimou has lived together with her family for about four years in the Hlacomey area of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. The couple share the household expenses between them. To meet her daily needs, Kartimou prepares and sells food (beans, maize paste accompanied by tomato sauce). On the side, Kartimou also sells soap from Ghana. She buys these products at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin, and also in Ghana. Kartimou has run this business for thirteen years and has already benefited from three loans through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), all of which were repaid properly. Kartimou wants to enhance her business and better respond to the demands of her clientele. Thus, in order to achieve this goal, Kartimou is seeking more financial support.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize, beans, sauce condiments, palm oil, and peanut oil.

loans.name: Leh We Member I Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Leh We Member I” group from Waterloo, a small town in western Sierra Leone. They are petty businesspeople who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, in order to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Mary T.. Marie is a forty-year-old woman, married to a driver. She has two children – one in secondary school and one adult. Mary sells firewood and has been doing this business for fifteen years now. She will use her share of the loan to buy a large quantity of firewood to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: Buy a large quantity of firewood for resale

loans.name: Claveles X Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama  CLAVELES X porque así se llama  la calle principal de donde viven y así mismo, comentan que son parecidas debido a la belleza de la misma. El grupo pertenece al estado de Puebla y está  formado por 11 personas.La Presidenta del grupo es doña Mercedes F. tiene 41 años,  estudio únicamente la primaria, se dedica a la venta de zapatos y cosméticos. Tiene dos hijos, ella  es una mujer que ha salido adelante ante la adversidad y carencias por falta de preparación educativa, el  crédito lo ocupará para realizar pedidos de los productos que vende, las señoras la conocen desde hace tiempo saben que trabaja, es una persona honesta y quiere salir adelante. La Señora  Irma V. es la Tesorera de grupo,  se dedica a la venta de zapatos y lencería desde hace 3 años,  solo estudio la primaria tiene 2 hijos, la señora siempre ha trabajado y le gusta salir adelante por ella y sus hijos, para darles una mejor calidad de vida, las señoras la recomiendan porque nunca han tenido problema  alguno con ella y la conocen desde hace tiempo por que radican en la misma comunidad.
texts.en:
This group is called “Claveles X” (Carnations) because that is the name of the main Street where they live.  The members say that they are alike because of their beauty.  The group is in the state of Puebla, and it is comprised of 11 people.  

Mercedes F. is the president of the group.  She is 41 years old, and she only has an elementary school education.  She sells shoes and cosmetics.  She has two children.  She is a woman who has gotten ahead while facing adversity and the lack of education.

She will use the loan to fill orders for the products that she sells.  The women have known her for quite a while.  They know that she works, is an honest person, and she wants to get ahead.

Irma V. is the treasurer of the group.  She has been selling shoes and lingerie for three years.  She only has an elementary school education.  She has two children.  She has always worked. She likes to get ahead for herself and her children in order to give them a better quality of life.  The women recommend her because they have never had a problem with her.  They have known her for quite a while because they are from the same community.

loans.use: To make orders and buy merchandise

loans.name: Aminatou

texts.fr: K. Aminatou est née le 11 Octobre 1957 et est mariée à MOUNIROU Wabi. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Aminatou vit au quartier Minontchou à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis environs onze ans. Aminatou vient en aide à son mari en assurant avec lui les diverses charges de la famille. Aminatou n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Il y a environs huit ans que Aminatou mène comme activité la vente de divers produits (pâtes alimentaires, couscous, riz, sucre, conserves de tomate et de sardine, huile végétale, lait, piles, mayonnaise, papier hygiénique, etc.) dans sa boutique. Aminatou achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Dans le but d’agrandir un peu plus son activité et d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire, Aminatou sollicite pour la cinquième fois un appui financier auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Ms. K. Aminatou was born on October 11, 1957 and is married to Mr. MOUNIROU Wabi.  The couple have four children, who have all been to school.  Aminatou has been living in the Minontchou district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for about eleven years.  She helps out her husband by working with him to cover the various family expenses.  

Aminatou never attended school. For about eight years, she has been running a business selling various goods (pasta, couscous, rice, sugar, canned tomatoes and sardines, vegetable oil, milk, batteries, mayonnaise, toilet paper, etc.) in her shop.  She buys her goods at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. 

She is a previous ALIDé client who does a good job repaying her loans.  With the goal of expanding her business a bit and increasing her sales, Aminatou is applying for ALIDé financial support for the fifth time.

loans.use: Buying canned foods, soaps, boxes of sugar, and pasta

loans.name: Chérifath

texts.fr: M. Chérifath est née le 11 Janvier 1981 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Chérifath est mariée à LAÏSSI Souleymane et est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Chérifath vit avec sa famille au quartier Fifatin à Cotonou, depuis environs onze ans. Le couple subvient ensemble aux besoins de la famille. Chérifath n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Il y a environs  six ans que Chérifath mène comme activité la vente de sous-vêtements de façon ambulante. Chérifath s’approvisionne à Lomé au Togo, pays voisin du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Chérifath sollicite auprès de ALIDé un crédit, en vue de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. Le premier crédit dont Chérifath a bénéficié a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Chérifath M. was born January 11, 1981 in Cotonou, Benin’s economic capital. She is married to Souleymane LAÏSSI and a mother to two children, both in school. 

Chérifath and her family have been living in the neighborhood of Fifatin, in Cotonou, for about eleven years. The couple provide together for the needs of their family. 

Chérifath never attended school. For the past six years, she has been selling underwear door-to-door. Chérifath gets her merchandise in Lomé, Togo, a neighboring country of Benin. 

This is Chérifath’s second time requesting a loan from ALIDé, to strengthen her business and better meet customer demand. The first loan she received was fully repaid.

loans.use: To buy underwear

loans.name: Paulette

texts.fr: G. Paulette est née en 1976 et est mariée à ADJOVI Jean-Paul. Le couple a un enfant qui est scolarisé et qui vit avec eux. Il y a environs six ans que Paulette s’est installée avec sa famille au quartier Agongbomey à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Paulette assure avec son mari les charges de la famille. Depuis sept ans, Paulette vend des ustensiles de cuisine, et de façon secondaire, des cartes de recharges téléphoniques et des divers à son domicile. Paulette achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin.
