Sr. Pedro Jose is a member of the Communal Bank “Huayna Picchu”, which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

He is 78 years old, married, and has seven children. Pedro is the owner of a restaurant where he and his wife work. He works between the hours of 8am and 6pm, preparing different dishes for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Pedro wants to improve his restaurant. Therefore, he is requesting a loan to buy products for cooking such as rice, meat, and vegetables.

Pedro is grateful to those responsible for making his dream come true, so he promises to complete his payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: Purchase rice, meat, and vegetables

loans.name: Ramiro Antonio

texts.es:
Ramiro reside en El Transito, departamento de San Miguel junto a su esposa y su pequeño hijo, él es empleado tiene 22 años de edad, su esposa trabaja en una tienda de ropa y Ramiro en una empresa de mensajería, son una pareja joven y juntos contribuyen a los gastos del hogar, Ellos desean construir y para esto deben comprar materiales de construcción pero no cuentan con el dinero necesario.
Él solicita un préstamo para realizar esta inversión ayudándoles a que cuenten con su propio hogar ya que por el momento viven en casa de la mamá de Ramiro; Su principal objetivo es construir su propio hogar, una vivienda digna y cómoda mejorando así las condiciones de vida de ellos.
texts.en:
Ramiro resides with his wife and young child in El Transito, Department of San Miguel. He is 22 years old and employed. His wife works at a clothing store while he is employed by a message delivery company. This young couple works together to meet their household expenses. They want to build a house and need to buy construction materials, but they do not have the necessary funds.

The loan Ramiro is requesting will be used as an investment to help him secure his own home since he currently lives at his mother’s house. His main objective is to build his own house, a decent and comfortable home that will improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Susana

texts.es: La Sra. Susana tiene como actividad la venta y elaboración de pan y alfajores en la zona donde reside con esta actividad ayuda a su esposo en el mantenimiento de su hogar, el esposo es conductor asalariado, trabajando de es esta manera por varios años, en esta oportunidad al esposo sr. Félix, se le presento la oportunidad de adquirir un vehículo, ya que ellos tienen dinero ahorrado al  cual aumentaran el dinero solicitado en este crédito, para así de esta manera adquirir un vehículo con el cual podrá trabajar y de esta manera mejorar su economía, también así de esta manera poder transportar a su esposa en la venta del pan y así facilitar el trabajo de su esposa, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado .
texts.en:
Sra. Susana produces and sells bread and shortbread cookies in the area where she lives. This business enables her to help her husband with maintaining their household. Her husband, Sr. Felix, has been working as a salaried driver for several years. He has been presented with an opportunity to purchase a vehicle.

Susana and her husband have money saved up, but are requesting a loan so that they can increase their reserves. By acquiring this vehicle, her husband will be able to work and improve their financial situation. In addition, her husband can use the vehicle for selling bread, thereby creating work for him to do. Susana is very grateful to Emprender for the support that has been provided.

loans.use: Purchase a vehicle for selling bread & providing work for her husband

loans.name: Rigoberto Ernesto

texts.es:
Don Rigoberto de 60 años de edad, es un señor muy trabajador y posee un taller de sastrería(confección de ropa), reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, vive junto a su esposa y juntos atienden el taller ya que sus hijos ya tienen sus propias familias, Don Rigoberto aprendió este oficio desde niño porque sus padres se dedicaron siempre a este mismo oficio, lo que hizo posible que él aprendiera perfectamente y fuera desarrollándose hasta que logró instalar su propio taller y fue ganándose el reconocimiento de la gente y estos mismos se encargan de recomendarlo a nuevas personas.
Don Rigoberto trabaja por contrato y solo recibe el 50% de su trabajo al inicio de este, para esta temporada tiene dos eventos importantes por lo que necesita de un préstamo para comprar los materiales que necesita y poder darle salida a este trabajo. La oportunidad de este préstamo ayudara a que compre toda la tela y materiales necesarios para confección de estos pedidos y poder quedar bien con sus clientes.
El propósito de él es atender bien a los clientes, realizarles un buen trabajo y satisfacer sus gustos para contar siempre con su preferencia.
texts.en:
Don Rigoberto, age 60, is a hardworking gentleman who produces clothing at his tailoring workshop. He resides with his wife in El Transito, Department of San Miguel, and they manage their business together. Their children already have their own families.

Don Rigoberto learned this business as a boy because his parents were in the same line of work. This made it possible for him to develop properly as a tailor until he was able start his own shop and gain recognition among his customers. In return, they have recommended him to other people.

Don Rigoberto works by contract and receives 50% of his payment before the work begins. This season he has two important events and needs a loan to buy the materials required to proceed with the work. The opportunity provided through loan will help him buy all of the fabric and necessary materials so that he can complete his orders and keep his customers happy.

His goal is to provide excellent service to his customers, perform a good job, and cater to their preferences.

loans.use: Purchase fabrics & materials

loans.name: Arminda

texts.es:
Arminda tiene 41 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. DesD. hace más D. 4 años se dedica a L. atención D. su negocio, en el que ha instalado en su casa un espacio para vender artículos escolares, así como algunos alimentos que no hay en su zona, aprovechando que sus clientes van a su establecimiento a requerir el servicio D. locutorio que ofrece también. D. esta manera es como se gana L. vida, es por eso que su tienda es L. más concurrida, es por ello que tiene mayores ganancias y rotación D. su mercadería que constantemente son adquiridos en L. ciudad. Prefiere vender en su zona  porque  es una buena oportunidad D. negocios y ganancias y por tal espera incrementar su negocio D. mercadería y mejorar sus instalaciones. 

Es su cuarto crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que L. conocen como una persona que es responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en L. compra D. más mercadería para su tienda en  artículos  D. escritorio y algunos artículos D. primera necesidad.
texts.en:
Arminda, age 41, lives with her husband and three children in their own home.  For more than four years she has been managing a business, a store established in a space in her home where she sells school supplies and a few food items since there is no other store in the area.  Her customers also take advantage of the phone services that she also offers.  This is how Arminda earns her living, which explains why her store is always busy.  In order to earn as much income as possible, she constantly turns over her inventory and must acquire her merchandise in the city.  She prefers selling in her area because it provides a good business opportunity for generating profit.  For this reason, she hopes to expand her retail business and improve her facilities.  

This is her fourth loan with MFP.  Arminda is very happy to know that she has the financial backing of people who are aware of the fact that she is a responsible individual with her payments.  In addition, she is grateful to be part of her Communal Bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people.  Arminda thanks everyone who approved her loan request since it will very useful in advancing her business.  The money she requested will be invested in the purchase of more merchandise for her store, such as school supplies and a few basic necessities.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Jose Ramon

texts.es:
El Sr. Jose Ramon R. de 46 años de edad, y su esposa Mayra del Socorro Fitoria quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar viven en su finca en la comarca la Peña Tecolostote, el Sr. R. ejerce la actividad de  comercializar el ganado y  los trabajos agricolas, el cual desde muy joven se ha dedicado a estas labores ya que con los ingresos recibidos asume los gastos familiares y sus compromisos de pagos.

Esta solicitando su 8vo credito para ganado de desarrollo a Afodenic mediante el apoyo de Kiva que gracias a estos financiadores va a poder incrementar el hato Ganadero. 

Su mayor sueño es incrementar sus activos para obtener mayores ganacias y poder brindarles mejores condiciones de  vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. José Ramón R., 46, and his wife, Mayra del Socorro Fitoria, who is a housewife, live in their home in the rural area of Peña Tecolostote.  Mr. R. is a farmer and cattleman.  He has been in this line of work since he was a young man.  Income from this work allows him to meet household expenses and take on the responsibility of loan repayments.

He is asking for his 8th Kiva loan from Afodenic to use in cattle raising.   Thanks to these lenders he will be able to increase his herd size.

His greatest dream is to increase his assets so that he can obtain higher profits and provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: To buy a calf.

loans.name: Leidy Nathaly

texts.es: L. señora Leidy vive en casa D. sus suegros con su esposo y sus dos hijitos tiene un bazar donD. venD. peluches, regalos, ropa  para niños y otros, saco el crédito para surtir su bazar ya que siempre falta algo es lo que indica nunca se tiene lo suficiente, quiere que sus hijos tengan todo lo que elL. no tubo cuando era pequeña quiere mejorar su calidad D. vida D. elL. y D. toda su familia, desea a L. larga poder comprarse una casita y también ver a sus hijos profesionales y esta consciente que trabajara duro pero sabe que saldrá adelante y realiza todos sus deseos, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por L. confianza brindada.
texts.en:
Sra. Leidy lives at the house of her in-laws with her husband and two young children. She manages a bazaar where she sells plush toys, gifts, children’s clothing, and other items. Leidy is requesting a loan so that she can stock her bazaar because she is always lacking something and never has enough of everything.

She wants her children to have everything because as a girl she wanted to improve the quality of life for herself and her entire family. Leidy wants to be able to buy a small house and see her children become professionals. She is conscious about working hard in order to get ahead and fulfill all of her wishes. Leidy is extremely grateful to Emprender and Kiva for placing their confidence in her.

loans.use: Purchase novelties, gifts, and other products

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es: Aurora tiene 31 años, es casada y vive con sus 6 hijos en su casa propia. Casi toda su vida ha estado ligada a las tareas de la agricultura y la ganadería es por eso que desde hace 5 años empezó a intensificar su actividad en la compra y venta de animales como ovejas, cerdos y becerros de acuerdo al requerimiento del cliente, en el que son ofrecidos en las ferias ganaderas de su zona a un precio mayor. Es por tal razón que procura adquirir animales sanos y de buena raza, eso aumentará la calidad de su capital de trabajo así como de sus ganancias. En adelante desea incrementar su capital de trabajo para vender más cantidad de animales. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de animales menores porque ha visto que también es rentable en sus ventas.
texts.en: Aurora is 31 years old, married and lives with her 6 children in her own home.  For almost her entire life she has been involved in farming crops and livestock.  This is why 5 years ago she began to intensify her work in the buying and selling of animals such as sheep, pigs and calves according to the demand of her customers.  She offers her animals at cattle markets in her area for a higher price.  She tries to acquire healthy, thoroughbred animals which raises the quality of her working capital as well as her profits.  In the future, she wishes to increase her working capital in order to sell more animals.  This is the first loan which she has had with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She also likes being a part of her community bank because all the members are people who she knows.  They are responsible and very supportive.  She thanks those who will fund her loan because it will help her business to move forward.  She intends to use the loan which she is requesting to purchase young animals because she has seen through her sales that this is profitable.

loans.use: Purchase of young animals because she considers this to be more profitable

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HUAYNA PICCHU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Vanessa; ella tiene 24 años de edad y es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de pollería, ella por medio de estos pequeños negocios saca adelante a su hijo, ella trabaja desde las 6:30 a.m hasta 8:00 p.m, la socia quiere mejorar su negocios. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para la tienda de abarrotes y pollos para la pollería.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Vanessa is a member of the “HUAYNA PICCHU” community bank.  The bank is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

She is 24 years old, a single mother and has one child.  She divides her time between her grocery store business and her poultry store business.  Through these small businesses she provides for her son.  She works from 6.30am to 8.00pm and wishes to improve her businesses.  Vanessa is requesting the loan to buy merchandise for her grocery store and chickens for her poultry store.

Vanesssa thanks those who are helping her to achieve her dream by funding her loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her grocery store and chickens for her poultry store

loans.name: Kenya Del Socorro

texts.es:
Kenya de  30 años de edad es casada con el Sr. Donald Sandoval Cucalon quien asume los gastos familiares, habitan en la Comarca El Jobo, jurisdiccion de Tecolostote; Kenia y su esposo poseen una pequeña parcela de 3 manzanas donde produce leche, cuajada y comercializan Ganado obteniendo asi sus propios ingresos mensuales el cual les permite desarrollarse economicamente y brindarle a su familia las condiciones necesarias del hogar.
 
Esta solicitando su primer credito para compra de ternero de desarrollo, y asi poco a poco ir acumulando su propio inventario ganadero que le permitira brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida, Kenya se siente muy agradecida con el apoyo del Financimiento que brinda Kiva a estos Sectores pues asi puede irse desarrollando de manera individual en el mercado de la produccion .  

Su sueño es llegar a ser una persona con alta experiencia en el sector de la Ganaderia y poder sacar adelante a su Familia, pues es el patrimonio que dejara a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Kenya, 30, lives with her husband, Donald Sandoval Cucalón, who takes on the family expenses, in her house next door to the El Jobo School in Tecolostote.  She owns a 3 manzana plot where milk and cottage-like cheese is produced and sold.  She also raises cattle to earn her own monthly income to help their economic development.

She is asking for her first loan to buy a calf.  Kenya is very grateful for the financing Kiva offers to these sectors in order to get ahead in the production market.

Her dream is to become major cattle producer and thus move her family ahead in life.

loans.use: Compra de terneros

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HUAYNA PICCHU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Marleny; ella tiene 28 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanías, ella tiene una tienda de artesanía que atiende desde las 9:00 hasta las 10:00 p.m, la socia por medio de este negocio saca adelante a su hijo, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para la tienda de artesanía como chompas, pantalones, chalinas y mantas.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Marleny belongs to the “HUAYNA PICCHU” community bank. The bank is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Marleny is 28 years old.  She lives with her partner and has one child.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business where she sells handicrafts.  She has a handicraft store where she works from 9.00am to 10.00pm.  Through her business she manages to support her child.  She would like to expand her business.  She is requesting her loan to buy merchandise for her handicraft store such as sweaters, pants, scarves and blankets.

Marleny would like to thank those who will participate in her dream by funding her loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her handicraft store such as sweaters, pants, scarves and blankets

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es: Fortunata tiene 47 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. DesD. hace 10 años  se dedica a tejer artesanalmente, y cada semana realiza diferentes prendas D. vestir, que con ayuda D. un familiar, quien la ayuda en la comercialización a otros lugares. Su trabajo lo realiza en su misma casa y paralelamente a esto también se dedica a la agricultura, donD. cultiva papa principalmente, asimismo venD. leche que extrae D. las vacas que tiene en su establo, esta actividad lo hace diariamente. La venta D. sus tejidos los ofrece a un buen precio que compensa el esfuerzo que ha realizado por lo que su deseo es incrementar su producción D. tejidos e innovar en sus diseños. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en todas las actividades que realiza, en la compra D. lana, así como arrendar un tractor para empezar con la siembra D. papa.
texts.en:
Fortunata, 47, lives with her husband and two children in her own house.  For the last 10 years she has maD. hand knitted items and every week makes various articles of clothing which a family member helps sell in a different location.  She does her work in her home but also is a farmer, primarily of potatoes and she also sells milk she extracts from cows she keeps in her stable.  This work is done daily.

She sells her woven articles at good prices that compensate her for the effort she’s put into them and she wants to increase production and innovate her designs.  This is her first loan from MFP and she is very happy to know that she has financial help.  Besides, she enjoys being part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible and mutually supportive people.

She is grateful to all the persons who will fund the loan she’s asking for that will be so useful for her business’ progress.

She will use the requested funds to invest in all the activities she undertakes; in the purchase of wool as well as in leasing a tractor to start planting potatoes.

loans.use: To buy wool to make more knitted articles and to lease a tractor for potato planting.

loans.name: Luz De San Antonio Group

texts.es:
Yolanda participa en L. alcancía comunal “Luz D. San Antonio”, sus diez integrantes día a día se esfuerzan por salir adelante cada uno en su negocio distinto, tal es el caso D. Yolanda quien es una mujer muy trabajadora, se dedica a vender floreros, jarras y vasos D. vidrio además ayuda en L. cocina en el comedor “L. Central” D. su zona. 
Anteriormente a ello su esposo D. Yolanda compró un auto con L. liquidación que recibió D. su anterior trabajo, inexpertos en este campo fueron estafados al comprar este bien resultado D. ello se malograba constantemente; es decir L. inversión que hicieron fue una pérdida. EmprenD. en el negocio Yolanda D. venta D. productos hechos en vidrio a raíz que L. fábrica donD. prestaba servicios su esposo le pagaban con mercadería que ellos hacían; es decir productos en vidrios; así entonces Yolanda tuvo que venderlo a fin D. no afectar L. economía en su casa; le ha servido para apoyar a su esposo en terminar L. educación a sus hijos, así mismo en su alimentación.
Al principio no era fácil porque solo sus amistades eran los compradores, pero esta situación cambió porque se dio cuenta que estos productos y no habiendo aquel tiempo mucha competencia le generaba buenas ganancias; y desD. entonces continúa ofreciendo sus jarritas, vasos y floreros; esta vez el crédito que necesita será para comprar lencería para niñas y damas como son: medias, trusas, y brasieres apropiado para recibir el año venidero.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the “Luz D. San Antonio” communal bank.  The bank's ten members work hard every day to get ahead, each one in their own business.  This is the case with Yolanda who is a very hard-working woman.  She sells glass vases, jugs and cups as well as helping in the kitchen at the “L. Central” eatery in her area.

Previously, Yolanda's husband bought a car with the severance pay which he received from his old job.  Inexperienced in this field, they were ripped off when they bought it and it constantly broke down.  In other words, the investment which they maD. turned out to be a loss.  Yolanda set herself up in the business of selling glass products since the factory where her husband worked paid its employees in goods which they manufactured; that is to say glass products.  Yolanda had to sell them in order to keep her household finances afloat.  It has helped her to support her husband and allowed their children to finish their education.  It has also helped them put food on the table.

In the beginning, it was not easy because only their friends bought from them but this situation changed because Yolanda realized that there was not a lot of competition in providing these products at the time and she maD. good profits.  Since then she has continued to offer her jugs, glasses and vases.  The loan which she now needs will be used to purchase underwear for children and women such as stockings, briefs and bras to receive in the coming year.

loans.use: To purchase underwear

loans.name: Maria Ursula

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HUAYNA PICCHU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. María Ursula; ella tiene 27 años de edad y es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de golosinas, ella tiene una carreta de venta de golosinas en forma ambulatoria, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 3:00 p.m y por miedo de este pequeño negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar su negocio teniendo otra carreta y asi ir aumentando su negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar golosinas como galletas, dulces, chupetes y gaseosas.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
María Ursula belongs to the “HUAYNA PICCHU” community bank.  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of the same name.

María is 27 years old, a single mother and has 2 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business, selling sweets.  She has a cart from which she sells sweets in an itinerant manner.  She works from 8.00am until 3.00pm and through her small business she supports her children.  María would like to expand her business by buying another cart and thereby steadily grow her business.  She is requesting a loan to purchase sweets such as cookies, candies, lollipops and soda.

María would like to thank those who are participating in her dream by funding her loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To purchase sweets such as cookies, candies, lollipops and soda

loans.name: Abraham

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “HUAYNA PICCHU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


El socio es el Sr.  Abraham; el tiene 67 años de edad y es casado y tiene 6 hijos; el socio tiene un negocio de comidas, el juntamente con su esposa trabajan en este negocio, el socio trabaja en forma independiente, el trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Abraham belongs to the “HUAYNA PICCHU” community bank.  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of the same name.

Abraham is 67 years old and is married with 6 children.  He has a food business.  He works together with his wife in this business.  He owns his own business and works from 8.00am until 6.00pm.  He would like to expand his business.

Abraham would like to thank those who are participating in his dream by funding his loan and pledges to make his repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To purchase cooking ingredients such as rice and meat

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es: Yanet tiene 26 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 1 año que posee una tienda, en donde vende productos comestibles que abastece toda la gente de su zona, más sus vecinos que son lo principales consumidores. Paralelamente a este trabajo, también se dedica al cultivo de papa así como a la crianza de ganado vacuno, actividades que hacen posible que tenga una economía estable. En tanto su mayor tiempo lo dedica a la atención de la clientela que visita su establecimiento, por lo que ha visto la rentabilidad que le genera su negocio, por ser uno de las pocas tiendas que existe en su zona. Por tanto ha decidido aumentar con más mercadería en su tienda. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita,  lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería para su tienda.
texts.en:
Yanet, 26, lives with her husband and three children in her own house.  For the last year she has had a store where she sells foodstuffs that supply all the residents of her area, especially her neighbors who are her main customers.  Alongside this work she also farms potatoes and raises cattle, activities that provide steady income.

Most of her time is spent tending to customers that frequent her store so she has noticed how profitable this business is because it’s one of the few stores in the area.  Therefore, she has decided to increase her stock inventory.

This is her first loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial help.  Besides, she enjoys being part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible and mutually supportive.  She thanks all those people who will fund the loan she’s requesting that will be so useful for her business’ progress.  She will use the requested funds to buy more stock merchandise for her store.

loans.use: To buy more stock items for her store.

loans.name: Jenny Raquel

texts.es:
Jenny de 34 años, tiene un taller de zapatos y zapatillas. Vive en el Suburbio de Guayaquil(zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales). 

Ella inicio su negocio ya que tenia varias herramientas para producir y arreglar zapatos, poco a poco fui incrementando su capital de trabajo y clientela. En la actualidad sigue con su negocio de arreglo de zapatos y zapatillas trabajando desde las 07h00am 18h00pm. El problema principal es cerrar muy tarde ya que tiene que tener mucho cuidado con la delincuencia. 

Quiere tener otro negocio para así asegurar el futuro económico de sus cinco hijos, comprando con el préstamo carnes para una pequeña carnicería que quiere. En el futuro quiere incrementa la carnicería y su taller de zapatos.
texts.en:
Jenny, age 34, has a workshop where she produces shoes and slippers. She lives in Suburbio de Guayaquil, an urban area where most of the residents are informal merchants.

Jenny started her business since she had the various tools needed to manufacture and repair shoes. Little by little, she was able to increase her operating capital and build up her customer base. At the moment, she continues to repair shoes and slippers and works between the hours of 7am and 6pm. Her main problem is when she has to close late because she has to be mindful of the crime in the area.

Jenny wants to open another business so that she can secure the financial future of her five children. With this loan, she wants to buy meat so that she can start a small butcher shop. In the future, she wants to expand both her butcher shop and her shoe repair shop.

loans.use: Purchase meat to start a butcher shop in addition to her existing business

loans.name: 20 De Octubre Group

texts.es:
La A.C. 20 de Octubre inicia su primer ciclo, es parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes, ocho mujeres y un varón.  La mesa directiva está compuesta por la  presidenta la señora Maria,  la tesorera  la señora Ledia y la secretaria de actas la señora Karina.

La señora  Maria es una mujer de 42 años de edad, casada, con  cuatro hijos,  las señoras han depositado su confianza en ella para que asuma el cargo de presidenta. Este es su primer ciclo, ingresó al grupo debido a que se informó de los servicios de Pro Mujer a través del equipo de Promoción.

Con respecto a su negocio, ella cuenta con una “tienda – pulpería” (tienda de abarrotes y otros productos).  La tienda está ubicada en su domicilio, por lo que las ventas pueden realizarse durante todo el día, todos los días.  Su primer crédito fue invertido en compra de mercadería, el nuevo crédito de Bs. 2000.- también será invertido en mercadería y tarjetas de recarga para celulares.
Cuando se le consulta sobre el servicio que más le gusta de Pro Mujer ella comenta que el servicio de Salud.
Con respecto a los negocios  que llevan adelante el resto de integrantes de la asociación, se cuenta con negocios de comida, venta fruta, venta de medias y ropa, tienda de lanas, hilar lana, venta de fresco, tienda de barrio, taller mecánica.
texts.en:
The October 20th Communal Bank is starting its first loan cycle as part of the Villa Exaltación Community Center. The group is composed of eight members, seven women and one man. The Board of Directors consists of Sra. Maria (President), Sra. Ledia (Treasurer), and Sra. Karina (Secretary of Records).

Sra. Maria is a 42 year old woman who is married and has four children. The other women have placed their trust in her by electing her to be President. This is her first loan cycle. She joined Pro Mujer because a group promoting the organization told her about the services. With respect to her business, Maria has a store in her home where she sells groceries and other products every day. Her first loan, in the amount of 2000 BOB, will be invested in the purchase of merchandise. She will also acquire rechargeable calling cards for mobile phones. When asked what she enjoys most about Pro Mujer, Maria said she likes the health services.

With respect to the other members, they have businesses involving the sale of food, fruit, socks, clothing, wool, soft drinks, as well as managing a neighborhood store and an auto repair shop.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise & rechargeable calling cards

loans.name: Zoila Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HUAYNA PICCHU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Zoila Rosa; ella tiene 61 años de edad y es viuda y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de alquilares de su casa, ella alquila diferentes cuartos de su casa por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar las habitaciones de su casa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para que arregle las habitaciones.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Zoila Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank “Huayna Picchu”, which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

She is 61 years old, widowed, and has two children. Zoila divides her time between her daily activities and her business renting rooms in her house. She rents out different rooms of her house so that her children can get ahead. Zoila wants to make improvements to the rooms in her house. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy materials for making repairs.

Zoila Rosa is grateful to those responsible for making her dream come true, so she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: Purchase materials for repairing rental rooms

loans.name: La Gran Amistad (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal La Gran Amistad está formado por 9 mujeres y 2 hombres quienes con sus diferentes actividades diarias ayudan a la estabilidad económica de sus hogares y así brindarles un mejor futuro. La mayoria de los miembros de la banca comunal viven el la parroquia de Cumbe, que es conocida por la belleza de su naturaleza, en su mayor parte su gente se dedica a la agricultura que es para su consumo y cría de animales, muchos salen a la ciudad a trabajar en diferentes actividades.

La Señora Rosa M. vive en la comunidad del Salado en la parroquia del Valle pero asiste a las reuniones a la parroquia de Cumbe,  una amiga le ha invitado a formar parte de este grupo, este es el segundo crédito que realiza en la banca comunal.
Nuestra socia se dedica a la Agricultura, cultiva verduras y hortalizas  en tierras que le han prestado para que las haga producir, todos sus productos los vende los días sábados en un merado de la ciudad, esta en este negocio hace 7 años. En sus tiempos libres se dedica a tejer ponchos, carteras, etc., las que vende a sus compañeras de la banca comunal y amigas. 
Doña Rosa tiene 33 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijas de 14, 12, 9, 7 y 6 años de edad, su primera hija  estudia en el colegio y sus cuatro hijas  estudian en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión albañil, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven cuidando una casa.

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono para la fertilización de las tierras. Su meta es cerrar con mallar el terreno para que animales vecinos no le dañen sus cultivos.

La Señorita. Graciela L. vive en la parroquia de Cumbe, pero es oriunda del Cantón
Sigsig, vive en casa de su prima pero independiente, es soltera y tiene 18 años de edad, Este es el primer crédito que realiza en la banca comunal y fue invitada por su prima a formar parte de este grupo de mujeres. 
La Señorita Graciela trabaja en la atención de una panadería, labora desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, esta actividad  la viene realizando hace 2 años de lunes a domingo.
 
Con el dinero de su crédito va a iniciar en el negocio de criar pollos. Su sueño es emprender con su propio negocio y llegar a tener un local de venta de electrodomésticos.
texts.en:
The Gran Amistad (Great Friendship) communal bank is made up of 9 women and 2 men who, with their different daily activities, help the economic stability of their homes and in this way they provide for themselves a better future. The majority of the members of the communal bank live in the Cumbe parish, which is known for its natural beauty. Most of its habitants make a living in the agricultural sector, which is for their own consumption and for raising animals. Many leave the city to work in different activities. 

Mrs. Rosa M. lives in the Salado community in the Valley parish, but she attends the meetings of the Cumbe parish, as a friend of hers invited her to be part of this group. This is the second loan that she has taken out as part of the communal bank. This group member makes a living in agriculture. She cultivates vegetables and garden produce in land that has been loaned to her to cultivate it. She sells all of her products on Saturdays at a market in the city. She started this business 7 years ago. In her free time she also makes a living sewing ponchos, wallets, etc. She sells them to the members of the communal bank and to her friends. Rosa is 33 years old, married and has 5 children, ages 14, 12, 9, 7, and 6. The oldest child studies in high school and the other four children study in a city school. Her husband is a bricklayer. They don’t have their own house. Where they live, they are caring for another’s house.

The loan money will be used to purchase fertilizer for the fields. Her goal is to close off the land plot with a wire fence so that the neighbors’ animals don’t damage her crops. 

Miss Graciela L. lives in the Cumbe parish, but she is originally from Cantón Sigsig. She lives in her cousin’s house, but independently. She is single and 18 years old. This is the first loan that she is taking out with the communal bank and she was invited by her cousin to form part of this group of women.

Miss Graciela works at the counter of a bakery, and woks from 8 in the morning until 8 at night. She started this job two years ago, and works Monday through Sunday. 

With the money from her loan she is going to start a business raising chickens. Her dream is to launch her own business and to eventually have an electrical appliances store.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and chickens.

loans.name: María Beatriz

texts.es:
La Señora. María A. es socia del banco comunal María Reina de la Paz, vive por el sector de Totoracocha en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por la belleza de su centro histórico, cuenta con varios lugares turísticos los que se encuentran a poco tiempo de la ciudad, tiene una gran variedad en su gastronomía. Cuenca es especial por su gente la que lleva su cultura y tradición.
 
Nuestra socia se dedica a vender bisutería, inicia sus actividades desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde.  Viaja a la ciudad de Machala para comprar la mercadería.

Doña María tiene 46 años de edad y tiene 4 hijos, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando pero tiene una vida estable económicamente.

Es socia de la Fundación Espoir y de la banca comunal hace 10 años beneficiándose de los créditos en la ampliación de negocio,  el nuevo crédito que realiza lo va  a invertir en la compra de más mercadería como aretes, manillas, etc. Su meta es  crecer mucho más en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. María A. is a member of the María Reina de la Paz (Mary, Queen of Peace) communal bank.  She lives in Totoracocha, Cuenca.  This city is well known thanks to its beautiful city center.  It has several tourist attractions not too far away and quite a varied gastronomy.  Cuenca is made special by its people who preserve its culture and tradition.

She sells costume jewelry from 8am until 4pm.  She travels to the city of Machala to buy her merchandise.

María is 46 years old and has four children.  She doesn’t own a house so lives in a rented house.  However, her life is economically stable.

She has been an associate of Fundación Espoir and communal banking for ten years.  She has taken out loans to expand her business.  The new loan she’s negotiating will be used to buy more merchandise like: earrings, bracelets, etc.  Her goal is to grow greatly in her business.

loans.use: To buy earrings, rings, bracelets and costume jewelry in general.

loans.name: Flor María

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La California de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Las Divinas.

La señora Flor María es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal Las Divinas, tiene 36 años de edad y está soltera, tiene tres hijos de 16 – 12 y 4 años de  una relación que tuvo hace varios años, los dos mayores están en colegio. Estudio belleza y cosmetología en un centro de estudios en la capital manabita.

Realiza diversas actividades para ganarse la vida, vende ropa por catalogo, tiene una academia de modelos en la ciudad, además tiene un centro de belleza en el que reconocidas personalidades de la ciudad acuden a realizarse distintos arreglos como, cortes de cabello, tinturados, depilaciones, etc. Trabaja todos los días en sus diferentes actividades, con ella trabajan dos personas que le ayudan.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para instalar un spa ya que le faltan unas cuantas cosas que con este crédito piensa cubrir. Su meta es terminar por completo su SPA.
texts.en:
The members of the “Las Divinas” (The Divine Ones) communal bank meet every two weeks in the La California neighborhood of Portoviejo, Manabí province capital, known for many years as the City of Royal Tamarinds.

Flor María is a founding member of the Las Divinas communal bank.  She is 36 years old and single.  She has three children, who are 16, 12 and 4 years of age, products of a relationship she had several years ago.  The two oldest children are in school.  She studied Beauty & Cosmetology at an institute in the capital of Manabí province.

She undertakes several activities to support herself:  she sells catalogue clothing; she has a modeling academy in the city and also has a beauty salon that well-known celebrities in town frequent for hair styles, hair coloring, hair removal, etc.  She works every day in her various activities and she has two employees that help her.

The loan will be used to set up a spa; she still needs a few things that she’ll use this loan to get.  Her goal is to finish her spa.

loans.use: To buy items she needs to set up a spa.

loans.name: Dolores Marilu

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La California de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Las Divinas.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Dolores,  ella tiene 48 años de edad, está divorciada pero de esta relación ha tenido tres hijos ya todos mayores de edad, uno de sus hijos vive con ella el mismo que estudia en la Universidad en Manta. Desde hace mucho le gusto la costura, por eso estudio corte y confección y obtuvo un titulo de modista en la asociación de modista en Portoviejo.

Tiene un taller de costura en su casa, confecciona todo tipo de ropa, pero confiesa que lo que más le gusta es  confeccionar ropa de mujer, les cose a las personas que necesitan de sus servicios,  trabaja todos los días desde las 8am hasta las 20h00 pero que a veces se queda trabajando hasta más tarde cuando tiene mucho trabajo. Trabaja con la ayuda de su hermana y otra ayudante.

Este crédito es para comprar una maquina y materiales para la costura. Este es su séptimo ciclo en el Banco  Comunal y la gusta porque los créditos los entregan sin muchos trámites.
 
Su sueño es tener su propia casa ya que donde vive es alquilado.
texts.en:
Members of the Las Divinas (The Divine Ones) communal bank meet every two weeks in the La California neighborhood of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí province, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.

Here we find Dolores, 48, who is divorced but who had three children in the relationship; all the children are now adults but one of them still lives with her and is studying at the University of Manta.  She has enjoyed sewing for a long time so she studied Tailoring and Dressmaking obtaining a degree in Dressmaking from the Portoviejo Dressmaking Association.

She has a sewing workshop in her home.  She makes all kinds of clothes but she confesses that what she likes best is making women’s clothes. She sews for everyone who needs her services and works every day from 8am until 8pm although sometimes stays working until much later when she has a lot of work to complete.  Her sister and another person help her.

This loan is to buy a sewing machine and sewing supplies.  It’s her 7th loan in the communal bank and she likes it because the loans are delivered with a minimum of paper work.

Her dream is to have a house of her own because she currently lives in a rental.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Gladys Rosario

texts.es: Gladys tiene 35 años, tiene un hijo de dos años de edad ella es soltera vive en casa de sus padres, inició sus negocio hace ya 6 años, vendiendo comida a los obreros de una construcción y poco a poco fue ganando más clientes, formando así su puesto de venta de comida en su domicilio, tiene gran cantidad de clientes, por lo que necesita una cocina mas grande para que pueda avanzar mas rápido con la preparación de sus platos, el sueño de Gladys es poder incrementar su negocio y atender a todos sus clientes, se le brinda el crédito por contar con buenas referencias personales.
texts.en:
Gladys is 35 years old, a single mother with two children, and lives at home with her parents. She started a business six years ago selling food to construction workers. Over time she was able to attract more customers, enabling her to establish a food stall in her home. Gladys needs a larger stove so that she can prepare her dishes more quickly.

She dreams of expanding her business and serving all of her customers. This loan is being granted to Gladys because she has excellent personal references.

loans.use: Purchase an industrial stove

loans.name: Bertha Azucena

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La California de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Las Divinas.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Bertha, ella está casada y de esta relación tuvo tres hijos mayores de edad, la última de sus hijas vive con ella. Su marido es profesor en un colegio de la ciudad. Trabaja en el Municipio de Portviejo.

Se dedica al comercio en sus tiempos libres, vende ropa y su forma de venta es por encargo, trabaja los fines de semana  y por las  noches, además vende en su trabajo  ya que sus mejores clientas son sus compañeras de trabajo, deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días, su mercadería la compra en Guayaquil ciudad a la que viaja cada fin de mes ya que allá consigue más variedad y diseños.

Este crédito es para ir a Guayaquil a comprar su mercadería. Este es su cuarto ciclo en el banco y le gusta por las facilidades de pago, así como también los beneficios adicionales que brinda.

Su meta es comprarse un carro.
texts.en:
The members of the Las Divinas Communal Bank meet every fifteen days in the neighborhood of La California in Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds.  

Here, we meet Bertha who is married and has three adult children; her youngest daughter lives with her.  Her husband is a teacher at a city school.  She works for the Municipality of Portoviejo.

In her spare time, she sells clothing, working weekends and evenings. She also sells her clothing at work since her best customers are her co-workers. She gives them credit and collects payment every fifteen days.   She travels to Guayaquil at the end of the month to buy her merchandise as she finds a wider variety of styles and designs there.

She will use this loan to travel to Guayaquil to buy her merchandise.  This is her fourth loan cycle with the bank and she is pleased with the convenience of payments as well as the additional benefits offered.  Her goal is to buy a car.

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Ana Alexandra

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La California de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Las Divinas.

Hace dos años la hermana le llevo a la señora Ana para que ingresara al Banco Comunal y desde entonces algunas cosas para ella han cambiado para bien ya que con los créditos que ha recibido de parte de la Fundación Espoir ha mejorado mucho su negocio y su vida. Tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tuvo un hijo que ya es mayor de edad y es independiente. Su esposo es mecánico de motocicletas. Ella hace muchos años se graduó de modista en la Fundación de modistas FUNDAPASH.

Tiene un taller de costura en su casa, confecciona todo tipo de ropa, pero confiesa que lo que más le gusta es  confeccionar ropa niñas y niños, les cose a las personas que necesitan de sus servicios,  trabaja todos los días desde las 8am hasta las 20h00 pero que a veces se queda trabajando hasta más tarde cuando tiene mucho trabajo. Trabaja en sociedad con  su hermana con las que comparten el trabajo y las ganancias en partes iguales.

Este crédito es para comprar telas  y materiales para la costura. Su sueño es tener un taller de costura más grande e industrializado.
texts.en:
Members of the Las Divinas (The Divine Ones) communal bank meet every two weeks in the La California neighborhood of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí province, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.

Two years ago Ana’s sister took her to enroll in the communal bank and since then things have changed for the better because loans she’s gotten from Fundación Espoir have greatly improved her business and her life.  She is 44 years old, married and has a son who is now adult and independent.  She graduated several years ago as a Dressmaker from the FUNDAPASH Dressmaking Foundation.

She has a sewing workshop in her home.  She makes all kinds of clothes but confesses that what she enjoys making the most is children’s clothes.  She sews for everyone who needs her services every day from 8am until 8pm but sometimes even later when there is a lot of work to complete.  She works in partnership with her sister.  They share the workload and the profits equally.

This loan is to buy fabric and sewing supplies.  Her dream is to have a larger, industrialized shop.

loans.use: To buy fabric and sewing supplies.

loans.name: David Ernesto

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La California de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Las Divinas.

En este sitio encontramos a David, el tiene 35 años de edad, en la actualidad está soltero y tiene una hija de 15 años que se encuentra en el colegio estudiando, vive con su hija en casa de sus padres, es Arquitecto de profesión pero se ha dedicado al comercio.

Vende ropa de todo tipo en su casa donde tiene un local, hasta allí legan muchos clientes todos los días ya que trabaja todos los días desde las 8am hasta las 18h00 hora. La mercadería la va a comprar a Guayaquil y también le traen ropa desde Panamá y Colombia, lo cual atrae a muchos clientes ya que sus productos son de muy buena calidad y  vende a un precio razonable.

Este crédito es  para comprar más mercadería para tener un buen stock de mercadería para la época navideña  que es muy buena y vende bastante. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco y le gusta por las facilidades para conseguir los créditos.
 
Sus metas son tener su propia casa y su propio local.
texts.en:
Members of the Las Divinas (The Divine Ones) communal bank meet every two weeks in the La California neighborhood of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí province, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.

We find David, 35, here.  He is single and has a 15 year old daughter who is in school studying.  He lives with his daughter in his parents’ house.  He is an Architect by profession but works as a merchant.

He sells all sorts of clothes at home where he has a space set aside for this.  Many customers come by daily and he’s open for business every day from 8am until 6pm.  He goes to Guayaquil to buy his merchandise and also has clothes brought to him from Panamá and Colombia which attracts a lot of customers because his products are of very good quality and he sells for reasonable prices.

This loan is to buy more merchandise so that he can have good stock available for the Christmas season which is very good and he sells quite a bit. This is his second cycle in the bank and he likes it because of the ease in getting loans.

His dream is to own his own house and his own store.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Kiv

texts.en:
Kiv R., 27, is a tailor who sews the villagers’ clothes in Kompong Tom Province. She often gets orders from her customers for both traditional clothes, and modern clothes, at a reasonable price. Kiv R. also shares her sewing knowledge with her trainees for a fee.

Kiv R.’s husband (pictured) is a local farmer, and he currently feeds a few pigs around her house. The couple is blessed with a young kid who is enrolled in school. In order to earn extra income, Kiv R. will be using the loan to buy more pig-feed and to build a pen for the pigs.

loans.use: To buy more pig-feed and to build a pen for pigs.

loans.name: 020305-Bac Son-Hoang Phu Group

texts.en:
Dung L. T. (14) is a 48 year old femaL. who lives in the town of Hoang Hoa. Dung is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsibL. for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 020305-Bac Son-Hoang Phu (020305-Bac Son-Hoang Phu).

Dung is married and has 3 adult children. To making a living, Dung owns and operates a specialized retail store. WhiL. not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling confectionery products in the local community. Dung has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, Dung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dung has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish to sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Dung plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:
1.  Phuong P. T. (18) is a 50 year old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her food stall business.
2.  Dien T. T. (16) is a 56 year old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her retail store business.
3.  Hoa D. T. (17) is a 39 year old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.
4.  Thanh P. T. (13) is a 50 year old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her agriculture business raising livestock.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Dung L. T. (14) là 48 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoang Hoa.  Dung là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 020305-Bac Son-Hoang Phu (020305-Bac Son-Hoang Phu).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm bánh kẹo trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Dung thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 20 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Dung kiếm được khoảng 1,500,000 VND.  Vào 2008, Dung đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Dung đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua cá bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,000,000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

3.  Hoa D. T. (17) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.
4.  Thanh P. T. (13) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

D. việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Mayra Guadalupe

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Las Orquídeas  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal los Ceibos, esta es una zona urbana marginal donde las personas se dedican a diversas actividades.

La señora Mayra que es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal,  también antes de este fue fundadora de un Banco  Comunal en Rocafuerte su tierra natal. Ella tiene 35 años, es madre soltera de tres hijos de 13 – 5 y 3 años de edad,  el mayor esta en colegio, otro en escuela y el menor aun no tiene edad para estudiar. Estudio en la Universidad en la cual se graduó de Lic. En Auditoria. 

Esta ama de casa para sacar a sus hijos adelante se dedica a la venta de productos Yanbal (perfumería, artículos de belleza y accesorios para damas) trabaja todos los días desde las 8 am hasta las 11am y en las noches. Además realiza trabajos  de asesoría contable trabajo que aprovecha para vender sus productos, nos cuenta que aprovecha las ofertas cuando los productos salen más baratos y que cuando pasa la promoción los vende a precio normal con lo que se gana un dinero extra.

Este crédito es para comprar sus productos e invertir en los que estén de oferta ya que estos  le dejan mayores ganancias.
 
Su sueño es darles a sus hijos una buena educación
texts.en:
The “Ceibos” communal bank meets every two weeks in the Las Orquídeas neighborhood of Portoviejo, a marginal urban zone whose residents are engaged in a variety of activities.

Mayra is a founding member of the communal bank.  Prior to this she was also a founding member of a communal bank in Rocafuerte, her place of birth.  She is 35 years old, a single mother of three children who are 13, 5 and 3 years of age.  The oldest is in secondary school and the next one is in elementary school; the youngest is still not old enough to go to school.  She studied in the university graduating as an Auditor.

In order to support her children, this housewife sells Yanbal brand products (perfumes, beauty supplies and women’s accessories).  She works daily from 8am until 11am and in the evening.  She also works doing accountancy jobs and takes advantage of these occasions to offer her products for sale.  She tells us that she buys items when they are on sale and when the sale is over she resells them at regular price thereby earning a bit extra income.

This loan is to buy products and invest in those that are on sale because they are the ones that produce higher profits.

Her dream is to provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams, costume jewelry and Yambal brand cosmetics.

loans.name: Soung

texts.en:
Soung T. is 22 years of age and a married woman. In order to fix the needs of the family, Mao Soung T. sells a little grocery inventory out of her home. She has a few years of experience in this sector and is earning approximately of $4.50 per day. To help contribute towards the family's expenses, her husband operates a handicraft business whose main activity is selling rattan cupboard.

This couple has been married for years and they have only one kid who attends school. Soung T. would like a loan in order to purchase a piece of land in good condition for farming. Soung T. was not available for the photograph, so her husband is in the photo instead at their house.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of land in good condition for farming.

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia T. is 60 years old, married, and supports her family by operating a fish vending business. She lives in Purok Everlasting, Brgy. Talacagay, Hinobaan, Negros Occidental.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005, and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 7,000.

Dionesia is now borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she can continue to fund the operations of her fish selling business. This will be her 6th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Dionesia aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund the operation of fish selling.

loans.name: Nelma

texts.en:
Nelma D. J. is a married woman who lives in Purok Crotons, Brgy. Doldol, Valladolid, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 3 business ventures:  tricycle transport, fuel sales, and a general store. Her husband Joseph, who is 43 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have three children who are between 14 and 23 years old.

Nelma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past twelve loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Nelma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 3,500, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 13th loan, she is borrowing PHP 18,500, which she intends to use for the maintenance of the motorcycle so that she can continue to save up for future improvement of her business. Nelma D. J. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund the operations of tricycle transport and fuel sales.

loans.name: Nelva Elizabeth

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Las Orquídeas  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal los Ceibos, esta es una zona urbana marginal donde las personas se dedican a diversas actividades.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Nelva. Tiene 49 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual ha procreado cinco hijos dos de ellos ya mayores de edad. Tres de sus hijas estudian una en universidad y dos en el colegio el mayor ya es independiente. Su marido se dedica al comercio.

Tiene una imprenta y papelería en el centro de la ciudad donde arrienda un local, trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 8am hasta las 18h00, trabaja con la ayuda de dos personas a la cuales les paga un sueldo mensual, nos cuenta que en las temporadas de inicio de clases tiene que contratar personal, sus productos los recibe en su local, compra en diversos lugares en cuanto a sus productos se refiere.

Este crédito es para compra papeles para la copiadora, libros y cuadernos de distintos tipos. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal  y le gusta por las facilidades de pago.

Sus sueños son tener un local propio para ahorrar el pago del arriendo y comprarse un carro.
texts.en:
The communal bank Los Ceibos meets every two weeks in the residential area of Las Orquideas in the city of Portoviejo.  This is a poorer urban area where people do different types of work.

Mrs. Nelva, 49, lives here.  She is in a common-law marriage and she has 5 children, two that are adults.  Three are of her daughters are studying in a university, two are in high school and the oldest is now on his own.  Her husband is in business.

She has a printing and stationery shop in the center of the city where she rents a shop.  She works Mondays to Saturdays from 8 am to 6 pm with the help of two employees who are paid monthly.  She tells us that at the beginning of classes she has to hire help and she buys the merchandise in different locations and she has the products delivered.

This loan will be used to buy paper for the copier, books and assorted kinds of notebooks.  She is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it for the ease of payments.

Her dreams are to have her own store to save the rent money and to buy herself a car.

loans.use: To buy papers, books and notebooks

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Gioi C. T. (19) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoang Hoa.  Gioi là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 020307-Bac Son-Hoang Phu (020307-Bac Son-Hoang Phu).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ thu hoạch & bán các loại cá đánh bắt ở biển trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Gioi thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 25 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Gioi kiếm được khoảng 1,500,000 VND.  Vào 2008, Gioi đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Gioi đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,000,000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia O. is a married woman who lives in Purok Cosmos, Brgy. Doldol, Valladolid, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  livestock and farming. Her husband Eliseo, who is 46 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have four children who are between 15 and 26 years old.

Cecilia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Cecilia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,200, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 13th loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,500, which she intends to use for additional capital for her livestock business so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Cecilia O. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital for her livestock business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela A. is a 40 year old married woman, who supports her family by operating two business ventures: a piggery and food vending. She lives in Papaya 2, Tabao Rizal, San Enrique, Negros Occidental.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1999 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000. Adela is now borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she can continue to fund the operations of her piggery. This will be her 17th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Adela aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund the operations of a piggery.

loans.name: Rosa Carmen

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Las Orquídeas  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal los Ceibos, esta es una zona urbana marginal donde las personas se dedican a diversas actividades.

La señora Rosa tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación a tenido 5 hijos ya todos sus hijos son mayores de edad aunque tres de ellos aun viven en su casan. Su esposo se dedica a la  albañilería.

Es un ama de casa que para ayudarse en sus gastos y a los de su familia decidió montar una mini papelería en su casa, además de productos de papelería también vende artículos de bazar ya que como nos dice hay que ayudarse con lo que se pueda vender. Trabaja todos los días desde las 7am hasta las 18h00 y a veces hasta más tarde ya que como su negocio está en su casa  esto no le incomoda, sus productos los compra en distribuidoras en el centro de la ciudad.

Este crédito es para comprar más productos tanto en papelería como artículos de bisutería y bazar. Esta en el Banco Comunal hace ya cinco ciclos y le gusta porque los créditos dan sin muchos requisitos.

Su sueño es terminar su casa ya que esta construyendo un segundo piso.
texts.en:
Every 15 days, the Los Ceibos Communal Bank meets in the Las Orquídeas neighborhood of the city of Portoviejo. This is an area on the edge of the city where people are engaged in a variety of businesses.

Señora Rosa, age 48, is married and has 5 children who are all adults, though three of them still live in her house. Her husband works as a bricklayer. She is a housewife who, in order to help with expenses, decided to open a small stationery shop in her house. In addition to paper products, she also sells miscellaneous items since, as she tells us, this helps her with her sales. She works every day from 7:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. and sometimes until later. Since her business is in her house this doesn’t inconvenience her. She buys her products from distributors in the center of the city.

This loan is for the purchase of more stationary, costume jewelry and miscellaneous items. She has been a member of the communal bank for five loan cycles and likes it because the loans are given without many conditions. Her dream is to finish her house since she is constructing a second floor.

loans.use: To purchase stationary, costume jewelry, and miscellaneous items.

loans.name: 020108-Hop Tan-Hoang Phu Group

texts.en:
Man N. T. (27) is a 58 year old female living in the town of Hoang Hoa. Man is the group leader of a 9-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 020108-Hop Tan-Hoang Phu (020108-Hop Tan-Hoang Phu).

Man is married and has 5 adult children. To making a living, Man operates a family member's business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting and selling wild-caught fish in the local community.  Man has been engaged in this business for over 30 years and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2005, Man joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Man has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the 6th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Man plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Las Orquídeas  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal los Ceibos, esta es una zona urbana marginal donde las personas se dedican a diversas actividades.

Aquí encontramos a la señora  Sonia, ella tiene 30 años de edad y esta casada, fruto de esta relación ha procreado dos hijos de 9 y 6 años los mismos que están estudiando en la escuela. Su marido es  Ing. Civil. Ella estudio en la Universidad donde se graduó de Ing. Civil.

A pesar de que tiene su profesión también se dedican a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, vende en su casa donde tiene un pequeño local y también entrega a domicilio cuando le realizan pedidos.
