Trabaja todos los días en las noches y los fines de semana todo el día, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería la compra en Quito y Guayaquil ciudades a las que viaja cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite.

Este crédito es para ir a Quito para traer ropa mas que todo ropa de mujer. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho para financiar sus compras.
 
Sus sueños son seguir progresando en su negocio y tener trabajo en lo que es su profesión.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the Los Ceibos community bank meets in the Las Orquideas neighborhood in Portoviejo. This is an area on the outskirts of the city where people make a living in a variety of ways. This is where we find 30 year old Sonia, who is married and has two children in school ages 9 and 6. Her husband is a civil engineer. She also has a degree in civil engineering. 

Even though she has a degree she makes a living selling all kinds of clothing from her home where she has a small shop. She also delivers when she has a special order. She works every evening and all day on weekends while offering credit to her customers who make payments every two weeks. 

She buys her goods in Quito and Guayaquil, where she travels in 2-4 weeks intervals depending on her needs. This loan will be used to travel to Quito to get more women's clothing. 

She has been a part of the community bank since its founding and likes it because the loans help finance her business. Her dream is to keep growing the business and to work in her field of study.

loans.use: Purchase clothing, especially for women

loans.name: Nancy Mercedes

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Las Orquídeas  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal los Ceibos, esta es una zona urbana marginal donde las personas se dedican a diversas actividades.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Nancy, ella tiene 36 años de edad, en la actualidad se encuentra divorciada, de esta relación tuvo tres hijos de 15 -  13 y 10 años, los dos mayores están en colegio y el menor en escuela.
 
En su casa tiene un negocio de cabinas telefónicas, también vende tarjetas y recargas de teléfono, trabaja todos los días desde las 7h30 hasta las 22h00, dice que le va más o menos por lo que en su barrio no hay otras cabinas, en la actualidad quiere comprar e instalar el servicio de internet para brindar a sus clientes este servicio.

Este crédito es justamente para ayudar a comprar dos computadores e instalar el servicio de internet. Este es se segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son mejorar su negocio y comprar un carro algún día.
texts.en:
The village bank of Los Ceibos meets every fifteen days in the Las Orquídeas neighborhood of the city of Portoviejo. In this low-income urban area, people make their living by various means.

This is where we met Nancy, a 36-year-old woman who is currently divorced and has three children from this relationship. Her children are 15, 13 and 10 years old. The elder two are in middle school and the youngest is in elementary school.

She runs a phone booth business out of her home where she also sells calling cards and prepaid phone cards. She works every day from 7:30am to 10pm. She says it's going fairly well as there are no other phone booths in her neighborhood. Now she would like to purchase and set up internet services so that she'll be able to offer this service to her customers.

This loan is precisely intended to help her purchase two computers and to set up internet services. This is her second time working with the village bank, which she appreciates for the ease with which you can obtain loans.

She dreams of improving her business and buying a car one day.

loans.use: Purchase of two computers and internet installation

loans.name: Han

texts.en:
Mrs. Han T. is a 35 year old married woman and a local villager living in a medium-sized home with family members in Kompong Tom Province. She has three children, all of whom are single. She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She uses this land to grow crops and vegetable crops in her farmland.

She has a life partner in her husband, who sells rattan beds, which he makes from raw materials to sell at the market. Mrs. Han T.’s husband thinks that it is time to sustain his investment's growth and look for extra revenue. He wants to pick up his materials in a large amount, but he doesn’t have a big enough vehicle to transport more products. To achieve her husband's goal, Mrs. Han T. has decided to seek a loan in order to purchase a trailer for her husband to connect to his motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer for her husband to connect with to his motorbike.

loans.name: Condrada

texts.en:
Condrada S. is 53 years old, married, and supports her family by operating two business ventures: buying and selling charcoal and a general store. She lives in Prk. 2, Bulungan, Toledo City, Cebu.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her buying and selling charcoal and general store businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 15,000. Condrada is now borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she can purchase more stocks to sell. This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 13,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Condrada aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea M., age 38, owns and operates a handicraft business whose main activity is selling rattan cupboards and beds. Her husband helps her to sell the finished products that they either weave or buy in bulk from other weavers. This couple has been married for many years, but they have only one child. This family’s living conditions are not so good because their house is damaged because of heavy wind. To solve the problem, Chea M. requested a loan to purchase a piece of wood for mending her house.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of wood to mend her house.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia  D. is a widow who lives in Brgy. Pandacan, Pinamungajan, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  food vending and a sari-sari store. She has 3 children who are between 33 and 37 years old.

Delia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 6 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Delia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 7th loan, she is borrowing PHP 18,000, which she intends to use to purchase raw materials for business so that she can continue to save up for future assistance to her grandson to finish his studies. Delia D. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Sem M. currently makes rattan cupboard furniture. She is 56 years old and a resident of Kompong Tom Province, located about 250 km from the capital, Phnom Penh.  Her husband is a construction worker. She has five children: four are married and one is single.

Sem M. saves up over 8 sets of rattan and then sells them to her customers for profit. Generally, her valued clients need to order a few days or a week in advance. Sem M. will be using her loan to add to her personal savings in order to buy a plot of her neighbor’s farmland near her house, which is a good location for farming. She will rent out this land to farmers for a fee. The loan will provide her with an additional new asset.

loans.use: To buy a plot of her neighbor’s farmland near her house, which is a good location for farming.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokha M. is 37 years old and her husband, Mr. Sarith Saum, is 35 years old. They live along National Road Number One, about thirty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1994 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. Four of them attend school and another one stays at home.

Sokha is a rice farmer and her husband is a mechanic. She is asking for her first loan of $1,200 to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm. She also wants to supplement a new business selling grocery items at home, so Sokha will use a part of her loan to build a grocery store and buy grocery items for resale.

In the photo: Mrs. Sokha M. and her husband

loans.use: To use for farming and to build grocery store.

loans.name: Yessenia Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Yessenia del Carmen S. H., tiene 34 años, vive en el Barrio Laureles Norte, es casado, y tienen un hijo que pronto estará preparado para entrar a la universidad, ellos tienen un negocio de venta de productos de ferretería desde hace mas de 20 años que tienen su tienda, ya ha tenido a lo largo de estos años muy buenos resultado con el alza de los precios de los últimos años se ha visto en varias ocasiones con bajas en las ventas, la razón por la cual solicita este préstamo es para la compra de mayor inventario de mercadería que le permita surtir su negocio, aumentar su capital de trabajo y favorecer a su único hijo con los recursos necesarios para solventar los gastos universitarios para su debida formación académica.
texts.en: Yessenia del Carmen S. H. is 34 years old and lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood. She is married, and they have a son that will soon be prepared to enter university. They have a business selling hardware and have had their store for over 20 years. Over the years they have had good results. With the rise of prices in recent years, sales have dipped on various occasions. The reasons she is requesting this loan is to buy a greater inventory of merchandise that will allow her to stock up her business, increase her working capital and help her only son with the resources necessary to cover the costs of university for his proper academic training.

loans.use: To buy hardware items for her business.

loans.name: Silbio Antonio

texts.es: El señor Silbio Antonio C. C. tiene la edad de 41 años habita en el barrio Los Rios, vive con su pareja de vida, tienen 3 hijos menores de edad que estudian  y ayudan a sus papas en los trabajos del hogar, ellos son agricultores desde hace mas de 21 años, y los problemas de las plagas les han disminuido las cosechas, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes para un mantenimiento Fitosanitario optimo que ataque el problema y se produzca un mejor cosecha que aporte una mejor economía a la familia, mas a los pequeños que pronto entraran a la Universidad y esperan tener los recursos para solventar este gasto para su mejor desarrollo y el de sus futuras familias.
texts.en: Silbio Antonio C. C. is 41 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Los Rios with his life partner. They have 3 young children who are studying and help their parents with the work around their home. They have been farmers for more than 21 years, and the problems of pests have decreased their harvests, which is why he is asking for a loan to buy supplies and fertilizers to maintain optimum plant health. This will attack the problem and produce a better harvest which will better support the family financially, especially the young ones who will soon go to University. They hope to have the resources to pay this cost for their self development and their future families.

loans.use: Plant Health Maintenance

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie M. is 42years old. She is married and supports her family by operating 2 business ventures, a Sari-sari(general) store and a food vending business. Elvie lives in Sin-sin, Bato, Toledo City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2001 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her Sari-sari store and food vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 3000. Elvie is now borrowing PHP 15000 that she could use as additional working capital. This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 14000, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Elvie aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way.

 About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Bayraa

texts.en:
Bayraa is 52 years old, lives in a small house with his wife, daughter and grandchild in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Two children are all grown up but the youngest daughter still lives in her parents' house.  She will go to university in Korea, leaving her baby with her parents this spring. The eldest daughter is separated from them.

In the year 2000, he started his transportation business with capital of 2.500,000 MNT and purchased a van for transporting people in the city. After a while, the government plans to enact a law forbidding the use of vans for transportation in the city. Therefore, Bayraa has purchased another used bus from the auto transportation service and used a loan from us.

He is renting one of his buses to someone else and his wife works along with him, collecting fares and announcing stops as he drives. Bayraa is  operating his other bus with someone he pays. He is a very clever, responsible and hardworking person.

Bayraa is planning to build a big house for his family. The loan will be used to purchase a new motor and four wheels to keep his buses operating efficiently.

loans.use: To purchase a new bus motor and four wheels to keep his buses operating efficiently.

loans.name: Merlin

texts.en:
Merlin G. is 27 years old, married and supports her family by operating a sari-sari (general) store. She lives in Sitio Tata-an, Brgy. Bato, Toledo City, Cebu. Merlin has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her sari-sari (general) store, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. Merlin now earns an average monthly income of PHP 2500. Merlin wants to borrow PHP 11000 so that she can  purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 4th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 8000, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Merlin aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe P. is a married woman who lives in Prk 3, Brgy. Bunga, Toledo City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating 3 business ventures: a  carenderia/eatery and a computer games and transport business. Her husband, Danilo P., works as a driver to earn his living and he also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 3 children who are between 10 and 19 years old. Fe joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 5 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Fe has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of PHP 8000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 6th cycle loan, Fe wants to borrow PHP 12000 which she intends to use to buy some items for her carenderia. She will use any profits to buy a motorcycle. Fe P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more items for her restaurant.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: El Señor Francisco Javier O. G.. Tiene la edad de 50 años es casado y se dedica al comercio de frutas, ellos tienen 6 hijos de los cuales uno de ellos es adolescentes y los otros 5 mayores de edad que trabajan para diferentes empresas y en sus tiempos libres apoyan a las actividades del hogar, el Señor O. es Agricultor desde hace 32 años de los cuales se ha enfrentado a diversos problemas de Plagas, fue gracias al apoyo de la reforma agraria de los 80 que lograron iniciarse en esta labor que a lo largo de los año ha sido el suministro alimenticio de toda su familia, es para su negocio que solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales agrícolas tales como fertilizantes e insumos vegetativos que integren un Mantenimiento Fitosanitario correcto para su mejoría económica y beneficio de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Francisco Javier O. G. is 50 years old, married, and works as a fruit trader. He and his wife have six children, one of whom is still a teenager. The other five children are adults who work at different businesses and help with the household activities in their spare time. Sr. O. has been farming for 32 years and has confronted a variety of pest problems. Thanks to the help of agrarian reform that was enacted in the 1980s, he was able to begin working on his own and supply food for his entire family for many years.

Francisco is requesting a business loan so that he can buy farming materials such as fertilizers and supplies used for administering proper phytosanitary maintenance (protection against a various pests and diseases). This will help him improve financially and provide benefits for his entire family.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & supplies to protect against pests and diseases

loans.name: Soeu

texts.en: Mr. Soeu L., 42, sells rattan cupboards and beds in the province of Kompong Tom. For four years, Soeu L. and his wife have owned a handicraft business, which they run from their home. They also sell their products in bulk to middlemen who then sell them  retail at the market. The demand for their craft is very high.  Almost all of their customers need to wait a few weeks before they can meet the orders. This couple wish to own a horse cart that they can use it to transport their products in and around their community, but they don't have enough money to buy one.  Mr. Soeu L. would like to request a loan to purchase a horse cart to transport his productsl. Mr. Soeu L. was not available the day of the photo, so his wife is in the photo instead.

loans.use: To purchase a horse cart for transport products to sell.

loans.name: Vantin

texts.en:
Mr. Vantin T. and his wife, Mrs. Sopheap Norng, have been married since 1996 and have three children:  two sons and one daughter. Two of them are in school and another one is still young and stays at home. The family lives along National Road Number One, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Vantin is a motor taxi driver and he drives in Phnom Penh City. His wife sells fish in the local market. Unfortunately, his motorbike is old and breaks often, so he spends a lot of money to repair it very often. 

Facing this, he decided to ask for his first loan of $800. He will use the loan to purchase a new motorbike to replace the old one.

Mr. Vantin T., his wife and their young son are pictured.

loans.use: To purchase new motorbike to continue his motor taxi business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase fertilizers and fungicides

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.en:
Jumagul K. is a married mother of two children. She sells socks at an open market in Tursunzade city. The very good location of her vending place brings many clients her way. Her business does well. Jumagul has been in this business for 25 years, ever since she saw that socks were one of the few products that sell well and produces a stable income. Jumagul would like a loan of $1500 USD to add an assortment of winter goods. She would spend additional income to improve her living conditions. 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new goods in order to increase the assortment of products for sale.

loans.name: Savat

texts.en:
Mr. Savat M. is 45 year old and his wife, Mrs. Hoeun Keat, is 44 years old (they are pictured together).  They have been married since 1984 and have four children:  two sons and two daughters. The family lives along National Road Number One about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Savat is a rice farmer. His wife has been raising fish at home for a year. She wants to supplement a new business raising pigs, so he is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy piglets to raise and he will use a part of the loan to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his farm.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise and also for growing rice.

loans.name: Eliseo

texts.es: El señor Eliseo C. tiene la edad de 54 años vive en el Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla, es casado y su esposa se dedica  a los trabajos del hogar, ellos son agricultores desde hace mas de 21 años, se han enfrentado a problemas de plagas y con el apoyo de su papa fue que aprendió los trabajos de la siembra, desde hace momento esta ha sido su fuente de ingresos, es para su negocio que solicita un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes y fungicidas que permitan un mantenimiento Fitosanitario adecuado para la mejora continua de su producción, tras esto una mejoría continua en las condiciones de vida de su pequeña familia que sirva para un mejor retiro de el y su pareja, así mismo desean invertir en su vivienda puesto que presenta un deterioro por las lluvias que han azotado fuertemente estos últimos meses. Ellos son personas muy responsables y trabajadoras que con el Apoyo que en otras ocaiones les han brindado ha mejorado de sobremanera su situación socio-económica.
texts.en:
Mr. Eliseo C., 54, lives in Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla.  He’s married and his wife’s a housewife.  They have been farmers for over 21 years.  He has faced pest infestations.  His father taught him farming skills and since then farming has been his source of income.

The loan is for his business.  He needs to buy fertilizers and fungicides to maintain good plant health for continuous production improvement.  This leads to improved living conditions for his small family as well as a better retirement for him and his spouse. He also wants to invest in his home because the recent heavy rains have caused some damage.

They are very responsible and hard working people whose socio-economic situation has been greatly improved by past support.

loans.use: For plant health maintenance.

loans.name: Yorng

texts.en:
Mrs. Yorng Y. is a 49-year-old single mother who has been living for years in Kompong Tom province. She was married, but her husband died several years ago. Yorng works from home making furniture which she sells. She has four children, two of whom are in school, and two who are married, live in their own houses and help her make furniture.

Yorng’s furniture is made mostly from wood and rattan. Most of her output consists of beds and cupboards, which she accumulates and sells in sets. Recently, Yorng has run out of materials from her stock of wood and rattan, so she would like a loan in order to buy additional materials and more rattan beds to sell.

loans.use: To buy additional materials and more rattan beds to sell

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Juana del Carmen G. E., tiene la edad de 49 años vive en el Barrio Gaspar G., es casada y su esposo labora como albañil, tienen 3 hijos mayores de edad de los cuales dos de ellos, estudian la universidad y el otro en la escuela secundaria, ella se dedica al comercio de diferentes mercadería que las ofrece en diferentes localidades, desde hace mas de 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad, ellos han logrado construir su humilde hogar, pero la limitación de los recursos monetarios, le han obstaculizado la culminación de las remodelaciones de su vivienda, es esta la razón de solicitud de su préstamo  para la compra de materiales de construcción para la edificación de un muro en la parte trasera de su hogar, para un mejorar las comodidades de su hogar, y dividir el terreno de la casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana del Carmen García E., 49, lives in the Gaspar García neighborhood.  She’s married and her husband works as a bricklayer.  They have three adult children.  Two of them are in the university and the third is in secondary school.  She retails assorted merchandise in various locations.  She’s been in this business for over 10 years.

They have managed to build a humble home but limited monetary resources has been an obstacle to finishing their home’s improvements; thus the reason for this loan request.

She will buy building materials and supplies to erect a wall in the rear of her home for better comfort and to divide the lot.

loans.use: To build a wall.

loans.name: Vuthy

texts.en:
Mr. Vuthy K. (pictured with his wife) is 22 years old and his wife, Mrs. Sina Krut, is 21 years old.  They live in a small village across the MeK. River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2004 and have two children: one son and one daughter. All of them are still young.  

Vuthy is a construction worker and his wife sells fish in the local market. Besides these businesses, the couple grows rice as well. Vuthy is asking for his first loan of $1,000 for his rice growing business. He will use $600 of the loan to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide, and the other $400 to buy a water pumping machine to spray his rice farm.

loans.use: To use for farming.

loans.name: Razia Mushtaq Ahmed's Group

texts.en:
Razia M. A. lives in Riwind, a small city in Pakistan known for its dairy industry. She is married to M. A. who works at a private company for a monthly wage. She lives with her family in a two-room brick house.

Razia is a housewife who stays at home and performs her household duties. She has given birth to three sons and a daughter. All are illiterate except her daughter who is studying at the fifth class level. All three of her sons work. Her eldest son has a grocery store in the market. The middle son has a burger joint, and the youngest is a tailor by profession. They all contribute to the family financially from their earnings.

Razia has applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner Asasah for her eldest son’s grocery store business. His store is located in the busiest market, and his business demands that he keep in stock all the necessary items required by his customers. He will invest the loan to purchase groceries in bulk for his store which will enable him to make more sales and increase his income. Razia is hopeful that this loan investment will shape up his business and move it towards success.

Razia is a regular Asasah borrower, and this is her third loan application. She is a client who has responsibly made her payments during her previous loan periods. In the photo, the woman who holds a book (called an “Asasah Passbook”) in her hands is Razia.

loans.use: To buy groceries in bulk quantities for her son's grocery store

loans.name: Ruzikhol

texts.en:
Ruzikhol M. is married and has two children. She runs a small business primarily selling candies and sweets. She has been in this business for about ten years. One of Ruzikhol’s goals is to be able to remodel her apartment and improve her living conditions.

Ruzikhol has requested a loan of 6500 TJS to buy additional candies and sweets. She is concerned that prices will go up soon and would like to buy in bulk now when prices are lower. The loan will help Ruzikhol increase her income and continue to operate a stable, sustainable business.

About Tajikistan:

Tajikistan is known for its rich place in history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the farthest reach of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged its already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve their agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

About IMON:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients have access to reasonable financial services. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy goods in bulk

loans.name: Mach

texts.en:
Mrs. Mach P. (in the photo) is 31 years old and her husband, Mr. Sam-ol Em is 35 years old. They live in a small village off of National Road Number Two about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have two children--one son and one daughter.

Mach is a garment factory worker. Her husband is a motor taxi driver. She hopes to generate income by raising pigs and a cow. So, Mach is asking for her first loan of US$ 1,200 to purchase a cow and piglets to raise.  

When the cow gives birth, she will be able to earn more income from selling the calves or when the cow grows to full size, she will be able to sell the cow for beef. 

And once the pigs are fully grown, she will sell the pigs for meat.

loans.use: To purchase a cow and piglets to raise

loans.name: Polo

texts.en:
Mr. Polo T. (in the photo with his wife) is 38 years old and his wife, Mrs. Srung Hoem is 44 years old. They have been married since 1992 and have four children--three sons and one daughter. Two of them are in school and the other two are still young and stay at home. The family lives along National Road Number One, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Polo and his wife are farmers. They grow vegetables such as green beans, cucumbers and cauliflower on their farmland in the village. The couple does not have enough capital to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain their vegetable farm.

Hence Polo is asking for his first loan of US$ 500 to provide his capital.

loans.use: To use for growing green beans, cucumbers and cauliflower

loans.name: Aloys

texts.en:
Aloys N. is forty years old. He is married with five children who are now between the ages of one and fourteen. Four of his children are currently attending school. Aloys is from Kisii in western Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for ten years and employs one farmhand. His farm produces napier grass (used as animal forage and for biofuels) and bananas that are all sold locally. He also owns and manages a local school.

Aloys has requested this loan of 45,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him pay school fees for his children with no problems. His biggest challenge in farming has been insufficient land upon which to expand his farming activities. He hopes, however, to expand his dairy farming in the future by acquiring more dairy cows.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Sovanna

texts.en:
Mr. Sovanna O. is a 35-year-old and his wife, Mrs. Phalleap Sao is a 34-year-old (pictured together). They have been married since 1999 and have three children--one sO. and two daughters. Both daughters are in school and the sO. is still young and stays at home. The family lives along National Road Number One about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sovanna is a teacher. His wife sells rice and other food at school along with her husband. He is applying for his first loan of US$ 1,000 to replace their motorcycle for commuting because the old one breaks down and uses a lot of gasoline. He will also use a part of the loan to provide capital for his wife to expand her business.

loans.use: To replace their motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Sarantsetseg

texts.en:
Sarantsetseg S. is 36 years old and lives with her husband and three sons in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent, in Huvsgul province, Mongolia. Two of her sons attend a local secondary school, and her husband operates a transportation business between sub-provinces.

Sarantsetseg operates a hair salon in her own space. She began her business in 1997 after graduating as a hairdresser from vocational school. In 2007 she built a wooden house and opened her hair salon in it. Over the years she has built a stable operation and has gained much experience as a hairdresser.

In the future, she wants to improve her workplace and provide good service in a convenient environment for her customers. Sarantsetseg is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more beauty products and tools for her salon as well as to decorate her work place.

loans.use: To purchase more beauty products and tools

loans.name: Soninhuu

texts.en:
Soninhuu D. is 31 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Huvsgul Province, Mongolia. She and her family all live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her sons attend secondary school while her husband works as a carpenter in their town. Her husband produces a variety of wood products and has built a stable operation with many loyal customers.

Soninhuu has been operating a grocery business since 2007, and since then her business has reached a stable level. She would like to expand the business and one day purchase her own wood pavilion at the local market. Soninhuu is a modest and hardworking woman and is requesting a 3,300,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventory for her growing grocery business in order to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Lukas

texts.en:
Lukas O. is forty years old, married and has three school-aged children who all attend school. He has been practicing mixed farming for ten years in Kisii, western Kenya. His mixed farm produces maize, beans and sweet potatoes which are all sold locally. He also earns income from other employment. He says that his biggest challenges have been drought that affects his production and the high cost of animal feed.

Lukas has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo of 35,000 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that this loan will enable him to purchase a quality dairy cow that will produce enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The proceeds from the sale of his milk will help him pay school fees for his children. He will also be able to get enough manure for his farm. In the future he would like to purchase more dairy cows to increase his milk production and enable him to sell milk on a large scale.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Odom

texts.en:
Mr. Odom R. (in the photo) is 34 years old and his wife, Mrs. Sokny Say is 31 years old; they have been married since 1997 and have four children--two sons and two daughters. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh, approximately 25 kilometers away.

Odom is an ice deliveryman. He buys ice and then delivers it to customers who have businesses that require ice, such as people who sell cold drinks or noodles. His wife assists her husband in the business.  

Odom is asking for his first loan of US$ 1,000 to expand his business by purchasing additional ice for resale.

loans.use: To expand his ice delivery business

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en:
Tungalag D. is 50 years old and lives with her two children in Uvurhangai Province, central Mongolia. They all live together in her ger, a traditional Mongolian tent home, in her sibling's yard. One son recently finished his bachelor’s degree and works as an engineer at the local mine.

Tungalag is a pharmacist and had worked in a drug store till 2001. Since then, she started to operate her own pharmaceutical business in the local market. In addition, she began to supplement her pharmacy earnings by selling a variety of cosmetic products and accessories such as bags, manicure sets, etc.

Tungalag stopped operating her pharmacy when pharmacies without licenses were forbidden to sell medicine. Her cosmetics trade then became her main business from 2003 on. Her other son lives and works in Korea and helps by sending cosmetics to her. She stocks up two to three times a month.

Tungalag is a very optimistic, diligent and hardworking woman. She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more cosmetics and accessories for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics and accessories

loans.name: Geovanna Dolores

texts.es:
Geovanna de 42 años, es venderá informal, vive en las Orquideas de Guayaquil (lugar caracterizado por que en su descubrimiento hubo muchas flores orquídeas). 

Escogió ser comerciante informal porque le gustaba la venta de bisutería y ropa a nivel particular, comenzó con poca mercadería hasta que incremento su capital tubo que vender a sus vecinos y conocidos. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 09h00am hasta las 12h00 todos los días. Vende ropa, bisutería a un precio muy barato.  Gracias a que la zona donde vive es comercial hasta ahora no ha tenido problemas con las ventas. 

Quiere comprar con el préstamo ropa para incrementar su mercedaria y así sus clientes tengan más variedad al comprar. En el futuro quiere tener un local bien adecuado para continuar con sus ventas y un estilo de vida mejor.
texts.en:
Geovanna, age 42, is an informal merchant who lives in Orquideas de Guayaquil (a place known for having several orchids when the area was discovered).

Geovanna chose to become an informal merchant because she enjoys selling jewelry and a particular style of clothing. She began with very little merchandise until she was able to increase her capital by selling to neighbors and acquaintances. At the moment, she works every day between the hours of 9am and midnight. Geovanna sells clothing and jewelry at a very low price. Since she lives in a commercial area, she has no problems making sales.

Geovanna wants to use this loan to increase her inventory of merchandise so that her customers will have more variety from which to buy. In the future, she wants to have a store that is adequate for continuing her sales and will help her achieve a better lifestyle.

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Parveen Shokat Ali's Group

texts.en:
Parveen S. A. is 44 years old, married to S. A. and has three sons and a daughter. Her husband has a cycle repair shop in the market which he has been running for over seven years. During this time he has successfully obtained a good reputation among his customers through his quality work. He and Parveen live in Riwind, a small city in Pakistan famous for its dairy industry. Parveen and her husband couldn’t educate their children due to financial constraints. They all now do different kinds of work to contribute to the family financially.

Parveen supports her family financially by sewing and selling clothes. She mainly gets sewing orders from her neighborhood clients and sells a variety of her clothes to different clothing shops. She also imports clothes from Faisalabad (famous for its textile industry in Pakistan) at cheap rates, and by selling them to different clothing shops she earns a good profit.

Parveen has applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner Asasah for her clothing business. She will invest the loan in purchasing clothes of different varieties in bulk quantities. The bulk purchasing will cut her cost of travelling and also minimize the purchase price. She is experienced in her business and is confident that after investment, her business will improve and she will easily pay back her loan installments.

Parveen is a regular Asasah borrower. This is her fourth loan application. In previous loan periods, she proved herself a responsible client who never missed any meetings and paid her installments on time.

In the photo, the woman who holds a book (called an “Asasah Passbook”) in her hands is Parveen.

loans.use: To buy clothes for clothes selling business

loans.name: Zarina Majeed Ahmad Khan's Group

texts.en:
Zarina M. A. K. is a widow who lost her husband to a heart attack a few years ago. She is a resident of Riwind that is famous for its dairy industry in Pakistan. She is the mother of three sons and a daughter and has been living with them in a two-room brick house for the last 25 years.

Zarina couldn’t educate her children due to unfavorable circumstances, and they had to start working at an early age to financially help support the family. Her eldest and youngest sons have a video game shop, while her second son works in a factory for a monthly wage. Her daughter is sixteen years old and is studying at the tenth class level.

Zarina has applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner Asasah for her sons’ video game shop. They will invest the loan in purchasing more video games. Their shop is famous in surrounding areas, and their clientele base is young kids. They have been doing this business for over ten years, and Zarina is very confident that through this investment her sons will successfully be able to introduce new and interesting games to their customers and double their income in size.

Zarina is a regular Asasah borrower, and this is her fourth loan application. In previous loan periods, she was a responsible client who paid her duties responsibly.

In the photo, the woman who holds a book (called an “Asasah Passbook”) in her hands is Zarina.

loans.use: To buy video games for her sons' shop

loans.name: Yon

texts.en:
Mrs. Yon Y. (in the photo), and her husband, Mr. Kouk Kem, have been married since 1981 but have no children yet. The family lives along National Road Number 5, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Yon stays at home and does housework. The main income for the family is from her husband’s business; he sells cows. He buys them in a nearby village for resale in his village. 

Yon is requesting a loan of US$ 500 to help her husband to continue his business by purchasing more cows for resale.

loans.use: To help her husband  purchase more cows for resale

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a dairy farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya. She has been practicing dairy farming for 30 years and employs one farmhand. Her main product is milk, which she sells locally. 

Rebecca is 48 years old and a married mother of five children who are all adults. Her youngest child is currently attending school.

She has requested this loan of 35,000 Kenyan shillings through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that her family will be guaranteed enough milk for consumption and her income will increase through the sale of milk. She will therefore be able to pay school fees for her child with ease. She says that her biggest challenge has been lack of a market for her product. She plans to increase the number of her dairy cows in the future to enable her to sell milk on a large scale.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Rom

texts.en:
Mrs. Rom P. (in the photo) is 48 years old, and her husband, Mr. Noun Pum is 46 yeas old; they live in a small village on National Road Number 2, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They married in 1987 and have three children--one son and two daughters. 

Mrs. Rom P. has been operating a business producing rice wine and raising pigs for 15 years. Her husband sells grocery items at home. She is asking for a loan of US$ 250 to purchase feed for her pigs.

loans.use: To use for raising pigs

loans.name: Luis Ernesto

texts.es: Luis Ernesto A. M. de 48 años de edad, es una persona muy esforzada quien ha trabajado muy duro por sacar adelante a su familia. Él vive junto a su esposa y una hija de 18 años de edad, quien se dedica a estudiar. Luis posee un molino el cual esta ubicado en su casa de habitación en el departamento de Usulután, en donde las personas llegan a moler: maíz, frijoles, verduras y diferentes tipos de alimentos ya sea para elaborar algún tipo de masa o para hacer salsas. Luis solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar un molino más y de esta forma atender a más personas, ya que muchas veces no da abasto con el que ya posee. Él desea mucho mejorar su negocio, debido a que es la única fuente de ingresos que posee para vivir de una forma digna.
texts.en:
Luis Ernesto A. M. is 48 years old. He is a determined individual who works hard so that he can succeed on behalf of his family. Luis lives with his wife and 18 year old daughter who is a student. He operates a grain mill located in his home in the Department of Usulután where his customers bring him different types of food to process such as corn, beans, vegetables, and other items used for making flour or sauces.

Luis is requesting a loan so that that he will have the money needed to purchase another grain mill. This will enable him to serve more customers since there have been several occasions when he could not keep up with the machine he already owns. Luis wants to improve his business since this is the only source of income from which he is able to live a decent life.

loans.use: Purchase another grain mill

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis Alberto P. de 36 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Usulután, en donde vive junto a su esposa y su hijo de 5 años de edad. Desde hace varios años atrás que él se dedica a atender su propio negocio el cual es una tienda de productos varios como productos para el hogar, para uso personal y productos alimenticios. Luis vive en su hogar junto a su compañera de vida, la cual le ayuda a atender el negocio, ambos trabajan con muchos deseos de salir adelante y así mismo de mejorar su negocio, surtiéndolo con todos los productos posibles para obtener más ganancias. Luis solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda invertir en la tienda comprando productos como: pan, medicinas, golosinas, diferentes tipos de bebidas, detergentes, granos básicos y muchos productos más los cuales son primordiales en un negocio como este, ya que son los que más se solicitan. Luis desea mucho poder prosperar en su negocio, sobretodo porque es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto P., age 36, resides in the Department of Usulután with his wife and five year old child. For several years he has managed his own business. Luis has a store where he sells different household products, toiletries, and food items. He lives at home with his lifetime companion who helps him manage the business. They both work with great motivation to get ahead and improve their business. Their store is stocked will as many products as possible in order to generate more income.

Luis is requesting a loan so that he can invest in more merchandise for his store such as bread, medicines, sweets, different types of beverages, detergents, basic grains, and many other products that are essential to this type of business and frequently requested. He has great hopes of prospering in his business since this is his only source of income.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for his store

loans.name: Ángela Guadalupe

texts.es: Ángela Guadalupe Z. M. de 24 años de edad, es una joven muy responsable con su hogar y en su trabajo. Ella vive en el departamento de La Libertad junto a su esposo y una pequeña hija de 7 años de edad, así mismo vive junto a sus padres y un hermano menor. Ángela se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogo como: perfumes, maquillaje, ropa, zapatos, accesorios para la cocina y otros más, su negocio es bastante estable ya que cuenta con una cantidad bastante grande de clientes los cuales mes a mes consumen los productos que ella comercializa de forma ambulante, haciendo visitas de casa en casa mostrando los diferentes catálogos. De esta forma Ángela se gana la vida y es así como le brinda el apoyo necesario a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Es por esto que ella solicita un préstamo para poder comprar mayor variedad de zapatos y así mismo diferentes productos para ofrecer a sus clientes a los cuales en su mayoría compran a crédito por lo que Ángela necesita cierta cantidad de dinero para invertir en el negocio.
texts.en:
Ángela Guadalupe Z. M. is 24 years old and a responsible young woman at home and in her job. She lives in the Department of La Libertad with her husband and seven year old daughter. In addition, she lives with her parents and younger brother. Ángela sells products by catalog such as perfumes, makeup, clothing, shoes, cooking accessories, and many other items. Her business is stable since she has a large number of customers who buy products month after month. She sells merchandise as a traveling merchant, going house to house with different catalogs. Through this type of work, Ángela is able to earn a living and provide assistance to her husband with the household expenses.

For this reason, Ángela is requesting a loan so that she can buy a larger variety of shoes as well as other products to offer to her customers. Most of her customers purchase on credit, so she needs a specific amount of money to invest in her business.

loans.use: Purchase catalog products to sell

loans.name: Otgonbaatar

texts.en:
Otgonbaatar is  36 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He and his family  live together in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Two children attend a local secondary school, and the youngest one attends kindergarten. His wife works along with him.  

He started a retail business in 2005, renting a stall in Narantuul market, the most crowded market in the city. He purchases a variety of products from Ereen, a Chinese border city, and sells them for a profit. With his earnings, he has been providing money for family expenses and he is planning to build a wooden house on his plot of land. He is a very hardworking and optimistic person. After years of successful business operation, he rented one more stall where he has been selling his products.

The reason why he is asking for a loan is to increase his working capital.

loans.use: to increase his working capital

loans.name: Sambat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sambat N. (pictured above), 37, and her husband, Mr. Soy Sok, are fishermen. They fish from the nearby lake and sell their catch in Prek Phnao market.

The couple has been married since 1987 and have four children--two sons and two daughters. One of them has full-time employment and the other three attend school. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number Five, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Because their children commute to school far away, they have to take motor remorque or motor taxi very often. A remorque is a motorcycle with a trailer on the back. Taking a remorque to school is expensive for the family. 

Hence Sambat is asking for her first loan of US$ 1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for her children for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her children to drive to school

loans.name: Candida

texts.es: Candida M. D. E. D. 45 años D. edad, vive junto a tres hijos, los cuales dependen por completo D. ella, debido a que Candida es madre soltera, junto a ellos resiD. en el departamento D. San Salvador. Ella posee un ciber café, en el cual brinda el servicio D. Internet y así mismo comercializa otros artículos como: cuadernos, lápices, lapiceros, diferentes tipos D. papelería, CD’s y otros más. En el negocio le ayudan sus hijos, D. modo que todos trabajan muy duro para sacar adelante su hogar. Candida solicita un préstamo con el deseo D. mejorar su servicio, comprando productos como: audífonos, cámaras web, nuevos monitores, parlantes y otros accesorios muy útiles y necesarios para las computadoras que él alquila. D. esta forma Candida desea ir creciendo más y más y así contar con un negocio muy estable, el cual le brinD. una mejor estabilidad económica para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Candida M. D. E. is 45 years old and lives with her three children, all of whom are dependent on her. She is a single mother and lives with her family in the Department of San Salvador. Candida manages a cybercafé where she provides Internet services and sells merchandise such as notebooks, pencils, pens, different types of stationery, CDs, and other items. Her business allows her to help her children, since they all work hard to get ahead.

Candida is requesting a loan because she wants to improve her service. She plans to buy headphones, web cameras, new monitors, speakers, and other needed accessories for the computers she makes available for rent. Candida wants to keep growing so that she will have a stable business, which will help her proviD. better financial stability for herself and her family.

loans.use: Purchase computer accessories

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Sixty-four-year-old Rachel is a widowed mother of eight children who are between the ages of 15 and 32. Four of the children are currently attending school. She is a farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya. She has been farming for 10 years and has employed two farmhands. Her mixed farm produces maize, millet and bananas, which are all sold locally. She also operates a kiosk in the same area.

Rachel has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 35,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that with this loan, she will be able to acquire a quality dairy cow that will produce enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The proceeds from this loan will help her pay school fees for her children. 

Her primary challenges have been drought, which affects her production, and lack of enough capital to expand and diversify her farming activities. She hopes to acquire more dairy cows in the future that will increase her milk production and earn her more income.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Joselyn Vanessa

texts.es: Joselyn Vanessa P. G. de 20 años de edad, es una persona muy trabajadora, la cual reside en San Marcos, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como albañil y junto a sus dos pequeños hijos de 2 años de edad y el menor de 3 meses de vida. Joselyn se dedica a la venta de ropa interior femenina, la cual comercializa en el mercado de San Marcos, estas ventas las realiza de forma ambulante en las instalaciones del lugar, así mismo comercializa por encargos. Sus ventas son muy buenas, es por ello que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar ropa interior que este de moda con estampados y colores juveniles, ya que son las jóvenes quienes más compran sus productos. Ella desea mucho salir adelante y poder brindarles de esta forma una vida mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Joselyn Vanessa P. G., age 20, is a hardworking person who resides in San Marcos, Department of San Salvador. She lives with her husband, who works as a mason, and their two small children (ages 2 and 3 months). Joselyn sells women’s undergarments on the premises of the San Marcos Market as a traveling vendor. She also generates sales through orders. Her level of sales is very good, so she is requesting a loan so that she can buy undergarments with different prints and youthful colors since younger women buy more of these products.

Joselyn has great determination to succeed and provide a better life for her children.

loans.use: Purchase undergarments to sell

location.town: San Marcos, departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Veasna

texts.en:
Mr. Veasna U. (pictured above), 25, is a motorcycle repairman. His wife, Mrs. Rann Horn, 28, stays at home and takes care of their children. The couple has been married since 2006 and have one son and one daughter. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number Five approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Veasna is asking for his first loan of US$ 1,000 to purchase additional motorbike spare parts to respond to his customers’ needs.

loans.use: To purchase additional motorcycle spare parts for his motorbike repair business

loans.name: Elda Lucia

texts.es: Elda Lucia O.  de 41 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Usulután, en donde vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como albañil y junto a tres hijos de los cuales el mayor trabajo junto a su padre. Ella posee su propio negocio en el cual elabora tortillas, así mismo comercializa ropa, El negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación  en donde vende con la mayoría de sus vecinos y personas de los alrededores. Elda solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima para elaborar sus ventas, tales como maíz, leña y cal para cocer el maíz y así mismo para surtir su venta de ropa. Este negocio es muy importante para Elda ya que le permite crecer como persona, debido a que puede contar con su propio trabajo y de esta misma forma ayudar a su familia a contar con una mejor estabilidad económica y así mismo a contar con todo lo necesario.
texts.en: Elda Lucia O.  is 41 years old. She lives in the department of  Usulután with her husband, who works as a bricklayer, as well as their three children. The oldest works with his father.  She owns her own tortilla making business. She also sells clothes. The business is located in her house where she sells to most of her neighbors and people from the surrounding areas.  Elda is asking for a loan with which to buy a greater quantity of materials for her sales, such as: corn, firewood and lime to cook the corn. She will also increase the ammount of clothes to sell.  This business is very important for Elda because it allows her to grow as a person. Having her own business allows her to count on her own work and also help her family with more financial stability and being able to have everything they need.

loans.use: To buy clothing and raw materials for making tortillas.

loans.name: Rath

texts.en: Rath S., 25 years old, is a humble people living in the capital, Phnom Penh. She is married and blessed with two young school-aged children, while her husband is a motorbike taxi driver. To earn a living, Rath S. operates the small business in her house by opening Karaoke room for people around her community who wish to sing a song. Rath S. said that most income come from her husband’s business. She said that her husband’s motorbike often has broken down during use. Because of that, Rath S. has decided to seek a loan of $1,200 from Kiva, which she will use to buy new motorcycle to replace the broken one.

loans.use: To buy new motorcycle to replace the broken one.

loans.name: Sokhann

texts.en:
Mr. Sokhann P. and his wife, Mrs. Saroeun Sat (pictured with her husband), live along National Road Number One about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1989 and have two sons and two daughters. Two of them work with their parents and the other two attend school.

Sokhann and his wife are vegetable farmers. They grow cauliflower, cucumbers and other crops. Sokhann has asked for a MAXIMA loan once before. He hopes to continue increasing his productivity, so he has decided to request a second loan of 1,200 USD. He will use the loan to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticides and pay for plowing to maintain his vegetable farm.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for plowing

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es: María del Carmen M. de 64 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y un hijo mayor de edad, junto a los cuales reside en el departamento de Usulután. Ella es una señora muy trabajadora, la cual debe dar su mayor esfuerzo día con día para poder salir adelante junto a su familia. María  posee una tienda, la cual se encuentra ubicada en su casa de habitación, y en la que comercializa diferentes tipos de productos varios como: pan, golosinas, sodas y otros productos más. El mayor deseo de María es el de poder mejorar sus ventas, es por esto que solicita un préstamo con el cual pueda llevar a cabo este deseo, ya que esta es la única forma en la cual puede contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en el negocio, y así comprar todos los productos necesarios para contar con más, clientes, los cuales son muchos, ya que ella se encuentra ubicada en una zona en la cual hay una gran afluencia de personas, lo que es una gran ventaja para María, lo cual espera aprovechar al máximo, ya que contando con más productos, permitirá que las personas que transitan por ese lugar se detengan a comprar ahí. Esto llena de mucha ilusión a María porque de esta forma podrá contar con una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: María del Carmen M. is 64 years old. She lives with her husband and a grown son in the department of Usulután. She is a very hardworking woman who works as hard as she can every day to be able to get ahead with her family.  María owns a store located at her house where she sells different types of products such as: bread, candy, soft drinks and other products. Maria's greatest wish is be able to improve her sales. That is why she is asking for a loan in order to make this wish come true. This is the only way that she can have enough money to invest in the business and buy the products she needs to have more customers. There are many more customers to have, because she lives in an area where there are many people. This is a great advantage for Maria  and she hopes to be able to take full advantage of it. With more products, the people that go by that place will be able to stop and buy there. Maria is very excited about this because this way she will be able to have more financial stability.

loans.use: To buy products of basic neccesity.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mr. Sok C. and his wife, Mrs. Ry Tey (pictured with her husband), have been married since 1980 and have nine children. The family lives along National Road No. 1, about 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sok has been a fisherman for more than thirty years. He grows rice as well. His wife sells the fish that her husband catches. Sok has asked for a MAXIMA loan once before. He is now is applying for a second loan of 1,000 USD to renovate his house.

loans.use: To renovate his house

loans.name: Oscar Alfredo

texts.es: Oscar Alfredo D. de 51 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Usulután, junto a su esposa y una hija mayor de edad. Él posee un molino bastante amplio en el cual posee varias máquinas para moler los alimentos, debido a que ya cuenta con muchos años de poseer este negocio, es muy conocido en el lugar, lo que le ha permitido contar con varios clientes e incluso con una persona que le ayuda a atender a los usuarios de los molinos, de forma que pueda brindar un mejor servicio. Oscar ha trabajado de esta manera durante 25 años, por lo que el lugar en el cual se encuentra el molino esta algo deteriorado, por lo que solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda hacer todos los arreglos necesario como cambiar el techo y mejorar el pavimento del lugar. De esta forma Oscar desea tener un mejor lugar de trabajo en el cual también sus clientes se sientan más cómodos e incentivados a seguir llegando a moler los alimentos a este lugar.
texts.en: Oscar Alfredo D. is 51 years old. He lives in the department of Usulután with his wife and an adult daughter.  He has a large mill with several motors to grind grains. He has had this business for several years. He is very well known in the area and this has allowed him to have various customers and even one employee to help serve the mill users.  This way, he is able to offer a better service.  Oscar has worked this way for more than 25 years and the locale where the mill is has deteriorated a little. That is why he is asking for a loan with which he can makes the neccesary repairs such as putting on a new roof and improving the pavement.  Oscar hopes that in this way he can have a better workplace and that his clients will feel more comfortable and and have an incentive to keep coming to grind their food in his place.

loans.use: For repairs in his business' locale.

loans.name: Mean

texts.en:
Mr. Mean M., forty years old, and his wife, Mrs. Pheap Vet, 34 years old, have been married since 2000 (Mean was not available for the picture, so his wife is pictured). They have three children, two sons and one daughter. Two of their children attend school while one stays home. The family lives in the area surrounding Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Mean is a truck driver while his wife is a rice farmer. His truck breaks down, and it does not work well. He wants to repair it, but he does not have the money. Therefore, Mean is asking for his first loan of 700 USD.

loans.use: To repair his truck

loans.name: Sokkea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokkea V. (pictured with her daughter) is 34 years old and her husband, Mr. Thorn Van, is 32 years old. They have been married for ten years and have three children, one son and two daughters. All of them are in school. The family lives in a suburb approximately 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sokkea is a construction worker. Her husband is a soldier. She is requesting her first loan of 600 USD to add to her own money to purchase a motorcycle for commuting to work.

loans.use: To add to her own money to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian L. is from the town of Banga. She is 45 years old. Vivian is married and has two school-aged children. She is involved in rice farming. She makes sure the farm is free of weeds and pests to keep her crops healthy. She said it is easier to sell a good quality of rice. Vivian also runs a sari-sari (variety) store to help with her family's daily needs. She sells various kinds of products that the people in her neighborhood usually buy from her.

Vivian joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vivian has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Vivian is requesting a new loan of 12,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto V., from the town of Banga, is 50 years old, married, and has five children aged 18, 17, 15, 13 and 8, all attending school. Roberto wants his children to finish college someday and have bright futures. To sustain their education and provide for their needs, he works hard on his farm, planting and harvesting rice crops that he sells to the market. His wife manages their small sari-sari store where products including sugar and coffee are sold.

Roberto joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is now requesting a loan of 10000 PHP to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Jarkyn's Group

texts.en:
Jarkyn J., the leader of the group, is 23, married, and has a newborn daughter. Jarkyn works as a nurse, while her husband is a security guard. This year the family started to breed cattle, and with money received from the loan Jarkyn wants to purchase cattle for breeding. In the future she wants to save money and start building a new house.

Edisa S., the treasurer of the group, is 22 and married. Edisa works in a cafeteria and her husband is a private driver. Edisa hopes to obtain the loan because she needs money to invest in the cafeteria.

Janyshbek K., 26, earns money by selling mobile phones. With money received from the loan he wants to purchase more mobile phones to sell.

Aijan J., 24 and married, takes orders and sews Kyrgyz national cloth and dressmaking supplies. Her husband is a fire fighter. Aijan wants to get a loan to purchase coal for the winter.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year.

To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Natalia, who is married, sells various food products at an open market in Kahovka town, earing a monthly profit of about 4,000 Grivnas. She started this business five years ago, deciding to become self-employed because of high unemployment in her town. Moreover, this business did not require a lot of start-up capital. Today Natalia has many repeat customers and good turnover. She enjoys her business and would like to develop it further.

Natalia is requesting a loan of 10,500 Grivnas to increase working capital. In late fall there are several national celebrations, so Natalia would like to be ready to offer her clients a higher volume of produce.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma L., from the town of Banga, is 27 years old, married, and has two children aged six and four. A rice farmer, she learned to farm from her parents, who were both farmers. Her husband, also a farmer, does the major farming duties while she helps keep the farm free of weeds and pests. She also takes care of their two children and hopes to be able to provide for all their needs.

Emma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting a loan of 8000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her farm.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher, from the town of Kisii in western Kenya, is 46 years old, married, and has 9 school-aged children who are all attending school. He has been farming for 30 years and employs 6 farmhands. His mixed farm produces sugarcane, milk, vegetables and chickens which he sells to the local market, and he also earns income from his rental houses in the same location. His major challenges in farming have been insufficient farm inputs, especially for sugarcane farming, and bad debts which detract from his profits.

Christopher has requested this loan of 45,000KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that the extra income arising from this loan will help him pay his children's school fees. His asset base will also grow with the additional dairy cow. In the future, he would like to specialize in sugarcane farming and also acquire a van for transporting his products to the market.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz is the wife of M. R. and resides in a city named Depalpur in Paksitan. Shahnaz is a 45-year-old caring lady. She carries out her responsibilities as a housewife and takes care of her children well.  

Among her five children are three daughters and two sons. Only her eldest son managed to get an education till 5th class. Shahnaz and her husband are unable to provide education to her children due to financial constraints. 

Her husband is a private entrepreneur and is involved in a movie-making business. He provides his services for different parties like birthdays, marriage ceremonies, etc. He has been in this business for over five years and has a good reputation due to his quality of work. 
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s movie-making business. With the loan, he will buy a digital movie camera which will help him in producing quality work for his customers. Shahnaz is hopeful that through this investment, her husband’s business will get a new shape and enable him to get good profits on each booking. 

Shahnaz is confident that she will enroll her younger children in school with the help of the loan's profit.

loans.use: To buy a digital movie camera for a movie-making business

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru: Эшпулатова Насиба проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 41 год. Замужем, имеет одного ребенка. Муж в России на заработках. Сама Насиба имеет среднее образование. Более 10 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Арендует торговую точку, где продает фрукты. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Nasiba E. lives in the town of Turzun-zoda. She is 41 years old. She is married and has one child. Her husband works in Russia. Nasiba has secondary education.
