She has been selling on the market for more than ten years. She rents out a vending stall where she sells fruits. Nasiba is taking out a loan to increase sales.

loans.use: To increase sales

loans.name: Levi

texts.en:
Levi L., from the town of Banga, is 36 years old and married. To make a living, Levi owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting rice for sale. He also raises pigs for fattening and hopes for his small piggery to grow.

Levi joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting a loan of 12000 PHP to purchase feeds and fertilizers, he plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income.

loans.use: To purchase feeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim, who lives in Depalpur, a small city in Pakistan, is a widow who lost her husband few years ago as a result of sudden death. Devastated by this tragedy, she recovered herself for the sake of her three sons and three daughters. Unfortunately, none of them could get an education because Shamim’s husband was the only breadwinner of the family and after his death, managing the school fees became impossible for Shamim.

Because all family responsibilities then came to rest on Shamim's shoulders, she started a clothes-sewing business, receiving orders from her neighbors to fulfill the basic needs of her family. Now, as her eldest son has grown, she has taught her sewing skills to him and he is now supporting the family financially from his earnings. She is now requesting for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son to purchase a sewing machine, a purchase that will enable him to complete his work on time and receive more orders that will earn him more income.

A regular client of Asasah, this is Shamim's second loan application. In the previous loan year, she demonstrated good credit behavior and attended all meetings.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for sewing business

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra lives with her family in a two-room brick house in an area named Basti Hamid Shah in Depalpur, a small city in Pakistan. A housewife who stays at home to discharge her responsibilities, she has a two-year-old daughter who needs her mother’s full attention.

For over 10 years Bushra's husband, M. H., has been involved in a laundry business, offering washing and clothes-pressing services to his customers to earn an income for their family. He is a very hardworking person who works for nine hours on a daily basis.

Bushra is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business so that he can purchase an iron and washing machine to provide better and more timely services to his customers. She is sure that her husband will gain positive results in his business by making this loan investment.

A regular borrower from Asasah, this is Bushra's fourth loan application. In previous loan years, she proved to be a responsible client, attending all meetings and paying her installments on time.

loans.use: To buy an iron & sewing machine for laundry business

loans.name: Bujuuta 'b' Development Group-Lugazi

texts.en:
Gorreti B. of Bujuuta 'B' Development Group Lugazi, is a happy-go-lucky 43-year-old married mother of four lively school-aged children. She operates a fifteen-year-old beauty salon business in Bujuuta-Lugazi. Gorreti left farming to start it up. The salon offers hair dressing services and also sells cosmetics.

With weekly profits of 100,000 UGX, Gorreti says she is casting her mind to the future with optimism. Her sense of determination is an attribute she says is invaluable in this kind of business. With this loan, she wants to buy more cosmetics and some hair dryers.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics and hair driers

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.ru: Камолова Мавжуда проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 24 года. Замужем, имеет 2 детей. Муж на заработках в России. Сама Мавжуда не имеет высшего образования. Занимается торговлей на рынке. Она в основном продает детскую одежду. В этой области уже 20 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения ассортимента товара.
texts.en: Mavjuda K. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. She is 24 years old. She is married and has two children. Her husband works in Russia. Mavjuda does not have higher education. She sells on the market, mainly childrens clothing. She has been in this field for twenty years. She is taking out the loan to increase the variety of her merchandise.

loans.use: To increase variety

loans.name: Rowenda

texts.en:
Rowenda L. is from the town of Banga. She is married and has two children aged 16 and 13. To make a living, Rowenda plants and harvests rice for sale. She wishes to see her children finish college and find decent jobs.

Rowenda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Firangiz

texts.ru:
Firangiz B. 46 let. Ona zamujem i imeyet 2 detey doch kotoroy 18 let ona  v etom qodu postupila v universitet i sin 17 let on uchitsya v shkole. Firangiz  i yeyo semya jivut v Absheron regione. 

Firangiz uje 6 let kak rabotayet v etom biznesse prodaji produktov. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi uvelichit pomesheniye svoyeqo magazina dlya toqo chtobi pomestit bolshe produktov.
texts.en:
Firangiz B. is 46 years old. She is married and has two children.  Her daughter is eighteen years old and has started going to university this year.  Her son is seventeen years old and is in school.  Firangiz and her family live in the region of Absheron.

Firangiz has been in the business of selling groceries for six years.  At this time she needs 2000 AZN to expand the store so she can sell more groceries.

loans.use: To expand the store

loans.name: Ntonwa Bakyara Tweimukye Group, Kyenjojo

texts.en:
Devis B. belongs to Ntonwa Bakyara Tweimukye group with members who hold each other accountable for paying back loans. Devis is a self-motivated and hardworking married father of seven children. For over eight years he has been operating a motorcycle transport business, motorcycle transport being the most common and accessible means of conveyance for locals in the area. He earns 120,000 UGX on a monthly basis that helps him in undertaking family responsibilities such as educating his children and making other provisions.

As Devis envisions more means of generating income, he is looking forward to buying beans and maize for a produce business. He feels this loan will be of great importance in implementing this new business.

loans.use: To buy beans and maize for a produce business

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane B. is from the town of Banga. She is 43 years old. Jane is married and has four school-aged children. Like most of the people in her town, she earns a living through farming. She plants and harvests rice crops that she sells to the market. She says farming is very challenging. She herself has experienced failures, but Jane is a positive person and thinks that someday, she will have a stable business.

Jane joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

Jane is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Amor

texts.en:
During her twelve years as a member of ASHI, Amor has performed very well and ASHI trusts her to repay her loans.

When she became a member of the Kiva field partner, Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), she always used her loan in her farming business, hoping that someday it would grow bigger and give their family enough income for their expenses, most importantly the expenses of her children's education. Amor wants her children to continue their studies until they get a degree for their better future. That is why she never stops finding ways to get her business to grow,

Now Amor will have a loan again to use as additional capital for her farming business. She will buy things that are needed to improve the farm like fertilizers, insecticides and other supplies.

Amor is glad for the secured chance of receiving this loan and for your support and inspiration. Amor's biggest dream is to increase her rice crop production and thereby maintain a long-term sustainable farming business. Amor’s one hope and goal in life is to alleviate her family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase needed supplies for her farming business

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham has a mixed farm in Kisii town, western Kenya. He has been farming for ten years and employs two farmhands. He sells his milk and horticultural products locally. He is also employed as a teacher. 

He has requested this loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow that will produce enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The extra income from the sale of milk will help improve the livelihood of his family. 

His biggest challenges have been the lack of market for his products and also pests and diseases which affect his production and create insecurity. In the future, he would like to diversify his farming activities and venture into poultry farming.

Abraham is 41 years old. He is married with four young children. Two of the children are currently attending school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nyamabare Tweyimukye Group, Bushenyi

texts.en:
He has subsisted on a produce sales business for a time frame of more than 2 years. Emmanuel B. of Nyamabare Tweimukye group, is a fledgling agro-sales business trend setter, whose example is bound to stand out as a benchmark for other people in his home area of Nyamabare, Bushenyi. Many in his home area preoccupy themselves in self-destructive activities like drinking alcohol and smoking, rather than working hard and taking on their family responsibilities. With his hard work ethic, he has managed to take firm root and in a month he makes 200,000 Ugandan shillings.

With his monthly savings, he has managed to diversify his small business where he is involved in coffee, beans, bananas, and livestock sales, especially goats. This has, however, not come the easy way as he has had to grapple with many adversities such as small livestock. He is looking forward to purchasing more goats on the farm for fattening. With this loan, he hopes to implement the aforementioned as he looks forward to improving the household income.

loans.use: To purchase more goats for fattening on the farm.

loans.name: Chin

texts.en: Chin S. is a 44-year-old married woman who currently resides in the middle of Phnom Penh. She is a housewife, and she always works many duties in her house such as cleaning house, cooking, and take care her children also. Chin S. has a life partner in her husband (pictured), who works as a army. This couple is blessed with three children, two of whom are enrolled school, while the other one married and employed in private company as internal staff. Besides of this, Chin S. also feeds a few pigs in a cage behind her house for extra profit in order to support her family. Because the pig-raising business is a very profitable one for Chin S. and her family, Chin S. has requested a loan in order to purchase pigs to rise for sale during the period when pork is commanding the highest cost.

loans.use: To purchase pigs to rise for sale during the period when pork is commanding the highest cost.

loans.name: Sherapat

texts.ru: Кашаева Шерапат проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 55 лет. Разведена, имеет одного ребенка. Образование среднее. Занимается торговлей на рынке "Дехкон". Она в основном продает носки и нужные вещи для хозяйства. В этой области более 10 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота. Она хочет расширить свою деятельность и получить больше прибыли.
texts.en: Sherapat K. lives in the town of Turzun-zoda. She is 55 years old. She is divorced and has one child.  She has secondary education.  She sells on the Dehkon market, mainly socks and other household necessities.  She has been in this business for more than ten years.  She is asking for a loan to increase sales.  She wants to expand her business and get more profit.

loans.use: To increase sales

loans.name: Eddie

texts.en:
Eddie D. is from the town of Banga. He is 30 years old. Eddie is married and has three children, aged 4, 8 and 9. To make a living, Eddie plants and harvests rice and corn for sale. Eddie wishes to become successful and have a happy and healthy family.

Eddie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eddie has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Eddie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Thirty-three-year-old Josephine is a widowed mother of four school-aged children who all attend school. She has a mixed farm in the outskirts of Kitale town in western Kenya, where she has been farming for eight years. Her mixed farm produces vegetables, milk and eggs, which are all sold locally. She solely depends on the income from her farm to cater for the basic needs of her family.

She has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo of 31,200 Kenyan shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the extra income from the sale of milk will help improve the livelihood of her family. Her biggest challenges have been lack of enough animal feeds and diseases, which are too costly to treat. She plans to expand her farming in the future and acquire high-breed dairy cows that will increase her milk production.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie P. is from the town of Banga. She is 36 years old. Rosalie is married and has three children, aged 17, 14 and 6. Rosalie grows pigs and also farms for a living. She sells the pigs to the market. She also helps her husband plant and harvest rice crops. Aside from the piggery and farm, she also runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells eggs, coffee and other kinds of products.

Rosalie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She said she likes its program, especially the micro insurance. Rosalie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to purchase farm supplies and feeds. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies and feeds

loans.name: Noor Elahi's Group

texts.en:
Noor elahi lives in a small city of Pakistan called Depalpur. She owns a single-room house in the housing colony named Zia-ud-din and has been living there with her family for over 19 years.
  
She is a 36-year-old lady married to N. A.. She has five sons. Her eldest son is in the army while the remaining four sons are getting their education from a local school. 

Her husband is a driver by profession and drives a rickshaw on local streets. He provides transport services to his passengers and generates income for the family. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband. With the loan, her husband will repair his rickshaw because its engine is creating a problem and needs immediate repairing, otherwise it will seize. With a fully repaired rickshaw, he will be able to provide better transport services to his passengers and also work for longer hours.  

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fourth loan application. In previous loan years, she has proved herself as a very responsible client who always paid her installments on time and attended every meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who is holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Noor elahi.

loans.use: To repair a rickshaw for a driving business

loans.name: Rudy

texts.en:
Rudy M. is from the town of Banga. He is 42 years old and single. Rudy is a farmer. He tills his land to plant rice and corn crops. Rudy helps his family financially and he is happy he has the farm from which he gets an income. Rudy also raises chickens and ducks. He sells the eggs to the market.

Rudy joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rudy has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Rudy is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which he will use to purchase fertilizer and feed. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and feed

loans.name: Kavata

texts.en:
Kavata is 27 years old and married to Fidelis. She supports the family alone while her spouse goes to college. They have one child who is five years old. She has been running the beauty salon for four years now with monthly profit of approximately KES 10,000. 

She has never been in another MFI and this is her first loan from KADET. She intends to buy a stock of children clothes for her salon. She hopes to improve the living standard of her family members.

loans.use: To buy a stock of children clothes

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed belongs to Depalpur, which is a small city of Pakistan. She is a house wife and is 32 years of age. She lives with her family in a four room brick house in the housing colony named Zia-ud-din. She got married when she was only 15 years old with M. A., who is a fruit seller by profession. 
She has given birth to five sons and three daughters. All of them are enrolled in a school and are studying in different classes except for the first two children who had to leave school to start working for the family. 
Her eldest son is 16 years old and works in a private company for a monthly wage while the second son does labor work. 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy fresh seasonal fruits from the fruit wholesale markets in bulk quantity. The bulk purchasing will help him increase his sales and the fruit variety will enable him to fulfill the needs of his customers on time.  
Khursheed is hopeful that her husband will get good results from his business after making this investment. 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 5th loan application. In previous loan years, she has proven herself to be a responsible client who paid her installments on time and never missed any meetings.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruits for fruit selling business

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Mrs. Ly L., age 53, makes a living by selling fish. Mrs. Ly L. sells the fish that she buys from other fisherman at a low price. She currently earns an average of US$7 a day, and she has been running her business for over eight years. Her husband is 58 years old and he is a grocery seller around his community and other villages. Mrs. Ly L. is the mother of six teenage children; three are single, and the two remaining are married. In order to make more profit, Mrs. Ly L. raises some cow in her stall. Mrs. Ly L. is a hard-working woman who never wastes time while engaging in her business activities. As a result of the increasing needs of her business, she is applying for a loan so she can purchase more cows to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more cows to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita A. is from the town of Banga. She is 62 years old. Teresita is married and has 9 adult-aged children. To make a living, Teresita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting corn and rice for sale. Teresita still works at the farm because she wants to help improve her family's living conditions.

Teresita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase sacks of fertilizers and other inputs.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizers and other inputs

loans.name: Varsenik

texts.en: Varsenik N. lives in Sarnakunq, a village in the Syuniq region, with her husband, two children and her father in-law. The family is engaged in farming, as they consider it to be a profitable activity. The parents give lots of attention to their children’s education, and it is now the time to send the younger child to receive higher education. To do that, Varsenik needs to extend their household’s economy and so has applied to SEF to receive a loan to purchase sheep.

loans.use: To buy sheep

loans.name: Kalungi Saving And Credit, Mubende Group

texts.en: Lawano B. is a  member of the Kalungi Saving and Credit, Mubende Group. He is a determined and hard working married father of 5 children who has been plying all his energy into running a salon business from the Mpara trading centre  for over 6 years. Lawano earns 300,000 Ugandan shillings on a monthly basis as he has daily customers from the people in the same locality. He is also involved in produce buying and selling and his main intention in asking for this loan is to help him buy food stock for starting up a produce store business in the area.

loans.use: To purchase stock for a produce business

loans.name: Butunduzi Tukore Group, Kyenjojo

texts.en: Determined and hard working Vanasio T. of the Butunduzi Tukore group, Kyenjojo, age 47, is a happily married father of 6 children. (Vanasio is the man in the photo with his hand raised).  He is in the poultry farming business, where he looks after chickens for egg production and broilers for consumption. He also sells other farm produce. Vanasio has different varieties of chicken and this makes his business more attractive. With this project, he has been able to capture good market share from shop keepers and hotel owners who purchase eggs that they use to prepare for customers. This has allowed him to earn 120,000 Ugandan shillings on a monthly basis and to ably look after his family. Vanasio's main intention in asking for this loan is to help in the purchase of chicken feeds, feeding troughs and to increase his stock of chickens. This will improve his market supply, sales revenue and profit.

loans.use: To purchase of chicken feeds and feeding troughs

loans.name: Jacquelyn

texts.en:
Jacquelyn A. is from the village of Brgy. Escoting, Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 37 years old. Jacquelyn is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Jacquelyn owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Jacquelyn has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jacquelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jacquelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jacquelyn is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan that Jacquelyn has taken from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys K. is thirty six years old. She is married with three school-aged children who all attend school. She has been farming for ten years in Kisii town, western Kenya. Her mixed farm produces maize, beans, bananas and milk which are all sold locally. She mainly depends on the income from her farm to cater to the needs of her family. Her primary challenge has been lack of financing to purchase farm inputs like fertilizer and animal feed.

She has requested this loan of 45,000KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. The increased income from the sale of milk will help her improve her family's livelihood. In the future, she would like to expand her dairy farming and acquire at least five high quality dairy cows.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Maslina

texts.en:
Maslina A. is a fifty-four-year-old lady in Mamboleo estate of Kisumu City, Western Kenya. She is married to Thomas A.. The couple has six children who are over 18 years.

Maslina runs a cereal business in Mamboleo and has been doing this for the last 24 years. She makes a monthly profit of around KES 6,000. With this profits she is able to feed her family with ease.  She joined KADET LTD and has been taking loans to fund her business. She has been awarded another loan of KES 30,000 which she will use to buy Maize cereals for sale. Maize is a popular cereal in Kenya and she believes it will sell quickly and make good returns, which she will use to cater her family needs.

She plans to continue taking more loans to fund her business .

loans.use: Buy cereal to add to her stock of maize

loans.name: Wilkister

texts.en:
Wilkister Wasonga is a fifty-four-year-old modest lady from Corner Maji area of Manyatta estate, a low income estate within the city of Kisumu. She is married to Tom who is a driver and they have five children; Irine 23 years, Mercy 20 years, Ishmael 17 years, Beryl 10 years and Isaac who is five years old.

Wilkister operates a food kiosk at Corner Maji shopping center and has been doing this business for the last five years. Wilkister has been in KADET LTD for a long time as she is taking a 7th loan of KES 50,000. She is grateful that KADET LTD has brought her this far in terms of success in her business because she makes a monthly profit of KES 20,000. Wilkister will use the current loan to purchase food stock like meat, wheat flour, cooking oil and many more. She will use the profits to pay school fees for her children.

Her dream is to one day own a stable food kiosk and she also aspires to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: Buy meat, wheat flour, cooking oil to add to stock.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 57-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She used to work as a traveling saleswoman selling underwear and lingerie almost 30 years ago. Two years ago, she opened a formal store to present her products to her customers. She obtained her first Kiva loan and she was very reliable with her monthly payments. Thankful for the results of the first loan, she is requesting today to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase her store inventory to attract more clients to her shop and reinforce her business. In the future, she hopes to add clothes to her shop to expand her occupation.

loans.use: To increase her store inventory

loans.name: Ramie

texts.en:
Ramie P. is from the town of Banga. He is 60 years old. Ramie is married. To make a living, Ramie owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Ramie is working hard to improve his family's living conditions. He also wishes to have good relationships among his family members.

Ramie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ramie has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Ramie is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase 4 sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.use: to purchase 4 sacks of fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Johnstone  Mbitila

texts.en:
Johnstone is a forty four year old gentleman. He is married to Mrs Mebo and both have been blessed with four children aged 17, 15, 13 and 8 years respectively. All the children go to school. It is through the profits from the business that Mr. Johnstone has been able to educate the children.

Johnstone learned about KADET LTD through an advertisement and is one of the oldest clients of KADET LTD. He has borrowed two loans and serviced them well. With this third loan he plans to buy additional stock of the latest movie tapes and DVDs to ensure customer satisfactory and  attract more customers.

His future plan is to open a wholesale shop to supply movie tapes and DVDs to the other retailers and from the business profits, he would like to buy a plot and develop it.

loans.use: To purchase additional movie tapes and DVDs

loans.name: Magongola Zinunula Group-Mityana

texts.en: 46 year old Robina N. who belongs to Magongolo Zinunula Omunaku group in Mityana has for the past 10 years been operating a bakery business in Magongolo, an up and coming trading center.  She says it has been a worthwhile experience given the headway her business has made over the years. She has mostly been selling chapattis, pancakes and mandazi (fried bread) which are especially appealing to school kids who eat them during breaks at schools. Robina is happily married with 6 children. Before she embarked on this business she was into retailing. With this loan, Robinah wants to purchase a refrigerator.

loans.use: The purchase of a refrigerator

loans.name: Minnie

texts.en:
Minnie is 35 years old single lady and supports four children aged 16yrs, twins of 13 years and a 3 year old. She has been running a retail shop for a period of five years with a profit of about Kshs 8,900 

She has never borrowed from another MFI and this is her fourth loan with KADET LTD. She has serviced the previous loans successfully. She intends to buy stock of maize flour, sugar, toothpaste, soap and detergents for her shop. She hopes to start a supper market and also purchase land and educate her children to the highest level.

loans.use: To buy stocks of maize flour, sugar, toothpaste, soap and detergents

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a married man with five children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is transport.

He operates a business of making school badges. Daniel supply' badges to different schools. He faces a major challenge of delayed payments and transportation. Delayed payments by schools after badges have been delivered on credit and high transport cost incurred during movement from one school to another. He hopes to expand his business and start a motorcycle business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to open a butcher shop to sell goat meat and purchase materials for making school badges. He decided to join Yehu because of its good platform and gives loans to small scale entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To open a butcher shop  to sell goat meat  and purchase materials for making school badges.

loans.name: Dedan

texts.en:
Dedan is a single man who lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food. 

He has operated his internet cafe shop offering play station and internet services for over three months.  Dedan faces the major challenge of seasonality. Students are his cafe's main customers. His business high season is when schools are out for holidays and his low season occurs when students have resumed classes. Dedan hopes to operate a music studio in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase a central processing unit for a computer. Dedan decided to work with Yehu because of its close proximity to his internet cafe.

loans.use: To purchase a central processing unit for a computer.

loans.name: Estella

texts.en:
Estella manages a general store in her village. The loan she borrows from lenders helps her maintain the growth of her business. Estella hopes that someday, she can expand her general store. She is very thankful to all the lenders for all their support and she will do her best for her business to become profitable.

Estella works hard, not only for herself to have a better life, but also to help others in need. She is hoping to have a long life so that she can continue her mission in life. ASHI is her second family; she found it through staff and her co-members. She enjoys the people that she meets while selling her goods. That’s why Estella is very happy and motivated all day.
 
Her previous loan from KIVA provided working capital to expand her business and purchase more inventory for her store. Positive growth from her business has helped Estella finance her needs. Since joining ASHI, Estella has experienced positive changes in her life, using the additional income to support her nephew who has enrolled in a doctorate degree in university. Estella hopes her business will continue to flourish so she can provide long-term financial stability for her family. Therefore, she is now requesting another KIVA loan, this time for 45,000 PHP, to purchase more inventory of food for her store. This will allow her to grow her business further so that her nephew can fulfill her dreams of completing a doctorate degree and experiencing a life that’s full of contentment.

Estella’s one hope in life is to have savings in the future for her retirement because she’s now getting older. Thanks in advance to all supporters for funding this loan. Again, this is a great opportunity for making her dreams come true.

loans.use: To buy more inventory of food for her store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: The purchase of more bags of bananas and charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: The purchase of more timber for resale.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a single woman with five children, one of whom currently attends school (four have graduated). She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For over ten years, she has operated her food stall business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. Rehema faces the major challenge of seasonality and generally has fewer customers during the rainy season. She hopes to own a hotel in the future.  

She decided to join Yehu because of its simple loan procedures and minimum collateral requirements. With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase utensils and stocks of food.

loans.use: To purchase utensils and stocks of food

loans.name: Kitto Development Group-Lugazi

texts.en: M. Margret is 30 years old and married with four children. She belongs to Kitto Development Group-Lugazi. All her children are in school, courtesy of the hard work she has put into her modest ten-year-old liquor store business in Kitto. Margret began as a farmer, but owing to other factors she decided to try her hand at this business. She has never looked back since, as her business has sustained her and her family well enough. In a week, she makes 15,000 shillings, and with this loan she wants to buy more alcohol to resell at her small bar business.

loans.use: To purchase more alcohol for resale

loans.name: Li

texts.en: Li M. is 53 years old and has been selling shampoo in her house for more than nine years. She sells her products to a wholesaler and other villagers in her community. She is married to Mr. Him, 55, who is a fresh fish seller in the a local market. Her husband always travels to the market to sell his fish by hiring a taxi or walking because he doesn't have his own vehicle. To solve the problem, Li M. has requested a loan in the amount of $1000 to be used to buy a new motorcycle so they don't need to hire a taxi.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle to provide transportation for selling fish at the market.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard O. is 32 years old and is married to Josephine, who is a shopkeeper. They have four children: Yvonne, 12 years; Philemon, nine years; Steve, seven years and Mathew, four years. 

Benard has a welding business that he has been running for the past ten years. He needs materials for welding, so he is applying for a loan. He is applying for his third loan from KADET LTD and has a good credit history.

His hopes to open up a welding workshop and create employment by having people there help him manage his business.

loans.use: Buy welding materials

loans.name: Adiya

texts.en: Adiya R. is 50 years old and lives with her husband and three daughters in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. The family has been living in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in her own plot of land for the past five years. Her oldest daughter, who is 25, works as a teacher at the university while her youngest daughter attends a local secondary school. Adiya started to work as a construction decorator during the summer after working in a construction company from 1979 to 2005. The construction business is seasonal; therefore, she decided to operate a more sustainable business. She built a winter house in her yard and opened a small grocery shop in one of the rooms of her house. In the future, she hopes to continue successfully operating both her businesses. Her husband and middle daughter have been helping her to run the two businesses. She would like to expand her businesses even further in the future. Adiya is requesting a 2,200,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more products such as bread, pastries, cookies, candies and sweets, beverages and fruit for her grocery trading business.

loans.use: To purchase more products

loans.name: Kibalinga Kyosimba Onanya B, Mubende Group

texts.en:
Hardworking and cooperative N. Aisha has been running a general-merchandise retail shop from Kibalinga trading center in Mubende, where she sells basic items for home use. She has been operating this business for over 10 years. She started this business in a bid to be able to educate her children, and it currently earns her 600,000 Ugandan shillings monthly. The mother of eight children confirms that she has had problems restocking her business, as the stock available is not satisfying customers' demand.

She uses loans to help her buy more goods to resell at a profit, with the hope of earning more income, catering for her family's needs, and thus improving her standard of living. This time round, she wants to clear her children's school dues. She belongs to Kibalinga Kyosimba onanya group with other members who hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: Paying her children's school fees

loans.name: Kibalinga Kyosimba Onanya A, Mubende Group

texts.en:
It has now been over eight years since the hardworking S. Joseph of Kibalinga Kyosimba Onanya Group, Mubende, started up his transport business hiring out a motorcycle (commonly referred to as “boda boda” here in Uganda) after getting help through a loan from Pearl MFI. He currently owns a motorcycle. Having a sense of dedication to his business, which he does alongside other work, has seen him earning 150,000 Ugandan shillings monthly. This is done in Kibalinga town, Mubende, where Joseph can easily get customers on a daily basis.

This loan is to help him upgrade his business and will go toward the purchase of a motorcycle. This will enable him to earn more revenue and thus be able to cover his personal bills and live a more self-sustaining life.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To mend her broken house.

loans.name: Bogita

texts.en:
Bogita has been practicing mixed farming for fifteen years in Kisii town, western Kenya. His mixed farm produces maize, tomatoes, bananas and milk which are all sold locally. He also earns income from his butcher shop in a nearby shopping center. He says that his primary challenges in farming have been fluctuation in the market prices of his products and a poor transport network which hinders them from reaching wider markets.

Bogita is 34 years old. He is married and has been blessed with two children, ages five and seven. Both children attend school.

He has requested this loan of 35,000KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will help him improve the living standards of his family. He would like to expand both his dairy farming and his butcher shop in the future. He is grateful to Juhudi for the financial help which has assisted many poor Kenyans improve their living standards.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Amartuvshin

texts.en: Amartuvshin G. is 36 years old and lives with his wife in Hovd province of Mongolia. He and his wife live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Amartuvshin operates a clothing store in his town. He started his business in 2007 with working capital that was given to him by his parents. Over the years, he has built a stable and successful operation and his earnings have enabled him to buy a new car that is used as a taxi. Moreover, he has used his earnings to start building a new house in his yard which is not completed yet. He and his wife operate a taxi service to supplement their family income. His current working capital has decreased because of buying the new car, therefore he needs more funds in order to increase his working capital to purchase more clothes to sell. Amartuvshin is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to import more winter clothing from China to sell.

loans.use: To import more winter clothing

loans.name: Tyrus John

texts.en:
Tyrus is 25 years old and married to Emily Nasimiyu, who has a small food store where she sells potatoes, onions, tomatoes, etc. They have no children at the moment.

Tyrus has had a motorcycle business for the last four years. He has a monthly income of Kshs 6,000. He is applying for his second loan to buy another motorbike as he sees there is a lot of business in that area and transportation is a problem. 

His desire is to be able to buy a pickup for transportation purposes.

loans.use: To buy another motorcyle

loans.name: Dortsogmaa

texts.en: Dortsogmaa J. is 55 years old and lives with her husband and two adult sons in Tuv province in central Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her oldest son is disabled and the youngest son operates a taxi service. Her husband is a carpenter and produces a variety of wood products. Dortsogmaa has been working as a hairdresser since 2008, after working as a butcher from 1998 to 2008. Over this short period of operation, she has built a stable business and has used her earnings to purchase all necessary equipment and tools for her hair salon. For the future, Dortsogmaa hopes to have her own hair salon.  She works very hard and is a clever woman. She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more equipment for her barber shop.

loans.use: To purchase more equipment

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 32-year-old single mother of one child who is 14 and goes to a nearby school. She operates a beauty salon at the center of the town and she has been running the business for the last 10 years. She has employed one lady to assist her with attending to her clients, of which she has many due to the best services they get from the salon. She makes a good profit from the business and she has been able to feed and educate her child and she even plans to add more employees.

Beatrice learned about KADET LTD through a friend who is also a KADET client. She has taken a loan and serviced it well and now plans to take her second loan. With this loan, she plans to buy additional cosmetics and hair weaves to ensure continued services to her clients.

Her future plan is to expand her business and open another beauty salon in town and eventually buy a plot of land and build her own house.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and hair weaves

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela N. lives in the Kanyanya neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school. Pamela has a business of selling sweet potatoes. She has been in this business for four years and she works one day out of every week. Pamela sells her products at the market, by means of wholesale/retail.     

Pamela has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sweet potatoes. The main business challenges for Pamela include transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling on a wholesale basis only.    

Pamela lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sweet potatoes

loans.name: Erdenechimeg

texts.en: Erdenechimeg A. is 51 years old and lives with her daughter in a Mongolian nomadic dwelling called a ger in Tuv province, Mongolia. Her daughter, Ariunzaya, helps with her business but her daughter is planning to operate a coal and wood trading business individually in the future. Erdenechimeg operates a grocery trading business in her local town. She started her business in June of 2010 after working as a tailor in a sewing company. Her business helps her to support the family. She hopes to expand her business by increasing her working capital so that she can improve her family's standard of living. For the future, she plans to enlarge her small grocery shop into a big supermarket. She needs more funds in order to increase her current working capital; therefore, she is requesting a 700,000 Mongolian tugriks loan to purchase coal and firewood for her daughter's trading business.

loans.use: To purchase coal and firewood

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

For over nine years, she has operated a retail shop and coconut sale business. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. Fatuma faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the rainy season, coconut supplies are scarce at the market. She hopes to start another business selling goat meat in the future.

She decided to join Yehu because it empowers small entrepreneurs through enhanced accessibility to sustainable financial services. With the loan of Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase cooking oil, maize flour and coconut oil for resale.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil, maize flour and coconut oil for resale.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia G. is 77 and widowed but still continues to work.  She is now living with her children.

In 2007, Virginia joined ASHI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in income-generating activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASHI. She is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fishing nets to continue to expand her business.

With the chance given to her family by this KIVA partner, Virginia believes she is getting nearer to achieving her dream that her grandchildren will complete college.  She hopes that through her determination her business will be successful.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing nets to continue to expand her business.

loans.name: Yunish

texts.en: Yunish is 38 years old and married; her husband is a driver. They have 5 children who go to school.  Yunish A. is currently in the business of selling groundnut paste at the roadside and is requesting a loan to stock more groundnuts to make paste to sell.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a restaurant.

loans.use: Stock more groundnuts to make paste to sell

loans.name: Namsrai

texts.en:
Namsrai H. is 37 years old and lives with his family in a ger (Mongolian nomadic dwelling) in the Songinohairhan District of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His three children attend school while his wife operates a taxi service in the city. 

Namsrai has been driving a taxi since 1995 and has built a successful operation. This enabled him to open a car repair center in his yard in 2008. Over the years, his businesses have been successful.  He now earns 10,000 MNT from his taxi service (per day) and 500,000 MNT from his car repair center (per month). Namsrai also raises dogs and sells those dogs at reasonable prices. 

Namsrai has proven himself a reliable borrower who always pays off his loans on time. He is a modest, honest man who says, "I am planning to save money for my son's future education." He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a new car.

loans.use: To purchase a new car

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen A. is 20 years old and married; her husband is a member of the UNHCR staff. She has one child who goes to school.  Hellen is currently in the business of selling beans and maize flour at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of beans to sell.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

loans.use: Stock more bags of beans to sell

loans.name: Narantuya

texts.en: Narantuya D. is a 42-year-old single mother who lives with her three sons in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. She and her sons live in their own ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent. Her older two sons, ages 19 and 21, are students and both live and study at universities in Ulaanbaatar, a capital city of Mongolia. Her youngest son attends a local secondary school. Narantuya started her trading business in 2006 and has been operating a clothing and shoes trade business out of container in the local market in her town since then. She sells a variety of clothing items and shoes imported from Korea at a wholesale price. After some years of positive growth with her business, she could afford her two sons' tuition fees. She is focused on expanding her trading business and offering different kinds of products to her customers in order to increase her sales in the future. She is a very hardworking person who wants to raise her children to become good people with high educational backgrounds. Narantuya is requesting a 1,000,000 Mongolian tugriks loan to procure more products, such as winter boots, before demand for such products rises for the upcoming winter months.

loans.use: To procure more products

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity D. is currently in the business of selling fruits like mangoes, jack fruits, etc., at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock more jackfruit and pears to sell. 

Charity is 33 years old and married to a businessman. She has five children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up an ice cream shop.

loans.use: Stock more jackfruit and pears to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace wants a loan to buy more local alcohol and beer for reselling in her bar. She is a 31-year-old married woman with four children living in Kyenjojo,Uganda in a semi-permanent house. She brews alcohol locally and sells beer. She dreams of brewing local alcohol on a large scale and expanding her bar with better standards.

loans.use: To buy both local alcohol and beer for reselling in her bar.

loans.name: Yobesh

texts.en:
Yobesh is 33 years old. He is married with four children who are between the ages of 3 and 14. Three of the children are currently attending school. He has been farming for the last 15 years in Kisii town, western Kenya. His products are maize, milk and tea, which are all sold locally. He says that his major challenge in farming has been lack of enough finances to buy farm inputs like fertilizers and pesticides to spray farm crops and animals.

He has requested this loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that this loan will increase the income of the family through the sale of milk. He will therefore be able to pay school fees for his children with ease. He hopes to expand his farming in the future and hopes to get enough income to invest in another business.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Yostasi

texts.en: Yostasi, age 40, is a married man with five children living in a semi-permanent house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He raises cattle and also buys more for reselling at a margin. He wants his children to study for a better future. He wants a loan to buy more cattle for reselling.

loans.use: To buy more cattle to resell

loans.name: Manth

texts.en:
Manth M., 45 years old, is a housewife who lives Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She always takes care of her children and does all the housework such preparing house, cooking meals and other duties every day. The main source of family income is from the business of her husband, who is pictured here. 

Manth M.' husband is a grocery seller. For instance, his products are cooking materials, plastic products and clothes as well. He always goes to the other province in Cambodia to sell his items. This couple has five children, all of whom are single. 

Manth M.’ husband needs more capital for improving his business. That is why Manth M. will use 80 percent of her loan to purchase more inventory for her husband's business and the rest of money for daily expenses.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for her husband's business and the rest of money use for daily expenses

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice R. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and green vegetables at the market and is requesting a loan to stock fish to sell. Joice is 28 years old and is married to a husband who is a driver. She has three children--only one child goes to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for the other two children.

loans.use: Stock fish to sell

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a married woman with six children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for the family. 

She operates a retail shop selling maize flour, sugar, cooking oil and rice. Her potential customers are the villagers and passersby. Kwekwe faces a challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand and open a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour and coconuts for resale. Fatuma decided to join Yehu to get loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, maize flour and coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Ignatius

texts.en: Ignitius is 51 years old and married with three children. He runs a slaughter house to earn a living. He works with two employees in his business. He has become more focused in his business since he joined Faulu Kenya. Now, it is three years since he started the business and he hopes to expand. In five years, he wants to open more slaughter houses. He has requested for a loan of 20,000 Kes to buy cows.

loans.use: To buy cows.

loans.name: Musum

texts.en: Musum K. is currently in the business of selling beans at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of beans to sell.  Musum is 29 years old and single. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a shop.

loans.use: To stock more bags of beans to sell

loans.name: Hendriah

texts.en:
Hendriah has been farming for the last five years in Kitale town, western Kenya. Her farm produces vegetables and maize, which she sells to the local market. Her biggest challenge in farming has been lack of storage facilities for her milk. Hendriah is 23 years old. She is married with one child, age 2.

She has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 31,200 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that this loan will help her purchase a quality dairy cow that will increase her milk production and enable her to provide enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. In five year's time, she plans to acquire at least three dairy cows and be the main milk supplier to the local market. She comments that dairy farming has got challenges but with commitment, one overcomes them and enjoys the profits.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is 32 years old. He is married and blessed with a three-year-old child.  For five years, he has been operating Shalom kiosk.  He sells foodstuff and other household goods in his shop.  He is able to employ two people in his business and he hopes to employ more people in the future.  In five years, he wants to open two more branches of his business.  He has requested 20,000 KES to buy rice and soda.

loans.use: To buy rice and soda

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi is a married woman with two children who are now adults. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

She has operated a charcoal selling business for four years. She sells in a shop and at retail to local residents. She faces a major challenge of transportation. Sidi incurs high costs for transporting charcoal from rural areas where trees are burnt for charcoal to urban areas for resale. She hopes to sell charcoal at wholesale in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase 30 bags of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase 30 bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To paint and re-tile a barber shop

loans.name: Yeu

texts.en: Mrs. Yeu M. is 44-year-old married mother who currently lives in Phnom Penh Capital, in Cambodia Country. She is a local chef. Mrs. Yeu M. is always hired by neighbors to cook meals for their wedding parties and their other ceremonies, while her husband is motor taxi driver around her community in Phnom Penh. The family includes two devoted children, one of whom is single and the other one is married. Mrs. Yen M.’s husband wants to buy a trailer for picking up more customers, but he complains that he doesn't have enough money to make it possible. To solve this problem, Mrs. Yeu M. will use her loan to purchase a trailer to connect with an existing motorbike for her husband's business. Mrs. Yeu M. was not available for the photograph, so her husband is in the photo instead at their house.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer to connect with an existing motorbike for her husband business.

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn C. is from the town of Banga. She is 38 years old. Genelyn is married and has a 12-year-old child. To make a living, Genelyn owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. She also plants vegetables like string beans. Genelyn wants to be a successful businesswoman. She also wants to have a healthy and happy family.

Genelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Genelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Genelyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase farm fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition feed for her child.

loans.use: To purchase farm fertilizer

loans.name: Mengsiluv

texts.ru: Рахмонова Менгсилув проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 41 год. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Муж, работает в ТАЛКО. Сама Менгсилув имеет среднее образование. Занимается торговлей на рынке. Она продает овощи и приправы. В этой области более 10 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Mengsiluv  R. lives in Tursun-zoda. 41 years of age. Married, with five children. Her husband works for the Tajik Aluminium Company. Mengsiluv has received secondary education. She is a market vendor, selling vegetables and spices. She has been in this line for work for over 10 years. She is taking out a loan in order to increase her sales volume.

loans.use: Increasing sales volume

loans.name: Morris

texts.en: Morris is a businessman who sells second-hand shoes.  He has 12 years of experience in the business.  His business is located in Gikomba open-air market, which is well-known in Nairobi City.  He gives credit to Faulu Kenya because he has learned how to manage his business well.  He hopes to succeed in his business so as to employ more people in the future.  He has requested  20,000 KES to buy second-hand shoes.

loans.use: To buy second-hand shoes

loans.name: Farida

texts.en: Farida N. lives in the Kalerwe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has three children, one of whom is in school.    Farida has a business selling sugar cane. She has been in this business for six years and she works 7 days out of every week. Farida sells her products in a market at retail. Farida has requested a loan of 500,000/- Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bundles of sugar cane. The main business challenge(s) for Farida include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration for her business are to start growing sugar cane herself. Farida lives in a home that she rents without electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent and food

loans.use: To buy more bundles of sugar canes

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene L. is from the town of Banga. She is 30 years old. Irene is married and has a four-month-old child. To make a living, Irene owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. Irene is doing her best to improve her income because she wants to save for her family's future.

Irene joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Irene has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Irene is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en:
Nathan has been practicing mixed farming for 20 years in Kisii town, western Kenya. His farm produces bananas, sugarcane, maize and vegetables, which he sells to the local market. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to provide for the basic needs of his family. His biggest challenge has been disease and insecurity in the area. 

Nathan is 60 years old. He is married with six children who are all adults. Four of the children are currently attending school.

He has requested this loan of 30,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that the extra income from this loan will help pay school fees for his children and establish a business for his family. He hopes to acquire more dairy cows in the future. He is requesting Juhudi to increase its loan sizes.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mwadiga

texts.en:
Mwadiga is a married man with seven children, three of whom attend school while four have already graduated. He owns a house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

He operates a retail shop selling sugar, wheat flour, cooking oil and maize flour. His potential customers are the local residents. Mwadiga faces a challenge of transportation. He incurs a high cost while transporting goods from the market to the shop for resale. He hopes to open a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, he wants to purchase more stock of wheat flour and maize flour for resale. Mwadiga decided to join Yehu to gain knowledge of business operations and to get loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour and maize flour for his retail shop.

loans.name: Jovel

texts.en:
Jovel P. is from the town of Banga. He is 41 years old. Jovel is married. To make a living, Jovel owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. He also plants vegetables like squash. Jovel wants to be a good husband and father. He says he wants to provide for all his family's needs and make them happy.

Jovel joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovel has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Jovel is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a young man from Jenin.  He is a Palestinian National Authority employee.  Ahmad is a very good employee, known for his discipline and honesty.

Ahmad is ready to have his own house and now he wants to purchase home appliances as he is preparing for marriage.  He took a $2,000 loan from FATEN to purchase the needed items.  

Ahmad appears in the picture here in FATEN's office.

loans.use: To purchase home appliances

loans.name: Jihan

texts.en: Jihan is a 34-year-old married woman who has been working as a makeup artist since 2009. She has 15 years of experience. Jihan owns a beauty salon and is a hard worker. She helps her husband with many things because she believes that marriage is based on sharing and commitment. Jihan is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to improve her business, pay what’s left from her car’s price and keep extra cash with her for hospital expenses, since she’s going to give birth to a beautiful baby soon. Jihan is very optimistic and supportive. She hopes to expand her business to a famous beauty institute soon. Her clients like her work a lot. Most of them are relatives, friends, neighbors and friends of friends.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander B. sells various home products at the central market in Melitopol city. He has been in business for 11 years. His income is about 4,000 Grivnas a month. 

He enjoys selling small things that help make home chores easier. Alexander is a very happy and enthusiastic person. With his income, he helps his sisters and their parents with whom he lives in one big house. He is not married.

Alexander would like to get a loan of 12,000 Grivnas to increase the assortment of his inventories. He always tries to have a large assortment of small home products to offer something to each client that comes his way.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of products he sells

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa P. is from the town of Banga. She is 31 years old. Melissa is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Melissa owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. Melissa wants her children to finish college so she works hard to sustain their education.

Melissa joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melissa has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Melissa is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Muhidin

texts.en:
Muhidin is a responsible father of 5 children. From the time he was young, he learned the honorable work of raising livestock. These activities were passed down from his parents and today bring him satisfaction. Thanks to his valuable knowledge of the livestock trade, he has been able to obtain good results from his sales. This enterprising gentleman’s wish is to invest more capital in young animals. Muhidin hopes to continue his dedication to his work, believing that by improving his stock and feed, his cattle will bring better prices. For this reason, he is turning to you for the support that would permit him to continue developing his business.  
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Pablito

texts.en:
Pablito C. is from the town of Banga. He is 41 years old. Pablito is married and has two children aged 15 and 14. To make a living, Pablito owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Like other businessmen, Pablito wants to be successful. 

Pablito joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He said he especially likes the micro insurance program because it makes him feel secure. Pablito is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Twisuganerubyiruko Group

texts.fr: Samuel, il est  membres du groupe appelé TWISUGANERUBYIRUKO de ruhuha dont les membres sont tous agriculteurs de riz, il est marié et a 28 ans. Son niveau d’étude est primaire. Il a 3 enfants, le premier a 5 ans et le cadet a 3 ans.  Il  habite avec sa famille en district de Bugesera précisément à ruhuha, en province de l’est. Il est agriculteur de riz,  il a contracté un prêt au sein d’Amasezerano pour augmenter l’argent de ses épargnes pour acheter les félitilisants de leurs champs. C’est son deuxième prêt, ses  épargnes lui ont permis de pouvoir se marier et de faire vivre sa famille. Dans l’avenir, il veut continuer à acheter et/ou construire une maison d’habitation pour la sécurité de sa famille.
texts.en:
Samuel is a member of the group called Twisuganerubyiruko of Ruhuha in which the members are all rice farmers.  He is married, 28 years old, and has a primary school education.  He has three children.  The first child is 5 years old, and the youngest is 3.  Samuel lives with his family in the Bugesera district, in Ruhuha to be exact (East Province).  He is a rice farmer.

Samuel has signed a loan with the micro-finance institution Amasezerano to increase his savings for buying fertilizers for their fields.  This loan is his second one.  

His savings have enabled him to get married and to support his family.  In the future, he wants to continue with buying and/or building a house for the safety of his family.

loans.use: Buying fertilizers

loans.name: Radjabali

texts.en:
T. Radjabali is 55 years old and lives with his wife and three children. He owns a mini-bus, which generates the income necessary to support his family. Radjabali needs this loan to replace the fuel supply system with one using gas as a fuel change, as this is cheaper than petrol. And also with part of the loan, he will purchase spare parts to keep the vehicle in good working condition, as this is how he makes his living. This will allow him to perform his work better so he can save more money in order to provide for his family.  
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase a kapron gas-cylinder for the fuel supply system.

loans.name: Mateus Zanqueu

texts.pt:
Mateus Zanqueu M. nasceu na Província Inhambane, sul de Moçambique, pai de 5 filhos de 6 aos 16 anos de idade todos vão a Escola. Fez 7ª classe interrompeu devido a guerra que assolou o pais. Vive na casa do serviço e não responsabiliza se por ninguém. 
 
Saiu de Inhambane para Namaacha a procura de emprego, apois sua chegada consegue arranjar um emprego no Hotel Libombos como Guarda, trabalha ha mais de 13 anos auferindo 2.000.00mt por mês. Também tem um negocio próprio de venda de produtos de primeira necessidade, dedicando se a esta actividade no período diurno. Tem como melhor produto refrigerantes, bebidas, bolos, arroz e peixe e hoje é proprietário de três bancas das quais uma citada em casa, outra na shoprite e na fronteira, conta com 2 trabalhadores e ajuda da sua esposa onde consegue uma receita de 5.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas da casa e ainda poupa algum em sua casa.

Este é o segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (bolos, refrigerantes, arroz, peixe e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. O anterior no valor de 8.000.00mt foi usado para a mesma finalidade.

 Esta confiante que vai pagar cem nenhum problema e solicitar um outro empréstimo para iniciar com a construção da sua obra.
texts.en:
Mateus Zanqueu M. was born in Inhambane Province in southern Mozambique.  He is the father of five children aged 6 to 16 years old.  All the children go to school.  Mateus finished seventh grade; his studies were interrupted by the war that devastated the country.  He lives in company housing and has no other dependents.
 
He left Inhambane to look for work in Namaacha.  After his arrival, he got a job as a security guard at Hotel Libombos.  He has worked there for more than 13 years, earning 2,000 meticais per month.  He also has his own business selling staple items during the daytime.  His best-selling products are soft drinks, other beverages, cakes, rice and fish.  He is now the owner of three stands, one in his home, one at Shoprite and one on the border.  He has two employees and his wife's help, and he earns 5,000 meticais monthly.  He uses the money for household expenses and even saves some in his house.

This is his second loan from Hluvuku.  He is asking for 15,000 meticais, which he will use to buy products (cakes, soft drinks, rice, fish and other items) to increase his inventory.  The previous loan of 8,000 meticais was used for the same purpose.

He is confident that he will repay the loan with no problems and will ask for another to begin a construction project.

loans.use: Purchase products (cakes, soft drinks, rice, fish, etc.)

loans.name: Sherali

texts.en:
Married and the father of four children, Sherali was born on May 6, 1974. Coming from an area where cattle raising is popular, Sherali has been selling cattle since 2002.
