He buys them in his village from the farmers who raise them and then sells them at the markets. As his business capital is limited, he buys just a few and then after he sells those, he returns to buy more. Today Sherali would like to expand his business by increasing his capital, so that he can then maximize his profits. For this reason, he is requesting this first loan to purchase young cattle and fodder for them. This will be his first loan with IMON International, and his evaluation shows he is qualified to receive the loan.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle in order to expand his business

loans.name: Good Sisters Group

texts.en:
Oniekeh F., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Good Sisters. She is 44 years old, married, and has five children who are between the ages of 25 to 14. She was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to a lack of financial support. She describes herself as a kind and hardworking woman. She cares for two siblings.

For 10 years, she has been selling palm oil and charcoal in Congo Town Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 10,000 LRD portion of this 39,000 LRD group loan to buy more gallons of oil and more bags of charcoal. Her goal is to improve her business to an international standard.

loans.use: To buy more gallons of oil and more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Joven

texts.en:
Joven E. is from the town of Banga. He is 33 years old. Joven is married and has an 8-year-old child. To make a living, Joven owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Joven hopes to improve his yield so he can earn more.

Joven joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He said he likes the policy and the micro insurance program. Joven is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase sacks of seeds and fertilizer. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Daler

texts.en:
Daler owns a small clothing sales business in Dushanbe, in the capital of Tajikistan. He has space at a market area near the center of city where he sells a variety of men’s and women’s clothing. Daler has been in business for about eight years. He has benefited from having a great location with no other serious competitors close by. Daler is married and has two children for whom he is helping to pay school expenses. Daler has requested a loan to purchase a supply of clothing to sell in his business. 

                                                                                    
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new clothing in order to increase the range of goods to sell

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites A. is from the town of Banga. She is 32 years old. Marites is married and has two children aged 10 and 3. To make a living, Marites owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Marites has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Early this year, Marites joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Marites is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Marites from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Svitlana

texts.en:
Svitlana is married with a three-year-old daughter. She owns a small business selling food and cleaning items in bulk. Svitlana has been in this business for eight years. She rents a small store located close to a busy open market. This gives her business a big advantage.

Svitlana would like to develop her business further. She would like to borrow 15,000 Grivnas to increase the assortment of her inventories. She hopes to receive additional income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventories

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo N. is from the town of Banga. He is 48 years old. Eduardo is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Eduardo owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Eduardo works hard to sustain his children's education. He wishes them to finish college someday and be working professionals.

Eduardo joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eduardo is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase sacks of seeds and fertilizers. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for his children's tuition fees.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Salomao Jose

texts.pt:
Salomão José Alfredo D. nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, Província de Maputo sul de Moçambique, é pai de três filhos de 13 aos 21 anos de idade, todos vão a Escola. Vive na casa própria e responsabiliza se pela sua sobrinha que vive com ele em sua casa.

Saiu de Namaacha após concluir o ensino médio (12ªclasse) e faz um curso de professorado durante 3 anos (tempo regular) após concluir é afeto primeiramente em Maputo onde trabalhou durante 9 anos. Devido a doença da sua mãe, ele pede uma transferência para o Distrito de Namaacha para dar assistência a sua mãe. E funcionário permanente a mais de 27 anos auferindo mensalmente um valor de 4.300.00m que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).

Ja teve empréstimos (25.000.00mt e 50.000.00mt) no BIM (Banco Internacional de Moçambique) para dar início da sua obra e pagou sem nenhum problema. Mas não conseguiu concluir devido ao elevado custo de material, assim aproxima se a Hluvuku solicitando o segundo empréstimo no valor de 17.000.00mt para comprar material de construção (cimento, pedra, tintas e outros) para dar continuidade da obra. O empréstimo anterior foi no valor de 12.000.00mt para a mesma finalidade.
Esta confiante que vai reembolsar sem nenhum problema e pedir um novo empréstimo para fazer um estaleiro aumentando a sua renda familiar pôs a sua esposa não trabalha.
texts.en:
Salomão José Alfredo D. was born in Namaacha District, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique.  He has three children, ages 13 to 21, and all of them go to school.  He lives in his own house and takes care of his niece, who also lives in his house.

Salomão left Namaacha after finishing high school and took a three-year (full-time) teaching course.  After finishing this, he was employed mainly in Maputo, where he worked for nine years.  Because his mother became ill, he asked for a transfer to Namaacha District to help her.  He has been a permanent employee for more than 27 years, earning 4,300 meticais monthly.  He uses this money for household expenses and also saves some in his bank account (at BIM).

Salomão had loans (25,000 meticais and 50,000 meticais) at BIM (International Bank of Mozambique) to begin building his house, and he paid them back with no problems.  But he was not able to finish the work because of rising costs for materials, so he approached Hluvuku asking for a second loan of 17,000 meticais to buy construction materials (cement, stone, paints, etc.) to continue the work.  His first Hluvuku loan was for 12,000 meticais, and was used for the same purpose.

He is confident that he will pay the loan off with no problems, and he will ask for another loan to build a kiosk to increase his family's income since his wife does not work.

loans.use: Construction materials (cement, stone, paints, etc.)

loans.name: Tony

texts.en:
Tony F. is from the town of Banga. He is 41 years old. Tony is married and has two children aged 17 and 14. To make a living, Tony owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. One of Tony's wishes is to have a God-fearing family. 

Tony joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tony is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase four sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for his kids' tuition fees.

loans.use: To purchase four sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes.

loans.name: Maria Bate

texts.pt:
Maria Bate M., nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, mãe de 6 filhos de 2 aos 26 anos de idade, três destes vão a Escola. Fez 2ªclasse não concluiu porque seu pai obrigava lhes a passar a maior parte do tempo trabalhando na machamba. Vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém para além da sua família.
Maria vivia numa localidade do mesmo Distrito (Mandevo) que dista 10km da vila sede, devido a guerra teve que mudar se para a vila Sede onde vive ate então. Após sua chegada começa a fazer negócio de pequena escala vendendo pastéis nas esquinas da escola, mas com ajuda do seu marido consegue arranjar uma banca no Mercado Central onde vende produtos de primeira necessidade tais como (tomate, cebola, cenoura e arroz) tem gastado uma média de 5.000.00mt nas compras e tendo de lucro 3.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas da sua casa e da obra. Para além vender faz refeições no Mercado (sopa) diariamente consegue ter 350mt.

Este é o segundo empréstimo de Maria na Hluvuku e primeiro com Kiva no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (tomate, cebola, cenoura, arroz e outros) para aumentar a quantidade de seus produtos. O anterior crédito de 5.000.00mt foi usado para a mesma finalidade. 
Pagou com muito sucesso e esta confiante que fará o mesmo neste segundo para aceder a mais empréstimos pois gostaria tanto de ajudar sua filha.
texts.en:
Maria Bate M. was born in Namaacha District, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique.  She has six children between the ages of 2 and 26.  Three of them go to school.  Maria finished second grade but did not continue with school because her father made his children spend most of their time working on the machamba (small family farm).  She lives in her own house and does not support anyone other than her family.

Maria lived in a part of the District (Mandevo) about 10 kilometers from the town of Sede.  Because of the war, she had to move to Sede, where she has lived ever since.  After her arrival, she began a small business selling pies at the corners of the school, but with her husband's help she acquired a stall at the Central Market where she sells staple goods such as tomatoes, onions, carrots and rice.  She spends on average 5,000 meticais on her purchases and makes a profit of 3,000 meticais, which she uses for household needs and construction expenses.  She also makes meals (soups) to sell daily at the Market and earns 350 meticais.

This is Maria's second loan with Hluvuku and her first with Kiva.  She is asking for 15,000 meticais, which she will use to buy products (tomatoes, onions, carrots, rice, etc.) to increase her inventory.  The previous loan of 5,000 meticais was used for the same purpose.

She paid off the loan easily and is confident that she will do the same with this second loan.  She hopes to have more loans because she would like to help her daughter.

loans.use: Purchase products (tomatoes, onions, carrots, rice, etc.)

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya where she has been farming for five years. Her main products are eggs and milk, which she sells to the local market. She also earns income from her motorbike transport business. She is 22 years old and married with three children. 

Christine has requested this loan of 26,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that this dairy cow will increase her milk production and she will be able to provide her family with enough milk for consumption and sale, creating more income. Her biggest challenge has been the high cost of artificial insemination services. In five years' time, she would like to acquire two more dairy cows and a chuff cutter.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina S. lives in the Kawempe- Bubajjwe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school. Regina has a retail shop.  She has been in this business for over 10 years and she works 7 days out of every week.  Regina sells her products in a shop at retail. Regina has requested  for a loan of 1,100,000/- Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy a new pay phone and more bags of sugar,cartons of salt, boxes of soap and jerycans of cooking oil. She also generates additional income  from selling milk. 

The main business challenge(s) for Regina include rainy season and transportation of merchandise from kikuubo in Kampala city to her shop in Kawempe- bubajwe  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler.  Regina lives in a home that she owns with access to electricity but no piped water.  Her major monthly expense includes school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and jerycans of cooking oil

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more sets of breakable bowls (dishes).

loans.name: Isabel Amos

texts.pt:
Isabel Amos M. nasceu na Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique, solteira mãe de 5 filhos de 12 aos 26 anos, três dos filhos é que vão a escola. Não teve oportunidade de estudar pois o seu pai dava mais prioridade aos rapazes, alegando que as raparigas tinham que ir trabalhar na machamba. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta sua mãe enviando dinheiro para bens alimentares.


Isabel sai de Gaza para o Distrito de Namaacha quando seu pai foi transferido para trabalhar na empresa águas da Namaacha. Após sua chegada Então Isabel começa a fazer (mukero) venda de produtos contra bandeada, mas a atividade era de muito risco então implementa uma nova atividade de venda de sacos de amendoim e feijão adquiridas na Suazilândia e revendidas na cidade Capital até então. Por mês tem feito 3 viagens adquirindo 20 sacos em cada viajem sendo 10 de feijão a 1.620.00mt cada, e 10 de amendoim a 1.800.00mt cada e revende a 1.950.00mt e a 2.250.00mt respectivamente. Tem tido um lucro de cerca de 10.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.  

Este é o quarto empréstimo de Isabel na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (feijão, amendoim e outros) para aumentar o volume do seu negócio. Os anteriores créditos foram de (5.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt e 15.000.00mt) todos para a mesma finalidade.

Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do prazo e pedir um novo empréstimo para comprar uma viatura que lhe facilitara na venda dos seus produtos na Capital.
texts.en:
Isabel Amos M. was born in Gaza Province in southern Mozambique.  She is a single mother of five children between the ages of 12 and 26.  Three of the children go to school.  Isabel did not have the opportunity to study because her father gave priority to his sons, saying the daughters had to work on the machamba (small family farm).  She lives in her own house with her family and supports her mother by sending her money for food.

Isabel left Gaza to move to Namaacha District when her father was transferred to work at the Namaacha Water company.  After her arrival, Isabel began selling contraband products (mukero), but the work was very risky, so she began a new business selling sacks of peanuts and beans. She buys them in Swaziland and resells them in the capital city.  She makes three trips per month, buying 20 sacks on each trip, 10 of beans at 1,620 meticais each and 10 of peanuts at 1,800 meticais each.  She then resells them at 1,950 meticais and 2,250 meticais respectively.  She makes a profit of about 10,000 meticais per month, which she uses for household expenses.  She also saves some in her bank account.

This is Isabel's fourth loan with Hluvuku.  She is asking for 20,000 meticais to buy products (beans, peanuts and other items) to increase the volume of her business.  The previous loans were for 5,000 meticais, 10,000 meticais and 15,000 meticais, all for the same purpose.

She is confident that she will pay off the loan ahead of schedule, and she will ask for another loan to buy a vehicle that would make it easier for her to sell her products in the capital.

loans.use: Purchase products (beans, peanuts, etc.)

loans.name: Abu

texts.en: This is 43-year-old Abu.  He is married, and has four children ages 6, 7, 10 and 12 years. In 1996, Abu established his drinks, shoes, water etc. business. He began his business after receiving the initial capital from his elder sister. Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, he earns about 800,000 SLL every month from this business. He needs a loan of 4,000,000 SLL.  Abu requires a loan in order to buy more goods like used shoes, 5 bags @ 650,000 SLL, Grafton water 15 dozen @ 22,000 SLL, and rubber drinks 30 dozen at 14,000 SLL. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 500,000 SLL. In the future, Abu plans to establish a savings account for old age, buy a car, plow more of his profits into the business, and educate his children to university level. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy used shoes, Grafton water, and drinks to sell

loans.name: Muzafar

texts.en: Muzafar G. is 58 years old. He is married and has four children. Muzafar was born into a simple, rural family and has worked with livestock for many years. He is very experienced and has the special skills in livestock care that help him to develop his business. He raises and sells livestock and sells meat and milk. Muzafar is requesting a loan of 5,000 Somoni to enable him to purchase a second dairy cow. The second cow will enable him to increase the milk produced and will provide income security to the family when one of the cows is with calf. The income will enable Muzafar to provide for his family, take good care of his cows and supply his neighbors with quality milk. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle for expanding the business

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a clothes-selling business for over four years. She sells from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. Fatuma faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation as she has to move from one place to another selling clothes. She hopes to open a boutique in the future. 

She decided to join Yehu to get loans to boost her business. With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase clothes and ornaments for resale.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and ornaments for resale

loans.name: Evandre Celio

texts.pt:
Evandre Célio Joaquim M. nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, pai de uma menina de 7 anos que vai a Escola. Vive na casa cedida pelo Estado e responsabiliza se pelos seus três irmãos mais novos e sua mãe que vivem com ele.

Apois a sua formação em Manhiça, volta a Namaacha como Professor onde é afeto na Escola Maria Auxiliadora, no departamento cultural da Administração Distrital de Namaacha onde tem um salário base de 4,700mt por mês. Possui também um negocio próprio de venda de refeições e produtos de primeira necessidade onde consegue um rendimento de cerca de 3.000.00mt juntamente com o salario consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancaria. 

Este é o quarto empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 9.000.00mt com qual pretende comprar produtos (bolachas, refrescos, sumos e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria no seu estabelecimento comercial. Os anteriores créditos de (10.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt e 6.000.00mt) foram usados para compra de material de construção. 

No futuro gostaria de conseguir construir um estúdio adjacente a sua casa para poder tocar com os amigos e ate gravar suas próprias músicas. Esta confiante que vai reembolsar cem nenhum problema.
texts.en:
Evandre Célio Joaquim M. was born in Namaacha District, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique.  He has a seven-year-old daughter who goes to school.  He lives in a house provided by the State and supports his three youngest siblings and his mother, who all live with him.

After completing his training in Manhiça, Evandre returned to Namaacha as a teacher, where he is employed at Maria Auxiliadora School and in the cultural department of Namaacha's District Administration.  He has a base salary of 4,700 meticais per month.  He also has his own business selling meals and staple goods, and he earns about 3,000 meticais together with his salary.  He saves some of this money in his bank account.

This is his fourth loan with Hluvuku.  He is asking for 9,000 meticais to buy products (crackers, soft drinks, juices and other items) to increase the inventory in his shop.  The previous loans of 10,000 meticais, 10,000 meticais and 6,000 meticais were used to buy construction materials.

In the future, Evandre would like to build a studio next to his house so he could play music with his friends and even record his own songs.  He is confident that he will pay back the loan with no problems.

loans.use: Purchase products (crackers, soft drinks, juices, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of biscuits, sardines, milk, butter, sugar, soap, etc.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet N. lives in the Nakulabye neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of whom are in school. The other one is four months old. She also takes care of additional family members. Harriet has a business of selling local gin. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week. Harriet sells her products from home, by means of both wholesale and retail. Harriet has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more jerrycans of waragi, the local gin. The main business challenge for Rose is transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to expand her business. Harriet lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of local gin

loans.name: Vegelyn

texts.en:
Vegelyn B. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 40 years old. Vegelyn is married and has three school-aged children. She and her husband are both farmers. They plant rice and corn crops and sell their harvest to the market. Vegelyn is also a Natasha (clothing and accessories) dealer. She says she started selling to her friends first but also got the chance to sell to other people in her community. She spends most of her time at the farm, though, because it is their main source of income. 

Vegelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vegelyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to purchase rice and corn seeds, fertilizers and other inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase rice and corn seeds, fertilizers and other inputs

loans.name: Robert Kisembo

texts.en:
Robert Kisembo I. is 27 years old. He is married and a father of three children between two years and five years old. He is a businessman who  sells jeans trousers on a busy street in Narok town. He has been running this business for the last five years.

He learned about KADET from other friends who are already registered as clients. This will be his first loan. He is planning to increase his stock by buying more jeans. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to rent a permanent shop where he can sell his clothes. He plans to open another shop and create employment for other people. His dream is that he will be able to build his own house and run the shop at  his own premises.
 
Robert believes he is hard working and he only needs the resources to attain his goals.

loans.use: To increase his stock by buying more jeans.

loans.name: Marifat

texts.en:
Marifat is a divorced mother of two children. For the last four years, she has had a bread bakery business. Marifat has a reputation as a goal oriented, hard-working, but pleasant merchant. Her desire is to see her children succeed and her business is one way that she is able to accomplish that goal. Marifat enjoys her work and is known to respond to economic opportunity. She has established a good credit history by diligently repaying five loans from “IMON International”. Marifat is requesting a loan for $1,500 USD, which will allow her to re-stock her inventory. She is planning to increase the assortment of bread she offers and continue to sell for affordable prices, which will attract customers and increase her sales profits.

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase flour at wholesale to bake the national bread “lepeshka”.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional inventory (e.g., rice, onions, pepper, salt, seasonings, oil, and beans)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase bundles of used clothing

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma B. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 43 years old. Gemma is married and has an 18-year-old child. To make a living, Gemma owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. Gemma wants to improve her family's living conditions.

Gemma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer and seeds. She hopes that someday she will have her own money for business capital.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Jeremiah Matanda Ole

texts.en:
Jeremiah Matanda Ole N. is 32 years old.  His spouse is Tabitha Kamau and they have three children aged 9 years, 6 years and 3 years old.  Jeremiah operates a taxi business in Narok town and he has been in this business for five years. 

He learned about Kadet from a market awareness program done by Kadet staffs within Narok town. This will be his first loan, which he is planning to spend on buying some spare parts and servicing of his car. He is also planning to start up poultry farming. With the anticipated profit from the business, he plans to buy more broilers as the demand for them is high in this area.

Jeremiah's dream is that he will own a fleet of cars and be a large-scale poultry farmer. He is a hard working man with a great vision.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and service the car.

loans.name: Choice

texts.en:
Choice is a farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya where she has been farming for 20 years. Her farm produces maize and nappier grass, which she sells to the local market and tree seedlings which she sells through brokers. Choice is 42 years old. She is married with six children who are between the ages of 2 and 20. Four of the children are currently attending school.

She has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 20,000 KES to start a cereals business. The extra income from this loan will help her pay school fees for her children and improve the living standards of her family. Her major challenge has been lack of enough capital to expand her tree seedling business. She hopes that in future, she will be able to increase the acreage of her maize and nappier plantation and expand her cereals business.

loans.use: To start a cereals business.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma V. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 60 years old. Elma is married and has seven children. To make a living, Elma owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. Elma still works at the farm to help provide for her family. She also wants to help send her grandchildren to school. 

Elma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase rice and corn seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase rice and corn seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine K. lives in the Lubaga neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has five children, four of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her sister’s children). Justine has a retail shop.  She has been in this business for six years, and she works 7 days every week. Justine sells her products in a shop at retail. Justine has requested a loan of 500,000/-Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and bans of bread. She also generates additional income through her nursery school and selling passion juice. The main business challenges for Justine include seasonality and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler. Justine lives in a home that she owns with access to electricity but not piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise like sugar, salt, soap, and bread

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en: This is 25-year-old Salamatu. She is married and has a child who is 8 years old.  In 2004, Salamatu established her textiles business.  This consists of cotton and gara fabric as well as lace materials.  She began her business in order to help her father generate income for their family.  Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, she earns about Le 600,000 every month from this business.  Salamatu would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 to purchase more goods in bulk.  She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 1,400,000. In the future, Salamatu plans to grow her business by increasing her stock.  Eventually, she hopes to buy more modern goods by trading internationally.  In the long run, she hopes to both build a house and educate her children to a higher level.  She thanks you for your support

loans.use: To buy more bales of clothing for her business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 35 years old, married and blessed with two children aged 8 and 6.  She is a businesswoman who sells milk.  She has been able to learn about business management through Faulu Kenya.  This is why she has managed to run her business for three years.  She hopes to supply milk at wholesale in the future.  She has been guaranteed a loan of 20,000 KES by her group members in Faulu Kenya.  With the loan, she will open a milk bar.

loans.use: To open a milk bar

loans.name: Augusto Salvador

texts.pt:
Augusto Salvador S. nasceu no Distrito de Chibuto, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique, pai de 2 filhos de 12 e 14 anos de idade, todos vão a Escola. Fez 6ªclasse não concluiu devido a guerra de desestabilização. Vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém para além da sua família.

Saiu de Chibuto para Maputo com a sua esposa refugiando se da guerra. Atualmente trabalha como auxiliar de segurança da empresa SOEIRO COMERCIAL ha mais de 5 anos e tem um salario de 3.250.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa muito pouco devido as despesas que tem excedido suas necessidades.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de conversas com outros clientes da Instituição. Este é o segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.300.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (ferro, pedra, cimento, barrotes e outros) para continuar com a construção da sua casa. O empréstimo anterior foi de 8.500.00mt aplicado no comércio. 

Esta confiante que vai pagar sem dificuldades para aceder a mais empréstimos para poder terminar a sua casa.
texts.en:
Augusto Salvador S. was born in Chibuto District, Gaza Province in southern Mozambique.  He has two children, ages 12 and 14.  Both children go to school.  Augusto went through sixth grade but did not finish school because of the civil war.  He lives in his own house and supports no one outside of his family.

He left Chibuto to move to Maputo with his wife while seeking refuge from the war.  He currently works as a security assistant at the Soeiro Business company and has been there more than five years.  He has a salary of 3,250 meticais, which he uses for household expenses.  He saves very little because he has had extra expenses.

Augusto never had loans from other banks.  He learned about Hluvuku through conversations with other customers of the Institution.  This is his second loan with Hluvuku.  He is asking for 10,300 meticais to buy construction materials (iron, stone, cement, beams and other items) so he can continue construction on his house.  The previous loan was for 8,500 meticais and was used for business.

Augusto is confident that he will pay off the loan with no difficulties so he can take out more loans to finish his house.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials (iron, stone, cement, beams, etc.)

loans.name: Moses Mbila

texts.en:
Moses Mbila, 34 years old, is married to Mercy Mumo and together they have one daughter who is seven years old. He lives at Tala and his hotel business is in Gikomba Estate in Nairobi, which is surrounded by slums. He has been running this hotel business selling snacks, tea, and meals for 6 years and his monthly profit is Kshs 10,000. His wife Mercy Mumo is aged 30 years and she is a businesswoman. 

Moses was introduced to KADET LTD by the loan officer in charge of the Tala office. After getting this loan, he intends to buy more chairs and tables for his hotel and also improve on the quality of service he has been giving his customers to target a higher class of people. The customers served by Moses are happy and contented by his delicious meals.

Moses intends to use the generated profit generated to open other hotels in other markets and add more workers for efficiency. Moses is hard-working and loves his business.

loans.use: Improve his hotel business and buy chairs and tables.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is a married man with one child who is too young for school. He owns a house that has piped water but no electricity. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

He has operated his boda boda (motorcycle) and retail businesses for over seven years. Town dwellers and neighbors are his potential customers. Juma faces the challenge of seasonality. During rainy season, it becomes difficult to operate with the motorbike. He hopes to open a wholesale shop and purchase another motorbike in the future. 

With the Kshs 30,000, he wants to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle, purchase fuel and stock of maize flour for his retail shop. He decided to join Yehu to get loans and save to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his motorcycle, fuel and maize flour for his retail shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional drinks in bulk

loans.name: Jane  Mueni

texts.en:
Jane Mueni, 42 years old, is married to William Ndoo, aged 63 years, and together they have one daughter aged 21 years. She lives at Tala and her dairy business is in the same place.

Jane has been running this dairy business for four years and her monthly profit is Kshs 30,000. Her husband William, who is a retired Army officer, supports her a lot in the business. She was introduced to KADET LTD by the loan officer in charge of the Tala office.

After getting this loan, Jane intends to build a cow shed to protect her cows against bad weather and to buy cattle.

The customers who buy milk from Jane are happy with her service delivery.

If the loan boosts the business, Jane plans that the extra generated income will enable her to buy quality feed for her cows to increase the production and to buy more cows.

Jane is very hardworking and she is happy she chose this type of business.

loans.use: To build a cow shed and buy cattle.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married, 41-year-old woman. She and her husband have seven children who are between the ages of 3 and 20 years old. Five of their children are currently attending school. She has been farming for ten years in Kisii town, which is located in western Kenya. Her farm produces maize, vegetables, bananas, and tea, all of which she sells locally.

She is requesting this loan in the amount of 30,000 KES ($375) through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and raise a dairy cow. The expected increase in income from the sale of milk will help her improve the family's standard of living. Her biggest challenge is a lack of funding, which is needed to buy farm products like fertilizers and seeds. She plans to acquire more dairy cows in future. She explains that she is grateful to Juhudi for the rural-based projects, which help the needy people in her area.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing a dairy cow.

loans.name: Maria Jose

texts.pt:
Maria José T. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, sul de Moçambique viúva e mãe de 4 filhos de idades entre 15 a 28 anos de idade, o ultimo vai a Escola. Fez somente 3ª classe parou devido a doenças e condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 2 irmãos que vivem com ela.

Nunca saiu de Maputo, mas sim mudou de bairro para km 16 onde vive atualmente. Tem um negócio próprio de venda de produtos de primeira necessidade ha mais de 20 anos. Não possui nenhum empregado, conta com ajuda dos filhos e irmãos e consegue em media um rendimento de cerca de 3.500.00mt a 4.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar através de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).

Ja teve empréstimos em outros bancos e pagou sem dificuldades, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga vendedoura que também é cliente da instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (feijão, amendoim, farinha, açúcar e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.

Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo e pedir outro para aplicar na eletrificação e canalização da sua casa.
texts.en:
Maria José T. was born in the city of Maputo in southern Mozambique.  She is a widowed mother of four children between 15 and 28 years old.  The youngest goes to school.  Maria only finished third grade and quit school because of illness and financial problems.  She lives in her own house with her family and supports two siblings who live with her.

She never left Maputo, but she did move to a different neighborhood, where she currently lives.  She has her own business selling staple goods; she has done this for more than 20 years.  She has no employees but counts on the help of her children and siblings.  Maria earns about 3,500 to 4,000 meticais per month, which she uses for household expenses.  She also saves some money through Xitique (a traditional system of rotating savings).

She has had loans from other banks and paid them off without any problems.  She learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is a saleswoman and a customer of this institution.  This is Maria's first loan.  She is asking for 10,000 meticais to buy products (beans, peanuts, flour, sugar and other items) to increase her inventory.

She is confident that she will pay off the loan ahead of schedule and request another to use for electricity and plumbing in her house.

loans.use: Purchase products (beans, peanuts, flour, sugar, etc.)

loans.name: Dominic Ole

texts.en:
Dominic Ole K. is 27 years old and he supports seven people in his family. He has been a wheat farmer for the last seven years. This will be his second loan, which he is planning to spend to prepare land for wheat planting. Wheat has been doing well in his area due to good climate conditions and adequate rainfall throughout the year.

He learned about KADET LTD from other members within his area who are already registered clients. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity by hiring a bigger farm to increase his wheat production.

He is a hard working man and when  supported financially he can achieve a lot.

loans.use: to prepare land for wheat planting.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a 36-year-old member of Pioneer Matasiah group in Faulu Kenya.  For ten years, she has been selling vegetables.  She has two employees in the business.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has become more focused on her business.  She aspires to own more grocery shops in the future.  She has requested 20,000 KES to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen has been practicing mixed farming for twelve years in Kisii town, western Kenya.  Her farm produces maize, beans and nappier grass, which are all sold locally. She also buys and sells vegetables at a local market.

She has requested this loan of 20,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She hopes that her family will have enough milk for consumption and sale. The extra income from this loan will help her provide for the basic needs of her family. Her primary challenge has been the unpredictable weather conditions which affects her production. 

Hellen is 34 years old. She is married with four children who are between the ages of 18 months and 13 years. Three of the children attend school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She operates a kerosene selling business, selling from door to door and from home to be used as fuel for lamps, as well as for heating and cooking. Mariam faces the challenge of an inadequate supply of kerosene in the area. She hopes to expand in the future. 

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase twenty liters of kerosene and building materials. She decided to join Yehu because it provides sustainable financial services to small scale entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase twenty liters of kerosene and building materials.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther A. is from the town of Santa Josefa. She is 45 years old and has two children aged 14 and 13. She is already a widow and raises her children all on her own. She runs a sari-sari (variety)store. She sells various kinds of products. Esther plans to expand her store and have additional kinds of merchandise to sell. 

She also tills a small parcel of land where she plants and harvests rice crops. Her harvest is for family consumption so it helps provide food for them. Esther hopes to be able to sustain her children's education.

Esther joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. 

Esther is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and additional merchandise to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose M. lives in the Wandegeya neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has six children, three of whom are in school.  

Rose has had a restaurant business for three years, and she works six days a week. Her restaurant is in a market, and she sells at retail prices.    

She has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, cassava beef, chicken and charcoal. The main business challenges for Rose include the rainy season.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked hotel. 

She lives in a home that she rents where she doesn't have access to electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy morefood staffs for her restaurant like bunches of bananas, rise,cassava, beef, chciken and charcoal

loans.name: Help Your Friends Group

texts.en:
Selena J., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Help Your Friends.  She is 34 years old and unmarried, and has four children between the ages of 3 and 16 years. She was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to financial difficulty.

For nine years, she has been operating a beauty salon on Ashmun Street in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 10,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 41,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more shampoo, hair driers and other hair products. 

She describes herself as a kind and friendly woman whose dream is to improve her business to international standards.

loans.use: To buy more shampoo, hair driers and other hair products.

loans.name: Erica

texts.en:
Erica is a widow with two daughters. She owns a small store selling food items like bread, baked goods, candies and so on. The monthly profit averages to $508.

Erica has been in this business for eight years. There is very little competition in the neighboring area. Erica knows her clients well and offers them what they need or ask for.

Erica would like to borrow 6,500 UAH to increase her working capital. She hopes to make additional profit and improve her living conditions. Erica lives with her younger daughter in a small apartment.

loans.use: to increase her working capital

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 22-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and two brothers. He has been working in a restaurant since 2008 to earn income. With his business income, he is able to help his father with the family expenses. 

As is common among young Lebanese men, he has a job and is pursuing education at the same time. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay for his university education fees. He is studying computer engineering and this is his second year. 

In the future, he is planning to start his career in a computer company to gain experience and be able to help his parents with his income. In the long term, he is planning to open a computer shop in his town.

loans.use: to pay for his university education fees

loans.name: Annelyn

texts.en:
Annelyn Y. is from the town of Santa Josefa. She is 28 years old. Annelyn is married and has two children aged 5 and 2. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Annelyn's husband is a farmer and she helps him keep their rice crops healthy. She also helps in selling their harvest.

Annelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

Annelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies and additional merchandise to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary N. lives in the Nakulabye Kiyaye neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has four children, three of whom are in school. She has a business of selling bananas. She has been in this business for ten years, and she works seven days a week.  She sells her products at the market at retail prices.     

She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas. Her main business challenges include transportation and the rainy season.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling on a wholesale basis only. 

Mary lives in a home that she rents where she has access to electricity and piped water.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 22-year-old single man living with his parents and three siblings. He is from Lebanon. Despite his young age, he has been working as a journeyman for almost five years. He is also attending university. 

He works hard to manage his time between his business and his education. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay for his university fees. He is studying physics and is in his third year of university. He really likes his major and after his third year certificate, he will continue on for his Masters. 

In the future, he is planning to start working in a laboratory to gain experience and be able to expand his career.

loans.use: to pay for his university fees

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is a married woman with three children all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water but no electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She operates a boutique selling Khanga's (a cotton wrapper worn by East African women), trousers and blouses for resale. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a challenge of transportation. High cost is incurred when transporting clothes from the market to her boutique. Salama hopes to open another boutique in town in the future. 

With the 40,000 KES she wants to purchase more Khanga's, trousers and blouses for resale. Salama decided to join Yehu to get loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase Khanga's, trousers and blouses for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 19-year-old single woman from Lebanon. She lives with her parents. This young woman works as an assistant in a doctor clinic. Her work is very important because with its income, she is able to satisfy her life needs and help her parents pay for her university fees. As with the majority of Lebanese students, her story illustrates the day-to-day challenges involved in working while at the same time pursuing an education. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay for her courses at the university. She is studying biochemistry and this is her first year. In the future, she is planning to start her career in a laboratory to gain experience and be able to help her parents with her income.

loans.use: to pay for her courses at the university

loans.name: Oinepu  Ole

texts.en:
Oinepu Ole K. is 31years old and he supports seven people in his family. He has been a wheat farmer for the last eight years.

This will be his second loan, which he is planning to use to prepare land for wheat planting. Wheat has been doing well in his area due to good climate conditions and adequate rainfall throughout the year.

He learned about KADET LTD from other members within his area of residence who are already registered clients. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

He is a hard working man and when supported financially he can achieve a lot.

loans.use: to prepare land for wheat planting.

loans.name: Terengot Ole

texts.en:
Terengot Ole K. is 24 years old and he supports a family of three. His spouse is Esther K. and she supports him in farming. Terengot has been a wheat farmer for the last four years, and he also raises livestock.

This will be his third loan, which he is planning to spend to prepare land for wheat planting and the remaining amount to buy some livestock. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: to prepare land for wheat planting and to buy some livestock.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en: This is 39 year-old Aminata.  She is married, and has one child who is 10 years-old.  In 1995, Aminata established her palm oil business in order to generate income for her family.  Working five days a week and six hours a day, she earns about Le 600,000 every month from this business.  Aminata would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to increase her stock.  She also expects that this loan will enable her to travel to other countries, where she can purchase goods more cheaply.  Her biggest challenges at the moment are the high cost of transportation and depreciation of the local currency.  She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 600,000.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 43 years old. He is married with five school-aged children who all attend school. He is a farmer from Kisii town in western Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last twenty years. His farm produces tea which he sells through Kenya Tea Development Agency and maize which he sells locally.

He has requested this loan of 25,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will help him pay school fees for his children. In the future, he would like to acquire more dairy cows that will increase his production and enable him to maximize profits from the sale of milk. 

He is grateful to Juhudi for giving loans to farmers, and urges them to consider the plight of other farmers not yet reached.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah N. lives in the Kawempe Bubajwe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has seven children, all of whom are in school.  

Hadjah has a business of selling bananas. She has been in this business for four years, and she works seven days a week. She sells her products for retail prices at the market.  Hadjah has requested a loan 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas.     

She also generates additional income through rental rooms. The main business challenges for Hadjah include transportation and the rainy season.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling on a wholesale basis only and also to buy another plot of land.   

Hadjah lives in a home that she owns; she doesn't have access to electricity or to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a single woman who rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

She operates a boutique business, selling clothes especially for women and children. Emma faces the challenge of competition. She experiences high competition from other boutique operators at the market. She hopes to open a bigger boutique in the future. 

She decided to join Yehu to get loans to expand her business. With the 40,000 KES she wants to purchase women's and children's clothing for resale.

loans.use: To purchase women's and children's clothing for resale.

loans.name: Boaz

texts.en:
Boaz O. is 25 years old and married to Slavian Akinyi, and they have a four-year-old son who is in nursery school. 

Boaz has a retail shop that he has been running for the past year.  He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD as he needs to buy four bails of flour, cooking oil and sugar to add to his stock. He intends to use the profits from the loan to pay school fees for their son and also for the family's upkeep. 

His desire is to own a big supermarket in the future and be able to supply other shops around his area.

loans.use: to buy four bails of flour, cooking oil and sugar

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Mrs. Rita B. is a 42-year-old married woman with a daughter and a son. They live in Bhatkepati, Lalitpur. Her husband, Mr. Shyam Krishna B., is a driver. Both her son and daughter are studying in higher secondary school.

Mrs. B. started selling milk five years ago. She already owns one cow. She's requesting a loan of 30,000 NPR to buy another young cow so she can sell more milk in the local area. Since they live in a growing neighborhood, she believes that there will be an increase in the demand for milk. Nepalese people love to drink cow's milk, so demand for milk is increasing constantly. 

She wishes to spend her income on her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a young cow

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: This is 35 year-old Isatu.  She is married and has five children, aged 4, 6, 10 and13 years.  In 1985, Isatu established her textile business, which includes selling cotton, underwear, clothes, and napkins.  She began her business to increase the living conditions of her family.  Working five days a week and six hours a day, she earns about Le 600,000 every month from this business.  Isatu would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 to buy more stock for her business.  She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 700,000. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more cotton cloth, underwear and napkins.

loans.name: C4607 Bamporeze Group

texts.en:
Emilienne is 32 years old and she is married.  Emilienne is the leader of a group called 'Bamporeze' which is in the business of selling shoes, this is their fifth year in this business.  The business hours are from 8 am to 6 pm every day.

Emilienne and her team need to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a.  With this loan, Emilienne will expand her business through purchasing different styles of shoes for sale.  With these additional styles of shoes, this team will hopefully earn more profits which in turn will allow each member of this group to keep progressing and in addition to that, they will keep investing in their business for better financial stability.

loans.use: different styles of shoes for sale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 46-year-old married man and the father of 4 children. One of his children is attending the university. He works as a farmer specialized in cultivating lemon products. He has been involved in this occupation since 1990. He works hard to be able to provide a good education for his children. And today, he is requesting a loan $700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay for his son courses at the university. His son is studying business management and he is in his second year. In the future, his son is planning to work in an advertising and marketing company.

loans.use: to pay for his son courses at the university

loans.name: Lilian Wambui

texts.en:
Lilian Wambui N. is 30 years old and she supports a family of three people. Her spouse is Kilas Kisento and he is employed. They have two children, aged 11 years and three years old.  Lilian operates a taxi Business in Narok town and she has been in this business for six years.

She learned about KADET LTD from a market awareness campaign done by KADET staffs in Narok town. This will be her first loan which she is planning to spend on buying some spare parts and servicing of her car.

With the anticipated profit from the business she plans to pay school fees for her children. Lilian dream is that she will own a fleet of cars and build a nice house.  She is a hard working woman with a great vision.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to service her car.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 33 years old and she is married with 4 children who are 6, 11, 13 and 14 years old.  Florence is a self-employed businesswoman who is commonly known in the business of selling dishes such as saucepans, thermoses and bowls, as her picture indicates.  Florence has been in this business for about 5 years and her business hours are from 8 am to 6 pm every day.

Florence needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  On receiving this loan, Florence will expand her business through purchasing different types of dishes for sale.  With these different types of dishes, Florence will hopefully earn more profits which in turn will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability and continue building a secure future for her family.

loans.use: the purchase of various dishes for sale

loans.name: Sushila

texts.en:
This is 32 year-old Sushila B..  She is married and has one child, aged 5.  In 1998, she established  her tailoring business.  Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to purchase raw materials for her tailoring work.  In the future, Sushila plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.  

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order.  Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines.  These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal.  With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:
 BPW Partner Page     Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team"

loans.use: to buy raw materials for tailoring work

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter M. became a Solio agent in May. He leases 10 Solios to clients in his community generating extra income and improving his business. He uses his own Solio to illuminate his grocery store in the evenings, extending his opening hours and increasing his sales. The bright light of Solio attracts more customers, allowing close inspection of vegetables at night and ensuring that the milk Peter sells in his store is not spoiled by the fumes that a kerosene lamp would generate. Since he has started using Solio his sales of milk have increased to 50 litres per day. His clients appreciate the convenience of charging mobile phones and that Solio makes lighting readily available  Also, the product  is not reliant of the recently unreliable supply of kerosene on the local market.

loans.use: purchase solar powered products

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet N. lives in the Kalerwe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is widowed and has 3 children, all of whom are in school.  Juliet has a business operating a retail shop.  She has been in this business for 4 years, and she works 7 days out of every week.  Juliet sells her products from home selling at retail.     

Juliet has requested for a loan 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, cooking oil and boxes of soap.   The main business challenge(s) for Juliet   include transportation and rainy season.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling at wholesale only and also buy another plot of land.    

Juliet lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and has piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, cooking oil, and boxes of soap

loans.name: Parsaon Ole

texts.en:
Parsaon Ole M. is 32 Years old and married to Talash M.. He supports three people in his family.
Parsaon is a farmer and he farms his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last seven years.

He learned about KADET LTD through a friend who is already a member with KADET. This will be his second loan which he is planning to spend forty thousand to buy fertilizer and chemical to spray his ready growing wheat. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small scale to commercial farming. Parsaon dream is to practice large scale farming, attain financial independence and improve the living standard of his family.

He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and chemicals to spray his wheat crop

loans.name: Tejan

texts.en: This is 50 year-old Tejan.  He is married and has three children, aged 15, 10 and 7.  In 2000, Tejan established his used clothing business in order to become self-reliant.  Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about Le 1,922,800 every month from this business.  He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 to buy more used trousers, t-shirts and blouses.  He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 288,420.  In the future, Tejan plans to have a shop instead of just a table and he also hopes to be one of the most popular suppliers in town.  He currently reinvests his profits back into his business for growth, Tejan plans to educate his children to university level.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy additional clothing to sell.

loans.name: Kayekai Ole

texts.en:
Kayekai Ole S. is 26 years old and married to Sankei S.. He is a father of two school going children. S. is a farmer who does potatoe farming and also a business man who buys potatoes direct from farmers and resells them in whole sale to retail sellers within Narok town and to others from Nairobi city.

He learned about KADET through a friend who is a registered member. This will be his first loan with which he is planning to buy more potatoes from the farmers as this is the harvesting time. He will sell them inthe city.

He hopes to use the anticipated profit from this loan to expand his business and open  a store within the city where he can be keeping his stock stored and waiting to be sold.

Kayekai dream is to become a distributor of farm produce in different towns. He is a hard working man and determined to achieve his set goal.

loans.use: To buy potatoes from farmers for resale

loans.name: Dipa

texts.en:
This is 18 year-old Dipa K..  She is unmarried and in 2008, she established  her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to purchase grocery goods for her shop.  In the future, Dipa plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.  

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:
 BPW Partner Page     Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team"

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her shop

loans.name: Muhamvi

texts.en:
Muhamvi is a married woman with eight children, six of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She operates a firewood selling business, selling from home to town dwellers and neighbours. Muhamvi faces a challenge of seasonality. During the rainy season it becomes hard to get firewood from the forest. She hopes to establish a stall for selling firewood in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of firewood and charcoal for resale. Muhamvi decided to join Yehu to get loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of firewood and charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Bernard Omwoyo

texts.en:
Bernard Omwoyo N. is 38years old and he supports a family of five. His spouse, Joyce is also a business woman.  Bernard is a businessman running a retail shop in Narok town and has been in this business for the last seven years.

He learned about KADET LTD through a friend who is a registered member in KADET. This will be his forth loan which he is planning to buy more items to increase his stock.  He hopes to use the anticipated profit from this loan to expand his business and open up another shop.

Bernard dream is to become a whole seller and be a distributor in Narok town.  He is a hardworking man with a great vision.

loans.use: To buy more stock of sugar, cooking fa,t and other shop stock

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel  solicito 500 $us. Vive en Achacahi y se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en su comunidad. Es Soltero.
 El crédito lo empleará en la compra de una vaca lechera, la cual será el comienzo para su nueva actividad, como productor lechero. Es el primer  crédito en impro y el primero vía Kiva.
texts.en:
Miguel is requesting a loan of $500USD.  He lives in Achacahi and works as a taxi driver in his community.  He is single.

Miguel will use his loan to purchase a dairy cow.  This will be the beginning of a new business for him as a dairy farmer.  This is his first loan from Impro and his first via Kiva.

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow to begin working as a dairy farmer

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen Kaipoi is a thirty eight year old industrious farmer in Magwara village, Kilgoris town. He is married to Lucy, a thirty one year old lady. They have four children, two daughters and two sons. 

Stephen does maize farming in Magwara area which has a rich soil for this type of crop.  It is planting  season in this area and Stephen has been awarded a Kshs 20,000 loan which he will use to buy maize seedlings, fertilizer and pay for labor costs. His plan is to keep a good credit record with KADET  Through making timely repayments he is assured of a subsequent loan.

His dream is to keep working hard in his agriculture business and maximize profits from his product sales in order to meet his family needs.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Bakebeza Group

texts.fr:
Verdienne M.,  est une femme de 42 ans, née à ngenda RWANDA, elle a fait l’école primaire seulement. Elle est mariée et à 8 enfants, le moins âgée a 3ans et le plus âgée à 22 ans, 5 vont à l’école. Verdienne habite avec sa famille à Ruhuha. Elle appartient dans le groupe solidaire Appellé BAKEBEZA œuvra à Ruhuha, cultivateurs de 
riz en milieu rural du district de Bugesera, les membres de ce groupe se garantissent mutuellement, Le crédit contracté avec ACB est  le deuxième, le précédent lui sont aidés d’augmenter l’étendu cultivé,  et améliorer les conditions de vie da sa famille. Notons qu’une partie du profit est épargné sur le compte du groupe et une autre est utilisé dans les dépenses familiales. Dans l’avenir, après avoir terminé les remboursements du crédit, elle pourra solliciter  un nouveau prêt pour  acheter une vache et deux moutons.NB hommes dans ce groupes sont representés par leurs femmes.
texts.en:
