Verdienne M. is a 42-year-old woman who was born in Ngenda, RWANDA.  She has only a primary school education.  She is married and has eight children.  The youngest is 3 years old, and the eldest is 22.  Five of them go to school. 

Verdienne lives with her family in Ruhuha.  She belongs to the solidarity group called BAKEBEZA in Ruhuha.  The members of this group are rice farmers in a rural area of the Bugesera district, and they guarantee one another.  The loan signed with ACB is Verdienne's second one.  The first one helped to expand the area cultivated and to improve her family's living conditions.  It should be noted that part of the profits is saved in the group's account, and another part is used for family expenses. 

In the future, after having finished paying the loan, Verdienne will be able to requesting a new loan for buying a cow and two sheep.  

Note:  The men in this group are represented by their wives.

loans.use: Buying fertilizers

loans.name: Uaminifu Renové Group

texts.fr: Kahambu Muhondo est  présidente du groupe Uaminifu Renové, âgée de 48 ans, mariée, mère de 5  enfants.  Son mari est  cultivateur. Tous ses enfants étudient. son fils ainé est déjà médecin, le second infirmier, le 3e fait la faculté d’économie. Les autres sont aux études secondaires. Elle  commença son business  avec son fond propre. Elle fait le commerce général de divers.  Elle a une boutique/kiosque dans la ville de Goma. Avant de s’installer dans la ville de Goma, elle venait du village de Kibirizi, dans l’intérieur du territoire de Rutshuru  en fuyant la guerre et l’insécurité des rebelles Rwandais  FDLR.  Elle bénéficia de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima de 50$ vers les années 2007. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner son stock  avec les farines, huile de table Rina, sucre, savon, produits  manufacturés, etc. La cliente Kahambu Muhondo remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique.  Il sied de signaler que ce groupe Uaminifu Renové est  composé de 7 membres.
texts.en:
Kahambu Muhondo is the president of the Uaminifu Renové group. She is 48 years old, married and the mother of 5 children. Her husband is a farmer. All of her children study. Her eldest son is already a doctor, the second is a medical assistant, the third studies economics at university. The others are in secondary school. 

She started her business with her own funds. She sells various goods. She has a shop/booth in the town of Goma. Before settling in the town of Goma, she lived in the village of Kibirizi, inside the Rutshuru territory. She fled the war and insecurity caused by the Rwandan rebels from the FDLR.  

She received a loan of $50 from the microfinance institution Hekima around 2007. This new loan will allow her to stock up on flour, Rina edible oil (a brand of oil), sugar, soap, manufactured goods etc. Kahambu Muhondo thanks Hekima for its actions in favor of the poor who are excluded from mainstream banking.  It must be noted that the Uaminifu Renové group is composed of 7 members.

loans.use: flour, Rina edible oil, sugar, soap, manufactured goods etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: David Alberto

texts.es:
David de 42 años, es taxista y vive con su esposa y dos hijos en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas), su casa es de cemento pero le falta remodelación. 

Siempre le gusto conducir, hace ya algunos años tubo la oportunidad de alquilar un carro para convertirlo en un taxi, poco a poco con esfuerzo y trasnocharse en las avenidas de Guayaquil pudo comprar su propio carro. En la trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días recorriendo las calles de Guayaquil. Ya tiene clientes fijos que lo llaman para el trasporte. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, piedras, pinturas para poder adecuar su casa y que su esposa e hijas vivan bien. En el futuro quiere seguir trabajando como taxista para darle una vida estable a sus hijas.
texts.en:
David is 42 years old.  He is a taxi driver and lives with his wife and two children in las Orqídeas de Guayaquil (an urban area which is called 'Las Orquídeas' – 'Orchids' because when it was discovered there were many orchids there).  His house is made from cement but it needs work.

David has always enjoyed driving.  Some years ago now he had the opportunity to rent a car to use as a taxi.  Little by little with effort and through working late nights in the streets of Guayaquil, he was able to purchase his own car.  He works from 7.00am until 9.00pm every day, driving around the streets of Guayaquil.  He has regular clients who call him when they need transport.

With his loan, he would like to purchase cement, stones and paint in order to be able to improve his house so that his wife and daughters can live well.  In the future, he would like to continue working as a taxi driver so that he can provide his daughters with a stable life.

loans.use: Cement, stone

loans.name: Sumaya Nompayan Enole

texts.en:
Sumaya Nompayan is a forty year old, modest lady from kilgoris County, South of the  Great Rift valley. She is married to Daniel who is a farmer. The couple has six children with the oldest being 18 years while youngest is two years of age.

Sumaya has been a farmer for the last 21 years and is growing stronger in this business due toa  high demand for maize as a cereal in this part of Kenya. She joined KADET limited to gain access to micro credit and is taking out her first loan. She will use the loan to hire farming fieldhands and buy maize seedlings for this planting season.

Through hiring other fieldhands, Sumaya is sure of a bumper harvest thus good profits which she will use to improve the family’s living standards and also pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy maize seedlings and to hire farming fields

loans.name: Sajana

texts.en:
This is 34 year-old Sajana D..  She is married and has 3 children aged 12, 10 and 8.  In 2008, she established her tea shop business.  Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supoorts her family.  She has already received, and successfully repaid, 2 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buys food supplies for her shop.  In the future, Sajana plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Whether on the streets of Kathmandu or in the villages outside of the capital, tea shops are places of business and meeting in Nepal.  Called a chiya pasal, these tea shops make a sweet, milky tea that can be purchased for a few cents a cup.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to keep their store shelves stocked while increasing their profit margins by buying in greater volume. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:
 BPW Partner Page     Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team"

loans.use: to buy food supplies for her shop

loans.name: Junior

texts.es:
Junior vive en la casa de sus padres cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la ciudad de el alto zona Alto pasankeri. El es productor agrícola, tiene una carpa solar donde produce hortalizas de alta calidad. Esta actividad su es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención. El tiene dos hijos, su esposa es comerciante, vende frutas en las ferias de la ciudad de La Paz. 
 
El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de material de construcción como cemento, arena  y ladrillo. Esto le servirá para refaccionar el muro principal de su vivienda.
 
Es Tercer crédito con Impro; el buen comportamiento de sus pagos le permite acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Junior lives in his parents' house which is in the city of El Alto in the Alto Pasankeri region.  He is a farmer.  He has a greenhouse where he produces high quality vegetables.  This business is his main source of income.  He has two children and his wife is a merchant who sells fruit in the markets in the city of La Paz.

The loan will be used to buy building supplies such as cement, sand and brick.  They will be used to resurface the main wall of his house.

This is Junior's third loan with Impro.  He is allowed access to a new loan because he has always made his repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To purchase cement, sand and brick to resurface the wall of his house

loans.name: Risper

texts.en:
Risper O. is a forty three year old hardworking lady in Pap Onditi Katito, a town near Kisumu City, along the shores of Lake Victoria. Risper is married to Willis who is a government official. They have three children, Hillary, Irine and Tom. 

Risper operates a food stall in Pap Onditi and has been running it for the last two years. She joined KADET LTD to gain access to micro credit and is now taking her second loan of Kshs 50,000 which she plans to use to buy food items like cooking fat, flour, water and many more. Risper makes a monthly profit of Kshs 6,000 but she hopes to make more than this. The anticipated profits will be used to pay school fees for her three children. 

Her dreams are to expand her business and educate her children, she believes that this is the best she can give them as a parent.

loans.use: To buy cooking fat and flour to add to her stock

loans.name: Chanda

texts.en:
This is 28 year-old Chanda B..  She is married and has 2 children aged 9 and 3.  In 2000, she established  her cow's milk selling business.  Working 7 days a week and 5 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buys a young cow.  In the future, Chanda plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal.  Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made.  Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking.  On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day.  In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50.  In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks.  The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.  

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:
 BPW Partner Page     Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team"

loans.use: to buy a young milk producing cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Soles and glue

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema K. lives in the Kawempe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children; all of them are in school. Rehema has a business selling charcoal. She has been in this business for just under 20 years, and she works seven days out of every week. Rehema sells her products in a retail market. Rehema has requested 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO. She will use the loan to buy more bags of charcoal. She earns additional income through selling passion fruit and samosas to fellow market vendors.

The main business challenge for Rehema is transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van to ease her transportation problems. Rehema lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is thirty years old and married to Mr. Rop. They have been blessed with two children, eight and three years old. She operates a clothing shop where she sells a variety of clothes for men, ladies, and children. She has been in the business for the last three years and has been making a good profit from it. She has used the profits to feed her family and educate her children. 

Beatrice learned about KADET Ltd through an existing client. This is her second loan. She plans to buy additional inventory of new clothes with this loan.

Her future plan is to own a wholesale shop where she will stock a variety of new clothes and even bales of second-hand clothes.

loans.use: To buy clothes for inventory

loans.name: Mwalimu

texts.en:
Mwalimu is a married man with three children. One of his chidlren attends school, while the other two are still too young for school. He owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are transportation and food.

For more than sixteen years, he has operated a retail shop selling sugar, maize flour, and wheat flour. Mwalimu faces a major challenge of transportation. He buys goods in bulk from town and transports them to his shop. Mwalimu hopes to operate an agricultural farm in the future. 

He decided to join Yehu because it empowers rural economically-marginalized entrepreneurs. With the 40,000 KES loan, he wants to purchase a poshomill machine that will enable him to grind maize into flour.

loans.use: To purchase a poshomill machine

loans.name: Florencia Esther

texts.es:
Florencia de 50 años, vive con sus hijos en en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, a su alrededor tiene el estero salado). 

Antes solo era un ama de casa pero quería tener sus propios ingresos y ayudar con los gastos familiares así que decidió invertir sus ahorros y comprar víveres. Desde ese tiempo hasta ahora ella ha venido readecuando la parte delantera de su casa donde tiene la tienda y surtiéndola con mercedaria y productos nuevos. Trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días la atiende sola. Vende arroz, enlatados, lácteos, bebidas etc.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz ya que es lo que mas se vende y lácteos, bebidas para su tienda. En el futuro quiere  tener su casa mejor construida y que sus hijos terminen los estudios con éxito.
texts.en:
Florencia is 50 years old.  She lives with her children along Guayaquil’s Beltway (a periurban zone surrounded by a salty estuary).

In the past she was only a housewife, but she needed her own income to help with the family expenses.  She decided to invest her savings in the purchase of supplies.  From that time on she has been reconditioning the front part of her house where she has the store.  She has also been stocking it with merchandise and new products.  She works by herself from 7:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m. every day.  She sells rice, canned goods, dairy products, and drinks, etc.

She wants to use the loan to buy rice, which is what she sells the most.  She also wants to buy dairy products and drinks for her store.  

In the future she wants to improve the construction of her house.  Additionally, she wants her children to successfully complete their education.

loans.use: Rice, canned goods, and drinks

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane N. lives in the Kawempe neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school.  
Jane has run a tailoring business for eight years. She works seven days a week selling her products in a retail shop. Jane has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from Kiva partner, MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more materials for making clothes. 
Jane's main business challenges are defaulters and the rainy season. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start a tailoring school and buy a plot of land. Jane lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but no access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more materials for making clothes

loans.name: Leon

texts.es:
Leon vive en la zona de Cota Cota de la ciudad de La Paz. 
Es jubilado, tiene una tienda donde elabora masitas, y tortas, con su esposa
Esta casado y tiene dos hijos.
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra de insumos, harina, manteca, levadura queso, y otros)
Es la novena vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Y la segunda vez que solicita el apoyo de Kiva, demostrando responsabilidad, en el pago de sus cuotas.
Con este crédito podrá incrementar sus ingresos, y comprar insumos en cantidad para mejorar los costos de compra.
texts.en:
Leon lives in the Cota Cota area of the city of La Paz.

He is retired, and he has a store where he and his wife make pastries and cakes .  He is married and has two children.

The loan will be for working capital (to buy supplies, flour, shortening, yeast, cheese, and other things).

This is the ninth time that he has requested a loan with Impro.  It is the second time that he has requested Kiva’s support.  He has demonstrated responsibility with his payments.

With this loan he will be able to increase his earnings and buy supplies in large quantities in order to improve the purchase price.

loans.use: To buy supplies, flour, shortening, yeast, cheese, and other things for his pastry business

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 24 years old and she is married with one child who is two and half years old.  Marie is a self-employed businesswoman who is commonly known in the business of selling shoes for women.  She has been in this business for about one year and half and her business hours are from 7 am to 7 pm every day.

Marie needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, Marie will hopefully expand her business through purchasing different styles of shoes for women.  With these additional styles of shoes for sale, she will hopefully earn more profits which in turn will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability in her business.

loans.use: different styles of women's shoes

loans.name: Lucie

texts.en:
Lucie is 23 years old, married with one child who is two years old.  Lucie is a self-employed businesswoman who is in the business of selling new shirts for men. She has been in this business for about 4 years; her business is open 7 am to 6 pm every day.

Although Lucie has been in this business for about 4 years, her capital is still too low to expand meaningfully.  To end this situation, she needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, she will hopefully earn more profits through the sale of a big number of shirts which in turn will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability. In addition to that, she will continue taking care of her family.

loans.use: buying a lot of shirts for sale

loans.name: Glenda

texts.es:
Glenda vive en la zona Obrajes de la ciudad de La Paz. 
Es empleada, trabaja por las mañanas en el Megacenter (Centro Comercial más grande La Paz) como vendedora, y por las tardes se dedica a la elaboración de Caleidoscopios, en su domicilio
Es soltera e independiente.
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra de tubos espejos, papel sticker, tapas de plástico y tubos de ensayo), para continuar con su actividad independiente.
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su historial la califica como cliente bueno en el pago de sus cuotas.
Con este crédito podrá incrementar sus ingresos, y mejorar la cantidad de producción de los caleidoscopios.
texts.en:
Glenda lives in the Obrajes area in the city of La Paz.  She is employed, and in the morning works in the Megacenter (the largest commercial center in La Paz) as a salesperson, and in the evenings she makes kaleidoscopes in her home.  She is single and lives by herself.

The credit will be used for capital (buying tubes, mirrors, stickers, plastic lids, and test tubes) to continue with her independent activities.

This is the second loan she has requested from Impro.  Her payment history classifies her as a good client.  With this loan she will be able to increase her income and increase the quantity of kaleidoscopes she produces.

loans.use: Purchase of materials like tubes, mirrors, stickers, and plastic lids for her kaleidoscope business

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan N. lives in the Ndeeba neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has six children, all of whom are in school.  Susan has a business that began as a shop, but is now a beauty salon. She has been in this business for less than a year, and she works seven days a week. Susan has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of hair relaxers and braids. The main business challenges for Susan include defaulters and the rainy season. Her goals and aspirations are to own a bridal salon and buy a plot of land. Susan lives in a rented home and has access to electricity, but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and medication.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of hair relaxers and braids

loans.name: Momo

texts.en:
Momo is a married woman with one boy aged 12 who is attending school. She rents a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is clothing.

She operates a restaurant from home, and neighbours and passers by are her major customers. Momo faces competition from nearby restaurant operators. She hopes to build her own home in the future. 

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings she wants to purchase packets of washing soap, cooking oil, rice, maize and beans for her restaurant. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase packets of washing soap, cooking oil, rice, maize and beans for her restaurant.

loans.name: Afuwa

texts.en: Afuwa N. lives in the Namungoona- Kawala neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school. Afuwa has a charcoal sales business. She has been in this business for less than than seven years, and she works seven days a week. Afuwa sells her charcoal from home. She has requested for a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more sacks of charcoal. The main business challenges for Afuwa are transportation and the rainy season. She aspires to owning a delivery van. Afuwa lives in a home that she owns, but she doesn't have access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Xavier Benito

texts.es:
Xavier de 38 años, es ebanista y vive en el Suburbio de Guayaquil(zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales). 

Desde los 12 años el empezó aprender a ser ebanista en varios talleres, pero como no le enseñaban detalladamente el papa le comenzó a enseñar llevándolo a los talleres para explicarle cual era el proceso de hacer un mueble. Cuando creció y para poder mantener a su familia opto por tener su propio taller de ebanista. En la actualidad trabaja desde las muy temprano con sus hermanos y papa, su taller se convirtió en un negocio familiar. 

El espacio donde viven es muy reducido por eso el quiere el préstamo para comprar cemento, piedras y bloques para construir mejor su casa. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y darle un buen futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Xavier, 38, is a carpenter.  He lives in the Ecuadorean city of Guayaquil (in an urban area where the majority of the inhabitants own informal businesses).

Xavier started training as a carpenter 12 years ago by working in various carpentry shops, but he only learned the intricacies of the trade when his father began taking him around so that he could watch and learn all of the different steps required to make furniture.  Once he had a family of his own, Xavier decided to set up his own carpentry shop.  He now works with his father and brother in a shop that has become a family business.

Xavier's house is very run-down, so he's applying for a loan to buy cement, gravel and cement blocks for a construction project to improve the house.  He wants to build a better future for his children.

loans.use: Buy cement, etc. for construction project.

loans.name: Jean Marie Vianney

texts.en:
Jean Marie Vianney was born in 1983 and is married with one child. Jean Marie Vianney is a driver, however, he does not drive his own motorbike. Jean Marie Vianney's wife does not work, so she does not have any income. For that reason Jean Marie Vianney works hard in order to provide all necessities for his family. Jean Marie Vianney has an experience of one year in his business and the hours he works are from 6 in the morning to 6 in the evening every day.

Jean Marie Vianney is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance in order to buy his own motorbike since he is a licensed driver. With this loan, Jean Marie Vianney will be able to have more income for daily needs.

loans.use: buying a new motorbike

loans.name: Emvar Ulises

texts.es:
El Sr. H. Q. Emvar Ulises es conviviente, tiene dos hijas de 6 y 3 años. Viven en casa de sus padres con los cuales comparte sus gastos.
Se dedica a prestar servicios de arreglos de celulares en un puesto alquilado en una galería hace 2 años.
Además también se dedica a la venta de artículos de celulares y alquiler de disfraces.
Tiene buenas referencias personales y solicita el préstamo para incrementar su negocio y así poder brindarle mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Sr. H. Q. Emvar Ulises is partnered and has two daughters, 6- and 3-years old, respectively.  They live with his parents and share the household's expenses.  He has operated a cell phone repair busines for 2 years, in a stall that he rents at a local shopping center.  He also sells cell phone accessories and rents costumes.  He has good personal references and is applying for a loan to grow his business and, in turn, provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 56 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus hijos. La actividad a la que se dedica, es la preparación y venta de comidas, en un local  alquilado que queda al lado del paradero de buses. Todos los días, muy temprano por la mañana acude a su local, que esta a media hora de su casa en carro, desde entonces empieza sus labores culinarias, ya que  sus  asiduos clientes, que en su mayoría son los chóferes van a su establecimiento a consumir la comida que prepara con tanto esmero y premura. Lleva 10 años realizando esta labor, aunque ahora tiene el apoyo de una persona que ha contratado. Su pronta necesidad es poner el piso de su local, para ofrecer mayor acogida a sus clientes. Es el segundo crédito que tiene y promete ser muy responsable con sus pagos, asimismo agradece a todas las personas que facilitaron el préstamo, ya que se es muy útil para el progreso de su negocio. María, piensa invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de productos de primera necesidad y  utensilios de cocina.
texts.en:
María, 56, is a very hard working mother.  She lives in her own house with her husband and children.  She prepares and sells food in a rented locale next to a bus stop.

She goes to her location, which is a half hour car ride from home, early in the morning every day to start her culinary chores because her regular customers, who are bus drivers for the most part, come by her locale to consume the food she prepares with so much urgency and dedication. She has been in this business for 10 years though she now has hired an employee that helps out.

Her immediate need is to install a floor in her place to better welcome her customers.  This is the second loan she’s had and she promises to be very responsible with her payments.  She also thanks the people who made the loan possible because it’s very useful for her business.

María plans to use the funds to buy basic ingredients and kitchen utensils.

loans.use: To buy basic ingredients and utensils.

loans.name: Theonille

texts.en:
Theonille is 26 and married with one child. Theonille is a businesswoman and her husband is a businessman as well. Theonille owns a business selling spare parts which is profitable business. Theonille's business is known and organized. This is her 5th year of successful work in her business and the hours of her daily activities are from 6 in the morning to 6 in the evening every day except one day on the weekend.

Theonille is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing more spare parts for sale. This expansion will make her more effective and more efficient.

loans.use: Purchasing additional products

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es:
Violeta forma parte del banco comunal “Pueblo de Indios Emprende”, perteneciente a la comuna de San Vicente de Tagua Tagua. Ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes, en su casa hace 2 años. Además los fines de semana hace tortas y empanadas por encargo. Su esposo, quien trabaja en construcción, le ayuda a atender el negocio cuando está sin trabajo. 
Con este préstamo comprará mercadería, es decir abarrotes, harina y bebidas. Tiene 3 hijos, pero solo el menor, de 12 años, vive con ella. Su sueño es tener una amasandería, ya que estudió repostería y es lo que más le gusta hacer. Violeta está muy agradecida de Fondo Esperanza, ya que pudo obtener los préstamos sin ninguna complicación, por el bajo interés y porque le dio la oportunidad para crecer en su negocio, ya que cuando comenzó a trabajar con Fondo  Esperanza solo vendía productos de repostería por encargos.
San Vicente de Tagua Tagua es una comuna de la zona central de Chile, perteneciente a la región del Libertador General Bernardo O’higgins, emplazada a orillas del río Estero Zamorano. Su principal fuente económica se basa en la producción de limones, naranjas y paltas.
texts.en:
Violeta is a member of the Pueblo de Indios Emprende Community Bank in the town of San Vicente de Tagua Tagua. She has run a grocery store out of her house for two years. Also at weekends she takes orders for pies and empanadas. Her husband who works in construction helps her with the business when he doesn’t have work.

With this loan Violeta will buy merchandise such as flour and drinks. She has three children but only the youngest who is 12 years old lives with her. Her dream is to own a breadmaker as she has studied baking, and this is what she most likes to do.

Violeta is very grateful to Kiva partner Fondo Esperanza as she obtained the loan without any problems. Also the interest rate is low, and the money has given her the chance to expand the business. When she first started working with Fondo Esperanza, she only sold baking which had previously been ordered. 

San Vicente de Tagua Tagua is a town in the central part of Chile in the region of Libertador General Bernardo O’Higgins, located on the banks of the Estero Zamorano River. Most people in this part of Chile make a living selling lemons, oranges and avocados. .

loans.use: to buy more stock

loans.name: Sarmila

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Sarmila N.. She is married and has one child, aged nine. In 2000, she established her metal utensil workshop business. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW, which was used to buy raw materials for her work. In the future, Sarmila plans to raise the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.   

Nepal has a long and rich history of traditional handicrafts.  Throughout the Kathmandu Valley, skilled artisans produce unique pieces of art that reflect Nepal's cultural diversity. Terracotta pottery comes from the red clay of the surrounding Himalayan foothills. Bronze and silver statuettes are formed using wax molds and intricate hand-tool finishing. In Patan, Newari culture and traditions are reflected in the images and symbols etched into metal or formed in stone. With the help of a Kiva loan, Nepal's artisans are able to purchase raw materials in greater volume. This increase in volume allows a single artisan to work on several pieces at the same time, while increasing her profit margin.

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her work

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: Bertha tiene 49 años, es una madre de familia trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 5 hijos. Todos los días, a cualquier hora de su tiempo, sale ofrecer sus productos de belleza, siendo su principal actividad de ella; es por eso que empieza sus labores domesticas muy temprano por la mañana, para que en lo que resta del día pueda trabajar tranquilamente. La actividad que realiza lo considera rentable, y gracias a las ganancias que obtiene puede brindar lo mejor a sus hijos. Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es orientar a sus clientes sobre los productos que deben usar, además que lo disfruta haciendo, pese a que debe caminar mucho, pero no le importa con tal de vender la mayor cantidad de cosméticos. Con el tiempo, desea poner una tienda en su casa, donde pueda vender con comodidad sus productos de belleza y otras cosas más. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y esta muy feliz de poder obtenerlo, y por ello seguirá siendo muy puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, para mas adelante tener nuevos créditos. Con el crédito que solicita, Adquirirá productos de belleza; asimismo desea invertir en la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
Bertha is 49 years old and a hardworking mother. She lives in her own home with her husband and five children. Every day, at any given hour, she offers beauty products for sale since this is her main business activity. For this reason, Bertha starts her household chores very early in the morning so that she can have the rest of the day available to work peacefully. She considers her business to be profitable and thanks to the income she generates she is able to provide the best for her children. What she enjoys most about her work is advising her customers as to what products they should use. In addition, she likes her job despite having to do a great deal of walking. As long as she sells a large quantity of cosmetics, nothing else matters. Over time, she hopes to establish a store in her house where she can comfortably sell beauty products and many other items.

This is her second loan with MFP. Bertha is very happy to receive it and will continue to be prompt with her payments so that she can be eligible for new loans. The money she requested will be used to acquire beauty products. She would also like to invest in the construction of her house.

loans.use: Acquire beauty products

loans.name: Perla Yuliet

texts.es: La sra. perla usara su credito para el mejoramiento de su vivienda pondra piso de concreto en su patio y vitropiso en sus cuartos y para que sus hijos tengan un hogar mas hijienico y asi tendra una mejor imajen su casa ya que ella es una madre soltera y vio en el credito una buena oportunidad de superacion y la mejor manera de tener a sus hijos en un hogar mas comodo.
texts.en: Sra. Perla will use her loan to make improvements to her house. She wants to add a concrete floor to the patio and tile the floors of the other rooms so that her children have a cleaner home. It will also make the place look better. Perla is a single mother. She felt that this loan was a good opportunity to get ahead and the best way to make a more comfortable home for her children.

loans.use: to install new flooring

loans.name: Rudh Secibel

texts.es:
Rudh de 28 años, , ella tiene una papelería (en Ecuador se los llama “bazar”), vive en el Suburbio de Guayaquil(zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales). 

La hermana mayor se fue al migro a oto país y le dejo en el cuidado de su casa y una papelería para poder mantener a su familia se puso administrar el negocio, vendiendo cuadernos, plumas y papeles a sus vecinos y conocidos Trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar un congelador para vender bebidas y  cuadernos, plumas para su negocio. En el futuro quiere amplia la papelería.
texts.en:
28-year old Rudh runs a stationery store (called a bazaar in Ecuador). She lives on the outskirts of Guayaquil, a suburban area where the majority of people have informal businesses.

Rudh’s eldest sister emigrated to another country leaving Rudh to look after her house and the stationery store as a means of supporting the family. Rudh started selling notebooks, pens, and paper to her neighbours and friends. She works from 7am to 9pm every day.

With the loan, she plans to buy a freezer so she can sell cold drinks, as well as more notebooks and pens. Her future plan is to expand the store.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and more stationery

loans.name: Serious Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Serious” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Waterloo, a small town near Freetown. They are seeking a loan of SLL 500,000 for each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Aminata K.. Aminata is age twenty-eight and was born in the village of Lumpa. She is married with one child. Her husband is a driver and her child is a pupil.  Aminata sells slippers, bags for ladies, clothes, etc. She has been a businesswoman for five years now. She will use her share of this loan to buy the above-mentioned items in large quantity to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: Buy slippers, bags for ladies, clothes, etc. in large quantity

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For the purchase of clothing for resale

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: El Señor Mario es cliente nuevo que tiene como actividad  transportista, se dedica al transportista de pasajeros, el vive en la zona de Irpavi alto, la esposa fue una cliente antigua que trabajo con crédito en grupo dentro de la institución sin ningún problema en el pago de sus cuotas,  ambos tienen dos hijas que se encuentran estudiando, pero solo con una vive con ellos  ya que la otra  hija se casó recientemente, el crédito que solicita es para comprar motor para su transporte ya que esta presentando algunas fallas y esto no le permite realizar un buen servicio, es una persona responsable y esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mario is a new client who works as a taxi driver, driving passengers.  He lives in the Irpavi Alto region.  His wife was a former client who worked with a group loan within the organization.  She had no problems in meeting her repayments.  They both have two daughters who are studying but only one of their daughters lives with them since the other recently got married.  The loan which he is requesting is for purchasing an engine for his vehicle since it keeps breaking down which means that he cannot provide a good service.  He is a responsible person and very grateful to the organization for the support it has given him.

loans.use: New engine

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es: El Sr. M. trabaja en una fabrica industrial al igual que su esposa cada quien en diferente turno para poder atender entre los dos una  tienda de abarrotes que tienen en su casa y tener suficiente entrada economica en el hogar para mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia. El negocio va funsionando bien y quieren seguir apliandolo, es por eso que requieren de este prestamo.
texts.en: Mr M. and his wife work in a factory.  Each of them works a different shift so that they can both spend time serving in the grocery store which they have in their home and also so that they have sufficient money coming into the home to improve their family's standard of living.  The business is doing well and they would like to continue expanding it.  This is the reason they are requesting the loan.

loans.use: Investment in his business

loans.name: Shake Hand Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Shake Hand” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Fatmata is the leader of this group. Fatmata is forty-two years old, married with six children – four are in primary school and the other two are no longer attending school. Fatmata  sells cooked rice, meat and vegetables. She has been doing this business for ten years now. With her share of the loan, she will buy cooking ingredients such as rice, tomatoes, palm oil, etc wholesale.

loans.use: Buy cooking ingredients such as rice, tomatoes, palm oil, etc wholesale

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 37 years old and married without any children. Agnes is a businesswoman whose husband does not work, so for that reason she has to work hard in order to provide all that is necessary for her family. Her business is profitable and organized well. Agnes has an experience of three years and the hours of her business are from 6 in the morning to 6 in the evening.

Agnes is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing more foodstuffs. With this loan, Agnes will be able to be more effective and more successful in her business.

loans.use: Purchasing additional foodstuffs

loans.name: Fanny

texts.es:
Fanny vive en la zona 16 de Julio de la ciudad de El Alto, está casada y tiene cuatro hijos de 15,13,11 y 5 años de edad respectivamente. Fanny confecciona almohadas  con el apoyo de su esposo y las comercializa en la feria 16 de julio de la ciudad de El Alto.  Vive en la casa de su madre con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos.
El crédito será utilizado en la compra de telas y otros insumos que requiere para continuar con su negocio, el cual aprendió de su madre.

 Es el segundo crédito con IMPRO y el primer via Kiva.
texts.en:
Fanny lives in the 16 de Julio area of the city of El Alto. She is married and has four children who are 15, 13, 11, and 5, respectively. She and her family live in her mother’s house. Fanny makes pillows with the help of her husband and sells them at the 16 de Julio market in the city of El Alto.

The loan will be used for the purchase of fabrics and other supplies that she needs to continue with her business, a trade that she learned from her mother. This is her second loan from IMPRO and first through Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and other supplies for her pillow making business.

loans.name: José Agapito

texts.es:
José D. 33 años, el recorre las calles en un triciclo vendiendo pescados, vive con su esposa y dos hijos en el Suburbio D. Guayaquil(zona urbana, L. mayoría D. habitantes son comerciantes informales). 

José viene D. una familia D. pescadores, su papa lo aprendió D. su abuelo y el D. su padre. Al el casarse continuo con el negocio familiar pescando y vendiendo mariscos en diferentes lugares. Trabaja desD. las 06h00am hasta las 13h00pm todos los días  recorriendo las calles del suburbio en un triciclo y pescados.  

El espera en el futuro tener su propio local D. mariscos, pero por ahora quiere comprar con el préstamo cemento, bloques, pintura para readecuar su casa y asi darle una mejor vida a sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
José is 33 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the suburb of Guayaquil (an urban area where the majority of the residents are informal merchants). He goes through the streets on a tricycle selling fish.

José comes from a family of fishermen – his father learned from his grandfather, who learned from his father. When he got married, he continued with the family business, fishing and selling seafood at different places. He works every day from 6am to 1pm going through the streets on a tricycle with fish.

In the future, he hopes to have his own seafood place. However, for now, he wants to use the loan to buy cement, blocks and paint to do housing improvements and that way, proviD. a better life for his two children.

loans.use: Cement, blocks, paint

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La Sra. R. R. Celia vive con sus tres hijos, cuenta con casa propia.
Tiene buenas referencias personales y laborales.
Se dedica a la venta de cerdos hace mas de 10 años y requiere del préstamo para incrementar su negocio y realizar mantenimiento a sus unidades de transporte (mototaxi).
Es una persona muy trabajadora y desea invertir en el negocio para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus menores hijos.
texts.en:
Celia lives with her three children and has her own house. She has worked selling pigs for more than 10 years and needs the loan to expand her business and to service her transport vehicles (moto taxi).

She has good personal and professional references, and is a very hardworking person. She wants to invest in the business to provide a better quality of life for her young children.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: El Sr. Jaime,  vive en la ciudad de la Paz, en la zona de Tembladerani, la casa donde vive es del Papa de su esposa donde cuenta con dos ambientes que son sus dormitorios, cuenta con una sala comedor y una cocina.  Tiene dos hijos a los cuales aun mantiene ya que aun están estudiando en primaria,  don Jaime es de profesión chofer con una experiencia de 20 años en su actividad, el trabaja todos los días a excepción de los días miércoles día en que se dedica a su familia. Su esposa aporta también en la economía familiar vendiendo ropa en un puesto ubicado por el centro solo por la noche. El crédito será destinado al equipamiento de accesorios y mantenimiento del vehículo, para así poder brindar un mejor servicio.
texts.en: Jaime lives in the Tembladerani área of the city of La Paz.  The house where he lives belongs to his wife’s father where he has two bedrooms, a dining room, and a kitchen.  He has two children who he still supports since they are still in elementary school.  Jaime is a driver and has 20 years of experience in the business.  He works every day except Wednesday, which he dedicates to his family.  His wife also contributes to the family finances, selling clothing at a place in the center only at night.  The loan will be used for accessories and service for the vehicle so that he can provide better service.

loans.use: To buy accessories and to service his car

loans.name: Cesar Galo

texts.es:
Cesar de 45 años, es vendedor de libros y revistas. Vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas). 

Una amiga de la familia de Cesar le sugirió que para tener mejores ingresos vendiera revistas y libros universitarios, cuando reunió el capital suficiente compro libros y revista para vender. En la actualidad vende desde las 08h00am hasta las 18h00pm todos los días recorriendo las diferentes calles y vendiendo a sus conocidos y amigos. Por ahora tiene una cartea de 150 clientes que le compran libros en un precio aproximado de $50.00 en adelante. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar libros de todas las clasificaciones para que sus clientes tengan mas variedad al comprar. En el futuro quiere ser supervisor de liderar un grupo de vendedores de libros.
texts.en:
Cesar is 45 years old, a bookseller, and lives in Las Orquídeas in Guayaquil (an urban area called Las Orquídeas – the orchids – because there were a lot of orchid flowers when it was discovered).

A friend of Cesar’s family suggested to him that to earn more, he should sell magazines and university textbooks.  When he gathered the sufficient funds, he bought books and magazines to sell.  He currently sells every day from 8am to 6pm, traveling the streets and selling to his acquaintances and friends.  Now, he has a client list of 150 that buy his books at approximately $50.00 and up.

With the loan, he wants to buy all types of books so that his customers have more variety when they buy.  In the future, he wants to be leading supervisor of a group of book salesmen.

loans.use: Textbooks and magazines

loans.name: Emerthe

texts.en:
Emerthe is 31 years old and married with four children aged between 2 and 8 years old. Emerthe is a businesswoman and her husband does not work. She owns a business selling various style of clothes in the local market. She has been selling clothes for 4 years and works from 8am to 6pm during the week. 

Emerthe is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing more bales of clothing which will allow her to sell various styles of clothes. With the profits from her business she hopes to pay for school fees for her children.

loans.use: Purchasing more bales of clothes

loans.name: Mr. Efrain

texts.es: El Sr. Efraín es una persona joven que se dedica a vender diferentes productos a crédito, viaja de la cuidad de la Paz a Cochabamba donde reparte sus productos principalmente en oficinas. El vive en junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos de los cuales el mayor que ya es bachiller comenzó a dedicarse a la música en un grupo musical. Efraín y su familia viven en la zona de alto Pampahasi que se encuentra a 30 minutos del centro de la cuidad. La esposa del Sr. Efrain, La Sra. Carmen, se dedica también a la venta de productos varios a crédito pero solamente en la ciudad de la Paz. Efraín solicita el préstamo para poder ayudar a su hijo a comprar un teclado eléctrico para que toque en su grupo. Ellos esperan poder ayudar a sus hijos para verlos como personas realizadas, con trabajos independientes. Y como familia esperan poder ahorrar lo suficiente para así poder comprar una casa propia.
texts.en:
Mr. Efraín is a young person who works selling goods on credit. He travels from the city of La Paz to Cochabamba where  he distributes his products mainly in offices. He lives with his wife and their three children, the oldest of whom is in college and has decided to pursue music in a band. Mr. Efraín and his family live in the area of high Pampahasi which is located 30 minutes from the center of town. Mr. Efraín’s wife, Carmen, also works selling various goods on credit but only in La Paz. 

Mr. Efraín requests a loan in order to help his son buy an electric keyboard for him to play in his band. Mr. and Mrs. Efraín hope to help their children become accomplished people with their own jobs. As a family, they hope to save enough money to buy a home.

loans.use: Purchase an electric keyboard

loans.name: Catalina De Lourdes

texts.es:
Catalina de 58 años, es vendedora de artículos y bisutería en un puesto. Vive con su esposo y tres hijos en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas). 

Comenzó hace varios años con su negocio vendiendo bisutería hasta que pudo conseguir en el municipio de Guayaquil un puesto en la calle para vender sus artículos y bisutería. Trabaja desde las 08h30am hasta las 18h30pm todos los días vendiéndole a las personas que caminan por la calle donde esta ubicado su puesto. Vende revistas, bisutería, periódico, dulces, blusas etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar blusas para diversificar un poco la mercadería que vende. En el futuro quiere seguir trabajando para seguir ayudando a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Catalina is 58 years old.  She sells goods and costume jewelry from a stall.  She lives with her husband and three children in Orquídeas de Guayaquil (an urban area which is called 'Las Orquídeas' – 'Orchids' because when it was discovered there were many orchids there).

She started her business several years ago selling costume jewelry until she could manage to get a street stall in the town of Guayaquil to sell her goods and jewelry.  She works from 8.30am to 6.30pm every day selling to people who pass by her stall in the street.  She sells magazines, jewelry, newspapers, sweets, blouses, etc.

With her loan she would like to purchase blouses to diversify the goods which she sells a little.  In the future, she would like to continue working in order to continue helping her children.

loans.use: To purchase blouses

loans.name: Fight Poverty Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Fight for Poverty” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Waterloo near Freetown.  They are requesting a loan of SLL 500,000 for each to enable them to further improve the size and quality of their respective businesses.

Pictured on the left (first row) is Dauda K. who is the leader of this group. Dauda was born in Waterloo, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with SMT to start a branch. The thirty-year-old is married and has three children.
 
Dauda sells charcoal, firewood, 'gari'  (quick cooking food made out of cassava roots), etc. He has had ten years of experience in business. With his share of the loan, Dauda will buy charcoal, firewood, 'gari', etc. in large quantity.

loans.use: Buy charcoal, firewood, 'gari', etc. in large quantity

loans.name: Editha

texts.es: La Sra. Editha  vive en el barrio San Antonio   D. la zona del plan 3000, es casa propia donD. vive al lado D. su esposo y D. sus tres hijos, su esposo trabaja como supervisor en una empresa D. seguridad y la Sra. Editha tiene su taller D. costura en su propia casa, el crédito que esta solicitando es para comprar otra maquina D. costura porque en estos meses va a tener mucha demanda D. trabajo ya que comienzan las promociones D. los kínder y D. los colegios y esta temporada la Sra. Tiene bastante trabajo,  La Sra. Editha es proactiva y cuenta con el apoyo D. una D. sus hijas que le ayuda después que regresa del colegio, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Editha lives in the San Antonio neighborhood of Plan 3000 region.  She lives in her own home with her husband and her three children.  Her husband works as a supervisor in a security company and Editha has a sewing workshop in her own home.  The loan which she is requesting is for purchasing another sewing machine because she has a lot of demand in her work right now as the kindergarten and school sales promotions are beginning and this season Edith has a lot of work.  Edith is a proactive woman and has the support of one of her daughters who helps her when she gets home from school.  She is very grateful to the organization for the support which it has given her.

loans.use: Working capital, purchase of a sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve the front of his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Build a fence in front of home

loans.name: Cruz Alexandra

texts.es:
Cruz de 47 años, vende almuezos a $ 1.50 c/u. Vive en el Suburbio de Guayaquil(zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales). 

Para ayudar con los gastos familiares ella empezó a hacer mucha comida en la cocina de su casa.  Ya tiene un año y medio vendiendo almuerzos, cada almuerzo lo vende a $ 1.50 sea cual sea el plato que venda. Tiene deferentes comidas que hace como sopas, y los segundo arroz con pollo, guatita, estofado de pollo etc. Con el préstamo quiere comprar víveres para hacer comida como arroz, bebidas y otra parte comprar cemento y pintura para readecuar el local. 

En el futuro quiere tener un restaurante bien adecuado que cumpla con las expectativas de sus clientes. Y que su familia este bien económicamente.
texts.en:
Cruz, 47, sells lunches for $1.50. She lives in the suburbs of Guayaquil (city outskirts, where most people are street vendors). 

In order to help with family expenses, she began making food in her kitchen. She has already been selling lunches for a year and a half. She sells each lunch for $1.50 a dish. She offers different foods such as soup, and second courses such as chicken and rice, guatita (a tripe stew), braised chicken, etc. With this loan, Cruz will buy groceries to provide food such as rice and drinks. She will also buy cement and paint to spruce up the premises. 

In the future, Cruz wants to have a restaurant well-suited to meet the expectations of her customers. She also wants her family to be well financially.

loans.use: Purchase rice, drinks, cement

loans.name: Damaris

texts.es: L. Señora Damaris  usara su credito para abrir un nuevo restaurant y asi mejorar su ingreso para poder construir su propia casa y ayudar a su familia ya que les daria empleo en el negocio y podra atender a sus clientes mejor ya que ellos fueron los que L. animaron a abrir L. sucursal po r que L. sra. Damaris solo abria los fines D. semana por L. mañana y L. nueva sucursal estaria abierta toda L. semana y el fin D. semana por L. tarD.  y ademas podria poner aparte D. L. venta D. comida L. venta D. ropa L. sra. Damaris es una parsona muy trabajadora y dice que su esposo L. apoya en todo por eso juntos tienen toda L. confianza D. que saldran adelante.
texts.en: Damaris will use her loan to open a new restaurant and thereby improve her income.  This will enable her to build her own home and help her family since she will give them work in the business.  She will also be able to better serve her customers.  It was her customers who encouraged her to open the establishment as Damaris only used to open weekend mornings but the new establishment will be open every weekday and weekend afternoons.  In addition to selling food, she also sells women's clothing.  Damaris is a very hard-working woman and says that her husband supports her in everything.  Together they are confident that they will get ahead.

loans.use: Investment in home-made meals business

loans.name: Benicio

texts.es: El Sr. Benicio   vive en el barrio San Antonio de la zona del plan 3000, vive en la casa de sus suegros, tienen un hijo, su esposa trabaja en el mercado como encargada de ventas en una ferretería, el señor Benicio tiene un foto estudio en un calle muy populosa de la zona, el tiene una computadora y dos impresoras con las que realiza su trabajo, el crédito que esta solicitando es para comprar una impresora mas apta para el foto estudio y un escáner. El señor Benicio con el apoyo de su esposa se esfuerza para salir adelante, es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Benicio lives in the San Antonio neighborhood of Plan 3000 region.  He lives in his in-laws' house.  He has one child.  His wife works in the market where she is in charge of sales at a hardware stall.  Benicio has a photo studio in a very busy street in the area.  He has a computer and two printers on which he does his work.  He is requesting a loan to purchase a better printer for his photo studio and a scanner.  Benicio, with the support of his wife, works hard every day to get ahead.  He is a very responsible and hard-working person.  He is very grateful to the organization for the support which it has given him.

loans.use: A printer for his photo studio and a scanner

loans.name: Brenda Rocio

texts.es: La sra. Brenda Rocio utilisara su credito en la apertura de una tienda de abarrotes ya que ella es madre soltera y sus hijos estan pequeños por lo cual ella no desea separarse de ellos y ve en la apertura de la tienda la solucion ya que estaria en su casa y al pendiente de sus hijos y a la  vez generaria un ingreso mas ya que ella vende platillos los fines de semana y los prepara en su domicilio y ella es muy conocida  y apreciada en su colonia y por la ubicación de su casa ella piensa que es lo que en su sector se necesita ya que las tiendas estan muy retiradas de donde ella vive por  lo tanto cree que es la mejor opcion.
texts.en: Ms. Brenda Rocio would use the loan to open a grocery store. Since she is a single mother with young children, she does not want work to separate her from them.  The grocery store would be the solution, as it would allow her to be home to watch her children and earn an income in addition to the meals she sells on the weekends.  She also prepares meals for home delivery and is well known and appreciated in her neighborhood.  Due to the location of her home, she thinks an in-home store would be needed as the other stores are too far removed from where she lives, therefore her store would be the best option.

loans.use: Purchase groceries to stock a store

loans.name: Rolando Javier

texts.es: El Sr.Rolando S. es un hombre muy trabajador lleva 16 años laborando en la empresa de servicios electricos empezo como ayudante y ahora tecnico en la empresa su jefe lo aprecia mucho y lo recomienda ampliamente argumento que ha base de esfuerzo y dedicacion a conseguido lo que actualmente tiene. El requiere el credito para ampliar su vivienda desea hacer su sala y recibidos mas grande para comodidad de el y de su familia siempre se ha comprometida con ella y quiere lo mejor mejorando su patrimonio que es lo que el le puede dejar.
texts.en: Mr Ronaldo S. is a very hard-working man.  He has worked as an assistant in an electric utility company for 16 years and now he is a technician in the company.  His boss values him very much and recommends him to everybody.  He argues that through effort and dedication he has obtained all that he currently has.  He needs this loan to extend his home.  He wants to make his living room and entrance hall bigger for his family's comfort as he has always promised to do.  He wants to improve his estate as it is what he can leave his family.

loans.use: To extend the front of his house, building a room

loans.name: Akossiwa E.

texts.fr: Akossiwa est une femme mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle vit dans le quartier de Nukafu avec son époux et ses enfants. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente de tissus bazins. Elle fait son commerce de façon ambulante pour toucher plus de personne. Le crédit qu’elle sollicite va lui servir à acheter 30 tissus bazins de différentes qualités pour satisfaire les besoins de ses clients.
texts.en:
Akossiwa is a married woman and mother of two children. She lives in the neighborhood of Nukafu with her spouse and her children. Her income generating business is the sale of damask cloth. She practices her activity from place to place in order to reach more people.

The loan she is requesting will allow her to buy 30 pieces of damask cloth of various quality to meet her customers’ demand.

loans.use: Purchase of damask cloth

loans.name: Mercedes Yadira

texts.es:
Mercedes de 34 años, ella vende productos de uso personal como cosméticos por catalogo de marca Avon ( empresa que ayuda a mujeres emprendedoras a vender cosméticos a un bajo costo), ella vive en el Suburbio de Guayaquil(zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales). 

Ella inicio con las ventas de cosméticos Avon para tener ingresos ya que su esposo la abandono con sus tres hijos y también dales una mejor vida a sus hijos que estudian en escuelas fiscales. Vende maquillaje, perfumes, cremas, desodorantes a un bajo costo por catalogo. Vende los productos a sus conocidos y vecinos. 

Para incrementar su mercadería ella quiere comprar con el préstamo perfumes, maquillaje, cremas para su negocio. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa, y tener un local de los productos Avon.
texts.en:
Mercedes, age 34, sells personal care products and cosmetics by catalog that are manufactured by Avon (a company that helps women entrepreneurs sell cosmetics at a low cost). She lives in Surburbio de Guayaquil, an urban area where most of the residents are informal merchants.

Mercedes began selling Avon cosmetics to generate income because her husband abandoned her and their three children. She wants to give her children a good life and provide for their public school education. Mercedes sells makeup, perfumes, crémes, and deodorants by catalog at low cost. She sells these products to acquaintances and neighbors.

In order to increase her inventory, Mercedes will use this loan to buy perfumes, makeup, and crémes for her business. In the future, she hopes to finish the construction of her house and open a store where she can sell Avon products.

loans.use: Purchase perfumes, makeup, and crémes

loans.name: Tamemsu Traders Group

texts.en:
Aminata K. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Born in Kambia town, in northern Sierra Leone, Aminata is married and has five children who are attending secondary school.  For thirty years now, Aminata has been selling cooked food. She will use her share of the loan (SLL 600,000) to expand her business. She will buy palm oil (the country’s favorite cooking oil), rice, onions, and other cooking ingredients in large quantity. In this way, Aminata will no longer be buying these items retail, thereby saving her a lot of cash. 

This is not the first loan that Aminata and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of their previous loan, they were able to expand their businesses, made more sales and consequently improved their living conditions.

loans.use: Buy palm oil, rice, onions, and other cooking ingredients in large quantity
